description:
Lush Lounge is arguably my favorite watering hole in San Francisco. From the first moment I walked in, I was greeted by such a friendly energy from both the bartender and regulars that it felt like I had known them my whole life. I quickly made friends that I still have to this day (4 years later) and some of the greatest experiences of my adult life have transpired there.

One of the best things about Lush is that it takes on a whole new feel after about 8:30pm. The day shift feels like a neighborhood bar with chill music, nice regulars, and friendly bartender. While I spent most of my time there between 3 and 730pm, I occasionaly popped in at 10 or 11pm to find the place bumping with great music and plenty of young singles having a great time. 

If you are looking for a fun place to either wind down or crank it up, Lush is for you!
author: Travelling G.

description:
Came to Lush because they were part of the 90s Bar Crawl. Raspberry lemon drop shots all around. The shot was alright, but it was warm; it would have been much better had it been strained through ice.

Bartender was friendly. Loved the decor. Plenty of seats both downstairs and upstairs. Not a good place to dance, but if you're looking to just chill, Lush Lounge is for you. Bathrooms were very clean.
author: Cindy C.

description: Lush Lounge was probably the most "normal" bar of the Bachelor Party pub crawl.  Not too crowded.  Warm, hipster, and casual environment.  Music in the background,but at the perfect volume so that you can still talk and hear each other.  Drinks are surprisingly affordable for San Francisco....beers available as low as $6 and wells drinks as low as $8.  Not the most exciting place to be on a Saturday night, but you won't be disappointed either.  Probably a great spot for your first Tinder date on a week night.
author: Chun P.

description:
Actually one of of my favorite bars on Polk street. Also usually the very first bar I go to because of their affordable drinks, good vibes, and chill environment. I remember the first time I came here with 5 other people on a Friday night and it wasn't too crowded nor was it too empty. We ordered 6 tequila shots and I think it was about $5 a shot! Pretty decent place to start your night  with that kind of price! We also got a free cocktails/mixed drinks which were pretty unique and good too! Didn't pay a cover fee and there were restrooms conveniently in the back. One of the cocktails I had was the mojito. Didn't taste like it had too much alcohol in it and a tad bit diluted with too much ice but a good drink to sip on while chilling with friends. 

They have quite a few seats upstairs and and open area on the bottom floor to just chill/possibly dance. 

Overall great place and I will always recommend this place for a person starting their night at Polk street!
author: Amy L.

description: The bartender was really sweet !! First time coming here I'll definitely come here again !!!
author: Emigdia V.

description: A great place to grab a drink and chat with friends. The drinks were well made and reasonably priced and it has a great energy to the place.
author: Mariah C.

description:
One of my friend invited us to this bar, pretty impressive. Very classy and trendy decor. 

They have a second floor overlooking the bar. Great ambience.
author: Aditya C.

description:
Don't go in when the boys aren't here. 
Lousy woman bartender. Not helpful at all. The place is empty rn and first she told me to basically get on my knees (which at times I'm not opposed to) to plug in my charger for my phone. What she doesn't know is, that I'm a regular here. The boys would never do that to me and my group of friends who are also regulars. Then I asked if I could change the music by putting money in the jukebox. (Very lousy depressing music) she said yea. She just had to pause her side of things. 
She saw me trying to shove money into the jukebox while I wait for my friends. 
No go on the music.
I want to slurp up my drink and get the heck out of here rn. And come back when Ian, Jack or/and Kevin are here...
Sigh...
author: Laura Y. P.

description:
This place is great and the bar staff, Lyndsay in particular, is attentive and gregarious. I've been a patron at the place for years now and, once every blue moon, you'll have some entitled folk stagger in inebriated and harsh everyone's mellow.

This was the case this past Sunday, 3/4, when a gaggle of twenty-somethings decided to imbibe more alcohol than their fragile little bodies could tolerate. I knew things were going left when this group started shattering more glasses than a couple at a Jewish wedding and one of the blokes in the group kept nodding off like a heroin addicted jazz musician. Lyndsay kindly asked them to leave as they'd had their fill of "potent potables", a request the group verbally protested with unsavory language. Ultimately, the group called the police because one of the members allegedly misplaced her identification and accused Lyndsay, the bartender, of holding it hostage. The knackered clique phoned the police, who showed up a few hours later and didn't give the kids the resolution they'd expected.

Lush Lounge is a great spot if you're looking for a good cocktail and a place to meet friendly people. If you're a self absorbed booger, go to Vertigo or something ‍
author: Rodney P.

description: A nicer bar/lounge in the area. Very chill and spacious. I felt like this would be a better and nicer bar to kick it with friends. Most likely would be back next time and highly recommend! If you where to only go to one bar to drink, this would be it, super chill place! I felt like this place looked pretty classy and I loved the fireplace, so cozy! I've to try the watermelon shooters next time.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Happy hour has good pricing but the Old Fashioned that I ordered tasted a little off. My coworker had a Mojito but they put coconut flavored liquor in it and she wasn't too impressed with that. I would definitely come back and try something different. I like the look of the place. I just need to try something else maybe.
author: Kat D.

description:
All Day Happy Hour. Not sure if it it's everyday. 
Nice Decor very eclectic. Not too pricey. They have a little upstairs area a fireplace area and good music. 

Bar Crawlers this is a  Must STOP. Only going to one Bar  you gotta consider this place.
author: Joseph E.

description: Great ambiance and great list of well priced fancy cocktails. They have a fireplace and an upstairs, so plenty of seating.
author: Eray B.

description: Came here for happy hour and enjoyed the vibes. Had football and basketball games on as well as comfortable couches, bar tables, and bar top. Crowd was lively and enjoyable for a Sunday evening. We will be back.
author: Megan M.

description:
watermelon shooters ($3): reminds me of soju. It can creep up on you easily

+bathrooms: 1 stall for each men and women, shared sinks for men and women
+upstairs space available
+fireplace near bar
author: Telena V.

description:
Great little bar just would have been nicer to have better service. Bartender seemed like he couldn't be bothered.

Ordered a couple of drinks and he seemed annoyed that we wanted to try a taste of a beer.
author: Jeremiah B.

description:
One of the cleanest bars in the area, but the vibe here was absent - don't know what it was. 

It also wasn't very packed at 1 o'clock which is never a good sign. However, it's a more spacious bar, so that might be why. There's a down and upstairs which would be great for large groups. 

Try a few other bars before stopping here. The music is decent.
author: Becca S.

description:
What a great find on Polk street! Their service here is great and the drinks here are on par! Stoli gimlets and picklebacks were the popular hit for the night. 

Lush Lounge is a nice intimate spot that you can cozy up with your date or you can even get turnt up with the other patrons. A pure gem on Polk Street, I can't wait to be back.
author: Linette F.

description: We were here for 2 nights visiting from LA. Came here both nights. Ian is the best bartender ever. We love him. Highly recommend. Super chill vibe. Reasonably priced drinks. Definitely go if Ian is working!!!
author: Molly A.

description: The place has some interesting mixed drinks. It was busy or noisy at all since it was I went on a Friday night.
author: Grey W.

description: I like it. Love the open window. Good happy hour prices and any time I've been here, there is a nice crowd
author: Nicola M.

description: Old people. Don't drink the raspberry lemon drop, it literally taste like cough syrup
author: Sarah L.

description: Loved this place Brian the bartender was awesome. He gave us great service and was awesome conversation. The bar itself is super cute on the inside. It wasn't packed when we first arrived but by the time we left it was packed. The upstairs portion was being rented out so that's great to knowvif you need an awesome venue for a party. Go in and ask for Ian at lush lounge.
author: Ana M.

description: Great place to chill with friends. Great drinks at a fair price and casual atmosphere.Love the set up, open window, nice fireplace, barrel tables etc. and it's close to home. Nicer bar in this area of Polk st. Fun especially Thursday, Friday and Saturday. It's GoodtimeS for sure.
author: Pete S.

description: Hate to give them one star. Had a fantastic night, everything was great, till a drunk bouncer tried to fight me. Why? Cause I held the bathroom door shut when he wanted to walk in on some ladies. Very unprofessional, had he been sober, he would have understood the situation. I worked security at clubs for years. This guy has no business in any position of authority in any establishment. He tried to escalate the situation several times, so bad that random patrons stepped between us, while telling him he was in the wrong. Management, feel free to contact me, and I will identify the culprit.
author: Andre P.

description: Solid spot to go to start off the night, if you are out on a non-Friday or weekend. Strong drinks, catch some of the Dubs game, and music can be hit or miss (depending on your taste) and mostly background (which i don't mind) while catching up with friends or coworkers. On a Friday or Saturday it is definitely more packed and better/louder music than during the week. If i hit this place up on a Friday or Saturday, I can have a good enough time to stay til closing...or until i need a place with a dance floor.
author: Kat C.

description:
Came here with a couple of friends on a Saturday evening and truly had a blast!

Ok...SO its not in the BEST area in San Francisco but it is right in the middle of GOOD food and more bars...What more can you ask for?

Happy hour was till 7PM and the drinks were AMAZING! I think that was really what attracted everyone to this lounge was Happy Hour. I liked that they have a top seating area as well! How nice, I definitely plan to use that the next time I come. All the workers were very nice and pleasant. 

Didn't have to worry about loud music or anything like that. This was literally a LOUNGE! I loved it!

Bathrooms were nice and clean! A+ FOR THAT. Please note, ATM is near the door! 

This is a great bar to come to and get the night started because there is SO much more around the area. Food and more bar hopping!
author: Porsche C.

description: What an honor--to visit a place named after oneself! ;-) Hehe, the Lush Lounge is a cool spot for a drink and conversation. I tried the raspberry champagne drink and fell in love, at least for the night! I'll be back soon!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: The absolute worst service I've ever had in my life. NEVER GO HERE. We were kicked out of the bar because my friend who was visiting from out of town was nodding off because he was jet lagged and because of that, we were physically kicked out of the bar.  Also, my other friend was sexually harassed by the fellow customers and nothing was done. This is a horrible place. Terrible service.
author: Sasha D.

description: Pretty fun place on Polk. Honestly, I was pretty drunk when i was here, but definitely had a good time. Would recommend to add to your bar hopping list next time you are on Polk!
author: Ross S.

description: Came on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty. The music was decent and the drinks were strong. We got lucky and got a table for a big group. When it was almost time to close they got really pushy about leaving our drinks so they could clean up and kicked us out. Totally get that you have to shut down by 2 but it was a little rude especially if we were waiting for friends to get back from the bar/bathroom before leaving.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
#89
I recently met several friends here for a little get-together.  Fun times!  I walked in and found my group nestled in a front area in the window.  This large window opened to Polk Street where the people watching was amazing, and the cool San Francisco breeze was whisping on our faces.

As I approached the table, I noticed everyone was drinking these wonderfully pretty blueberry drinks.  I guess they are the house special.  Special they were, as someone dropped a glass and broke it on the table top.  

We had a great time talking and hanging out in the wonderfully comfy and friendly space.  The employees were attentive and helpful and the atmosphere was very inviting.

Stephani Smiles for Lush Lounge ;)
author: Stephani M.

description: Stopped in for a quick drink with a friend because most of the bars don't open until 5 and it was only 4.  Had a nice table in the front that still caught some sun early in the day but the place still had about 20 people in there.  All different types of people in there which I am a big fan of.  Had one draft beer for $6 and the rest of the happy hour menu was solid.  Both bartenders were super nice and friendly, the guy was the owner and the girl was gorgeous.  You could tell they cared about what they were doing.  We left after  one drink but it was starting to fill up.  There was small upstairs that overlooked the bar from the back and good large open windows in the front.  I'd go back again and stay longer.
author: Scott M.

description: Wish I could give a zero.  Spent the entire night buying drinks at this place, leave momentarily to walk a friend outside, 30 minutes before bar close I am not allowed to quickly use the restroom prior to getting in my Lyft.  Sober and respectful, currently standing on the corner watching them serve other customers through the window. Okay drinks, rude employees, plenty of other bars to go to.
author: Brittney S.

description: Came with a group of six and reserved a table. One person in our party was injured and couldn't stand for long period of time so we thought it would be perfect since we had a table! We arrived and apparently they weren't opening the tables up that night......uhhhhhh okayyyyy....if I'd had know I would have made plans to go elsewhere.
author: AnDrea I.

description: On September 3rd at around 7:30pm, there was a group of 25 of us celebrating a friend's birthday at your establishment. I am a 27 year resident of this city, have spent my fair share of time on Polk Street, but had never been here. It was very hot inside due to the heat, and I was drinking a ginger-ale that I had purchased at the bar. I stepped outside on to Polk Street for some fresh air and was leaning into the large open window talking to my friends when one of your bartenders aggressively surprised me and grabbed my glass. In a ridiculously harsh manner, she directed me back into the bar telling me that no drinking or smoking was allowed on the street in front of that window. Her tone was unnecessarily tough and escalated, and she was combative and ready for an argument. I was really surprised by how aggressive she came at me. For my part, I am always very happy to be told when there are rules, and when politely told, I'll do my best to abide by them. But, the right way to do this is to say "Excuse me sir, not sure if you're aware, but there's a rule here... can you please take your drink inside..." This is NOT what happened. Flustered, I went up to the bar to try and explain to her why her behavior towards a paying customer was wrong and inappropriate. She clearly had some fantasy about how she had handled the interaction, insisting to me that she had used words like "please" and "excuse me." She verbally mocked me multiple times, bordered on homophobic when mimicking my mannerisms, and then quickly realized that I was extremely angry at this and then became a cold face automaton as her way of dealing with the situation. Some one needs to train this particular bartender on how to deal with diverse customers, and some one needs to explain to her that there are hundreds of places where we can spend our money in SF. Yes, Polk Street is a challenging street. Yes, we're in a heatwave. But, those of us who choose be consumers in San Francisco and participate in public life should not be subjected to thoughtless, aggressive people like the one I encountered yesterday evening working at this establishment. I have rarely had such a rude, unwelcoming experience in this usually very warm and friendly city. I left your establishment very upset, and I will not return.
author: Marc S.

description: Good drinks, good music is playing, but kind of dead on a labor day weekend. Go any of the bars to the right and they are packed. This place really didn't have a strong vibe or sense or party atmosphere. Not always bad, got to talk with friends; but, when you want to party, it was kind of a let down
author: Andrew M.

description:
Lush and I go back a ways when my friend Carlos used to take me to the old, more compact location down the street to get the Lemon Drops. He liked chatting it up with one of the bartenders while we both got sloshed. I know from taking the 19 all the time that Lush moved up Polk to bigger digs with a fireplace and an upstairs area. It's like an episode of "House Hunters" where the bickering young couple is staying with her parents in her girlhood room as they shop for a house with four walk-in closets and twin sinks in the master suite. Well, Lush obviously found their true north with this far more relaxing industrial-cool spot (photo: http://bit.ly/1eQXwYo). I came with Jamie W. this time before doing our regular pastrami run at Miller's East Coast Deli.

It was a holiday weekend, so we figured the popular bars would be empty. Wanting to wet our whistles, I flashed back to the good times I had at the old Lush and was happy to discover the new place keeps the same convivial vibe. Oh wait, maybe I was the old lush, but I can be the new lush, too, right? It was Happy Hour, and we were already late since it starts at 3PM. The Lemon Drop wasn't on the list, but other temptations compensated. Jamie went for the tantalizing $6 Don Q Mojito evoking Havana nights he's never had (photo: http://bit.ly/1c2wmxL). I went predictable and ordered the $5 Blueberry Martini (photo: http://bit.ly/1bLfVvs). Ah, their fruity martini cocktails are still addictively tasty. Yes, we had another round. And that pastrami sure tasted good after that.

COCKTAILS - 4 stars...they still make those refreshing martini drinks, don't they?
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...far more spacious than the former spot with enough dim lighting that you don't notice the hipster quotient...much
SERVICE - 4 stars...genuinely friendly and dexterous with a shaker (photo: http://bit.ly/1e6V4Nj)
TOTAL - 4 stars...still holds up as a favorite watering hole with the $5-6 Happy Hour libations a major draw on quiet three-day weekends
author: Ed U.

description: No double IPAS and very muggy for a hot night as the air seems to get trapped. Music wasn't bad.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Third stop on our bar hopping adventure. 

We decided to check out Lush because they had a sign outside offering $3 or $4 (I cant remember the price) watermelon shooters... DON'T DO IT! Those shooters were nasty =______=
author: Ariana M.

description: Great bar! Pretty much always popping, drink specials are cheap and surprisingly delicious. Bartenders were all awesome, really tried to serve everyone as fast as possible, and the decorations were great. Would recommend!
author: Sam R.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night with absolutely no expectations and I was pleasantly surprised by Lush Lounge. 

The ambiance is great. The lighting is dimmed, the music light, and the decor fits the vibe of this bar. The bartenders are all friendly and easily mixed my drink for me so that it wouldn't taste too strongly of alcohol. 

They have a happy hour menu from 5-7pm but if you're interested in margaritas they sure sold me one for a whopping $6! If that's not a deal then I don't know what is!
author: Alizen R.

description: Decided to bar hop on Polk St. and ended at Lush Lounge. This spot is cool the bartenders were friendly and they have a good selection of beers. Definitely will be back for another function. The music selection was good too!
author: Lex J.

description: The taste of Long Island is so awesome! $14 is the reasonable price.  I got 2 tonight!  I like the atmosphere, not too crowded on Thursday night! Good for hanging out with friends or doing birthday celebration which was I'd done it last time for my friend's birthday. I'll def be coming back here again.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Was here for a drink with a night out with friends.
It was a nice place and we were able to get seating which is always nice!

We got some fruity drinks and there is a large selection so that was nice to see! Definitely would come here for happy hour if I worked closer to it. It definitely gets busy on friday/saturday nights as it was when we were there, but the music was great and it was a cool place to be at the time.

would definitely go back!
author: Bori B.

description: Very cool bar on the street. The drinks are good, tried the recommend blue berry martini, average. Not sure why other reviewers were so amazed by it. Bar attendee was nice and friendly, you can ask him to make any drinks. Good atmosphere!
author: Wenting Z.

description: No food on the menu though you can bring your own. Nice, chill spot if you want to avoid the crowd
author: B C.

description: One of my friends invited us to this bar and it was a great experience. Very classy and trendy decor. Great selection of drinks, my favorite are watermelon shots. There is a plenty of space and seating. This became one of my favorites on Polk street.
author: Dimitry K.

description:
I enjoyed the music here, but holy shit it's super louuuud so prepare for that kind of vibe. The drinks are REALLY cheap, but it's CA$H only.

It's like stupid crowded with no ventilation and I want to say 40% of the crowd is RATCHET, another 40% is douche-baggy, and the remaining 20% is just trying to get through the ratchet and douche-bag crowd without getting harassed.
author: Elysse P.

description: This place was a little too hipster and overpriced for me. The sommelier seemed to know what they were doing but I missed the basic and a wider selection.
author: Laura B.

description: We love going to the place. Their drinks are delicious and their bartenders are attentive and know what they are doing, you'll always get your drinks within a few minutes even when they are slammed. What we didn't like is  on NYE one of their bouncers grabbing our friend who had a bit too much to drink and laid down on the benches along the window and almost shaking him to sit up. He said he's told him not to lay down before (which we didn't hear or see him near but even if that was the case there was no need to be this rough with a drunk person who was sleeping after we told him to lay down and wait til we finish our drinks). Had the bouncer told us to wake him up and take him outside we would've been happy to comply. Instead the man got nasty and started yelling at me and calling names. Not cool
author: Viktoriya S.

description: Lit! Lit! Lit! The drinks at this place were amazing when visiting San Fran a few weeks ago. I don't recall the bartenders name but she was super cool and amazing attentive. That BLUEBERRY MARTINI THOUGH, it was everything. Happy hour prices can't be beat, needless to say by the end of the night my friend and I were done. I will definitely be back
author: Diane J.

description:
If Lush Lounge were located somewhere other than Polk St. I probably would have had a blast.

But as it isn't, here's a quick list of its pros & cons:

Pro
-Part of the infamous Polk St. Bar Crawl
-A ton of people!
-Great ambiance and music.
-Amazing cocktails. Try their Gimlet.

Cons
-Part of the infamous Polk St. Bar Crawl
-A ton of people!
-Great choice of VERY LOUD music
-Amazing cocktails. The floors are sticky and you often see some rowdy folks because of it.
author: Scott S.

description: Got the drinks quickly. Met a lot of friendly locals. Great place to go to if you're visiting and want to mingle with people.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Mediocre bar lounge on Polk street, but one of the main ones on Polk street, nonetheless!

Bar drinks are of the norm here (pricey that can range for $13-15 with tips included) and it's loud to hold a conversation here during late nights when it is time to turn up! 

It's a fun bar spot to drink at and hop on over to another!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Best blueberry martinis ever!! They will creep up on you. Great happy hour and cozy fireplace.
author: Paula S.

description:
I watched a security guard repeatedly shove a guest out extremely violently and harm multiple innocent people in the way. I went to talk to the security guard and was rudely shoved aside. After talking to multiple people no one seemed to care. I found out the man got literally beaten out and others got injured for him drinking a beer that they didn't think the bar served. I was legitimately scared for my safety around the security guards and left the first chance I had. 

I've never been to a bar where I felt so uncomfortable and in danger. Security guards are meant to keep the building capacity at the correct number and escort unruly people out. What I saw was a man with an uncontainable temper and no regard for women and men with no affiliation with the situation be hurt. I'm so appalled with the way this business dealt with this problem and wouldn't be surprised if a law suit was headed their way.
author: Abigail L.

description: Four stars for their extensive cocktail menu (there's something for everyone, from martinis to sweet tea to muddled fruit cocktails and shots & beer combos) and their indoor fireplace!
author: Inga C.

description: Great spot for drinks and people watching. Bartenders are fun and very accommodating- will mix you drinks off the menu if you're looking for something different. Tried the blueberry martini...it's not too bad but I'm not sure why it's touted as much. Lots of places around for food and I heard the bar will let you bring food from elsewhere too.
author: N K.

description: My all time favorite place to be on Polk no matter what the weather or occasion is outside. I've spent New Years, St. Patrick's Day, Valentines, Santa Con, you name it and I've stopped by for a good drink and great background music. Though I'm pretty sure its the same playlist it never hurts to sing those songs out loud with your crew anytime! The drinks are reasonably priced and the bar tenders are some of the best in town! Can't go wrong with Lush people and you can always catch a seat by the fireplace or next to the windows to people watch.
author: Ankita C.

description:
If you're a single girl--wheeee! This place is 70% male! If you're a single guy--lol. I guess the same can be said for the rest of the Bay Area, but the number of times my overpriced drink got knocked over by a pack of male hopefuls entering to scan the room/a pack of disappointed males hastily leaving, was too high! 

Also the drinks were too sweet and had barely any alcohol in them. And how is this a lounge?
author: Amanda A.

description: Just a perfect dog friendly bar scene! The bartenders are amazing. The atmosphere is friendly and totally upbeat!! A few  s for sports and a nice layout of super fun bar accouterments. Cheers good people!
author: A. H.

description:
I came here for my friend's birthday a couple weeks ago. 
The crowd was so - so, and the music was whack. 
The best thing about this spot was that there is ample places to sit down. 
The music isn't too loud where you can't hear others while trying to have a conversation. This spot is good for a more mature crowd that isn't looking to go crazy partying on the town, but mainly to get out and have a good time with great folks. 

The best part of the night was the crepes spot across the street. We went there afterwards! = )
author: Jenn R.

description:
Lush is my go-to when I'm looking for a night out on Polk Street. It's cheap, spacious, and friendly. There's an upstairs which is sometime used for private events but when it's opened up it allows for a lot more room at Lush. The only bar is downstairs so you'll still have to go to up and down the stairs but long as you keep a sharp mind, the stairs will be no threat.

The bar is long so you probably won't have an issue getting to the front. There's usually only three or four bartenders serving the entire bar though so you'll be waiting awhile. They have a $20 minimum on credit cards and since drinks are pretty cheap you'll have to drink quite a bit to reach the minimum. Personally I think that's a blessing in disguise. 

Lush is both a good place to start and end the night. There's no cover fee and it's a convenient place to meet up. It's purely a bar but there are dance clubs like Playland, Mayes, and Vertigo very close by. My recommendation? Stop by Lush first to get your drink fix and then head out to some dance clubs. End up at Lush again at the end of the night to share stories and keep drinking.
author: Philip W.

description: My experience here was definitely one of the worst experiences in a club thus far. First off, the bouncer took a look at my Ohio driver's license (because I'm originally from Ohio, surprise surprise) and said it looked fake. No scanner. No questions to see if the ID really was mine (and I memorized my driver's license number). Instead, my friends filed in while I had to search for a photo of my passport on my phone -- which I have because I was in the middle of a job search and sent a scanned copy to my new employer. Thus, I stood in the rain searching on my phone while 2 bouncers stood there holding my ID and letting everyone else pass. I am 24. I did not need this, and I can't believe he was so rude. Finally, I showed him my passport image and he let me in. When my friends and I complained to the bartender and tried to let him know so that others may not run into the same issue, the bartender shrugged it off. The incident definitely dampened my mood and the music and alcohol the rest of the night did not make the situation any better. This place is definitely not worth returning, especially not for all of the inconveniences it caused me.
author: Jane T.

description:
I have lived down the street from this place and never tried it, mostly because the name makes it sound a tad bit sleazy. It wasn't at all though. The inside of the bar is kind of rustic with barrels as tables and game plants having from the ceiling. 

We went during happy hour, so drinks were very reasonable. We got a gimlet, which was smooth and sweet; a dark and stormy, my favorite; and a sweet tea, which was served in a mason jar. Oh, and of course the $3 bud light. After happy hour, it gets more expensive, so I would probably only come before 7pm. 
The bar wasn't crowded when we went, so we had no problem finding a barrel to talk around. The upstairs section was closed for some reason. Good play on their part, because now I will atleast go again just to sit upstairs. Like everyone else said, the music was good and not too loud.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday celebration.  The place seems a bit run down and dirty, kind of what I expect for a bar on Polk.  The bartenders were ok, the drinks were ok, the patrons range from the emo punkster to some gangsta wannabe.  I was really bored here, so thanks for playing one of my fav shows: Big Bang Theory on the TV above the bar.

I feel like this place is nothing special and there are plenty of other cool bars and places to check out on Polk.
author: Yue L.

description:
Can get crowded, good margaritas and vodka mixes. (good cocktails in general).

They had this weird watermelon shot, which was horrible.
author: Siddhartha G.

description:
Did I like my NYE?  YES!  I was with friends and people who mattered to me.
Did I like my NYE here or would I return?  H&%$ f$&$ing no!

Maybe New Years Eve isn't the day to make a good impression for any bar/lounge/club.  But that the day I went and so did many people.

Waiting in line, one of my friend's friend commented to another friend to prepare for sticky floor.  Four steps in, it felt the sticky.

What else was bad?  The employees.  I don't feel they are the brightest or the most considerate.  It's all about the cover and the money.  I felt like they didn't care about service or impression.

What else was bad?  Three people got pucked on that I know of.  Me.  My friend.  And another dude.  It hit me on the shoes.  It hit my friend all over his pants.  And it hit some random dude on his shirt. 

Was it clean quickly?  NO!  I'm not sure it was even cleaned.

This place is on my AVOID list.
author: Phillip N.

description:
Bumpin on a Saturday night for sure.  I haven't done a run on Polk since my 21st.  My friend chose this place because she was having dinner nearby.  Place gets crowded but the birthday girl managed to snag a table.  Good drinks specials like $9 Patron shots & $5 Watermelon Shooters.  Surprised that the space it's bigger than the pictures make it out to be.  

It's a chill place and I usually go for a more "dressy" lounge but it's not a bad place at all.  And the birthday girl had a good time so that's all that really matters right?  Only minuses: Cash only & parking was horrible!  We ended up parking at the garage a block away for a decent rate for a little over an hour, but they're closed on Sundays, meaning we had to get back to the garage before 12AM.  3.5 rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description: The ambience is pretty easy-going. Everyone here is having a good time. The happy hour is popular with after-work folk, and it's pretty cheap. The drinks are great, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The decor is rustic but very comfortable. Visited here a few times on my 10 nights in San Francisco.
author: Chris H.

description:
I don't drink alcohol, so I can't comment on the drinks.  A friend rented the second floor for his birthday party, so I went and was pleasantly surprised.  

First, everyone was friendly from start to finish.  When I told the ID checker I was here for a birthday party, he asked for my friend's last name so he could more easily direct others arriving after me.  On the way out, I asked the security guard for bus directions.  He saved my night by telling me exactly where to go.  Had I not asked him, I would have ended up on the wrong side of the street and missed the last Caltrain at 12:01AM.  

Second, the bartenders didn't dally after I made eye contact.  I usually tip a dollar a drink, and they seemed fine with that.  (I was buying drinks for my friends.)  They also smiled when my friend made a joke: "The strawberry fizz [a girly drink] is for him," she said.  

Third, the location is convenient.  There's a bus stop right outside the bar, and plenty more on Van Ness, which is one block up.  As of July 2013, the #47 on Van Ness goes to the Caltrain station on 4th and King, and if you're heading back, you want to make sure you cross the street on Van Ness.  

Two final points: 1) I arrived at 9:45PM on a Saturday night, and the bar wasn't busy.  It seems like more people started showing up at around 10:10PM.  By 11:20PM, the place was packed; 2) in case you're wondering, this is not a bar where people dance (at least not when I was there).  There is music--I heard Michael Jackson's ABC and recognized a few other songs--but the place gets so busy at night, people don't have space to dance.
author: Matt R.

description:
I went to Lush with a couple of friends after brunch! They had happy hour going on so we were thrilled to try their drinks!

We started off with their blueberry martinis! I wouldn't usually order a martini, but this really stood out to us, and it was actually good! You cannot say no to their happy hour prices as well, compared to other spots in SF!

I also had their mojito, which was refreshing after our brunch!

This is overall a great place to hang out, grab a couple of drinks and just chill. 

Since we went here in the afternoon, there was less action in the lounge, and there was only one bartender making drinks! He was very nice and took care of every customer!
author: Glenn L.

description:
With a name like Lush Lounge, this place sounds like a Vegas bottle service joint with hotties in their hoochie mini-dresses, with velvet seating, sheer drapes, and a jammed disco dance floor of sweating young bodies with Polynesian armband tattoos and tramp stamps. It is not this at all.  

Lush starts off the evening with a nice vibe, mature and comfy, with a casual ambiance to meet up with friends to imbibe a few and catch up with friends and their latest drama or gossip. It isn't crowded early, and the drinks are reasonable, like $8 call and $7 well. 

The long single bar is to the left, there is a large picture window in front which is open on nice days to the street, with tables and chairs there and around the edges of the room. There is an upstairs mezzanine section for the overflow or private function crowd, but there isn't any table service that I could see. It is step up to the bar and order. 

There are plenty of helpful bartenders, so the wait is never long. They offer a blackboard of specialty concoctions like most hip bars in SF do nowadays, but they aren't bogging down the bartenders with 5 minute prep time drinks with crushed fruits, shaken and never stirred girlie combos, mortar and pestle veggies, and a dab of bitters. 

Lush Lounge is part of the Polk Street corridor of nightlife spots, where on weekends, particularly after 11 PM, the streets fill up with young revelers looking for a good party time. After 11pm here, the vibe changes from comfy and friendly to young hotties, single ready to mingle, and a line forms almost exactly at the strike of 11. 

It isn't like the dance clubs in the TenderNob, since there is no dance floor here, and you can easily talk over the music, unlike most clubs, or even some bars like Rickhouse on Kearny. If you don't like the vibe (or change in vibe) here, you can just walk down the street to another spot on the Polk corridor. 

Decades ago, Polk Street used to be famously Gay, before it was castrated by the Castro. You'll still see the occasional cross dresser and trannies in the lower Polk, which is an area that used to also have male prostitutes. But up here on the upper Polk area, it is Hetero, with the young Marina crowd migrating up as the evening wears on, and they tire of Buffy and Bif (or should I say Mitt?) named lawyers in the Marina spots. 

During fleet week, there were groups of the Few, the Proud, the first in battle, roaming the bars in uniform, prowling for friend, not enemy. We applauded them and befriended them, thanking them for their service. I think they were looking for girls, but since the repeal of don't ask, don't tell, anything is game on Polk Street. I didn't ask, and they didn't tell.
author: Wanugee N.

description: Liked this place a lot!  Right on Polk street where a lot was going on already,  it had a little bit of a rustic feel (in a California way if that makes sense) with lots of exposed wood. They had a good selection of drinks (negroni - my fav), eclectic crowd and friendly bartender.
author: Lisa A.

description: Good cocktails and atmosphere. I enjoyed Harper & Rye before, but just can't handle the crowd of techbro douchebags that place attracts. Lush has what I liked about that place but is way more chill. There's a great window space for people watching. Overall felt plenty cozy and comfortable and the clientele seemed cozy and comfortable too. The Guinness seemed a little watery though.
author: Louise R.

description: My girlfriend and I visited this place because she'd heard it was a great place for Happy Hour fun. It WAS fun because the staff and patrons were universally warm, wonderful and jovial. On the other hand, the happy hour drinks we were served were low on alcohol, overly sweet and packed with flimsy-tasting non-alcoholic filler.
author: Brad A.

description:
Ugh! Stands for ugly drunk bartender with a food stained hoodie who charged me $12 for a black Russian well and never cleared the 6 glasses on the bat in front of me and called last call at 12:30. Ugh.

Also this place stinks. Its like sickly sweet like someone threw up fernet and no one cleaned it.  

Please avoid.
author: Jacklyn H.

description:
A neat little bar with a couple dogs hanging around, and a loft for groups to gather.  Kelle K's friend was having a Mardi Gras party so we stopped in for a quick visit.  Lush let her bring her own food, which I think is pretty cool.

My only complaint is that they don't stock non-alcoholic beer.  I stopped consuming alcohol, but would have liked to have a beer, and would have had an N/A if they stocked them.  Oh well.
author: Kevin K.

description:
After Upcider, we decided to head out to another bar but wasn't sure where to go. We decided to check out Lush Lounge. 

The vibe seems to be pretty fun and the drinks were well made. They have a cool upstairs area for people to hang out and have the windows open to keep you cool. 

Overall Thoughts

I wouldn't mind coming back to the Lush Lounge if I was in the area
author: Eddie W.

description:
Made a stop here while barhopping for my friend's birthday this past weekend.  Has that dive bar charm with adequate space for both sitting and standing.  Seems like it would be a chill place to grab drinks with a friend on a weeknight.  They have an upstairs area, looked like it was being used for a private event the night we went.

One thing I will say is stick to beer if you're not staying long or have other stops planned for the night.  The hard stuff is a little pricey, and the blonde bartender seems to have issues with mixed drink proportions.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Lush how I was deceived. We dropped by Lush to start our birthday bar hop and it was a colossal mistake. The place is dark and divey. Floor was sticky. Crowd was pushy as fuck. Dranks tasted like shit, straight up sewer water would've been better.

We ordered two AMFs (for birthday boy and birthday girl), a whiskey sour, and midori sour. Very typical drinks that all bartenders should know how to make. The whiskey sour and midori was literally just lemon juice (no hint of alcohol nor the typical flavoring). The AMFs were just liquor that was meshed together and tasted like cheap vodka from Safeway (but worst!). Since we bought it, we downed it anyways using the lemon juice (what jokes) as our chaser. Felt sick afterwards. We left immediately. 

No thanks, never coming back again.
author: Linh P.

description: Great spot in Polk Gulch to bring a group of friends or just hang out. Beautiful interior, excellent vibe, speedy knowledgeable bartenders, and great drink specials. Go!
author: Vince C.

description: The vibe is great. The bartenders are cool. The blueberry martini is a must, but all the drinks are good. Great people watching! Nit the best hood but wirth it to come here with friends for a great time.
author: Amy L.

description: OK.  Mr.L died late this summer. Sucks to be a new widow he was one of the greats. Lush's staff has sincere listening ears very kind. Oh don't worry I know when to leave you won't see me sloppy but you will see me slurping bubbly in my widow seat often laughing out loud at the tweeky street scenes on Polk. If you're laughing you're healing, right?
author: SF T.

description:
We went here on a Sunday night for an after-dinner drink. As we walked in, and ordered our drinks with the bartender (clearly hearing we were out of town), he proceeded to refuse our orders till he went through a "routine ID check", then happily took my $50 for drinks that summed up to $8 and pretend not to know how much change he should have given me back! If I was THAT trustworthy, I would have walked alway $42 short.

"Long night", he calims. 

I'm sure. 

Discraceful to see that such despicable people still exist. How can someone take advantage of people's vulnerability like that. Since when did it become OK to steal fortips?!

Who ever the bartender was tonight (14th September 2014), I hope karma servers you right.
author: Ana V.

description:
Found you on Yelp, Lush!

The protocol is to order your drinks at the bar and find some seats/a table.  They have a mean beer selection and even meaner chocolate martini.  I cut myself off after that sucker.  Mixed drinks run $7-8. 

Solid.
author: Tricia D.

description:
Lush is the type of bar you go to when you want to avoid the kiddies and the douchebaggery of other clubs. On my girl Carmella T's b-day, we just wanted to kick it at a bar with a laid back vibe and get our grown woman drank on. Lush was it.

No line to get in. 
No attitude at the door.
No crowds at the bar.
No problem snagging a table.

I tried their 3 for $12 drink special - SoCo lemon shots! Oh, and clean bathrooms. The only downside is that the bar is cash only, so be prepared.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Lush has swung it's doors open once more, new doors, but Lush Lounge's doors none the less. You'll find the new and improved Lush a block up from it's old location, right in the thick of the Polk St. bar scene, with more room for your lushing and lounging pleasure.

The most important thing here is that they're back with same squad of bartenders because lets face it, good bartenders are what makes a good bar. You can have the fanciest, hippest location in the city and if your team sucks ass you won't last long.

It will take me awhile to get used to as I'm sure it will for many of us who remember the old, much smaller digs. I'm no old man though, I embrace change, and I have to say while completely different I'm very impressed with the new setup. Much more room, longer bar, more tables, more lushing.

Did I mention the fireplace? Cozy. I asked if I could bring my own materials for smores and while I didn't get an explicit "no" I could tell the idea wasn't really embraced, I may have to hold off.

Next time you're wandering Polk, check it out. New spot, new interior, new setup, same great staff and customers. I enjoy being a lush at Lush.
author: Justin N.

description:
Awesome bar! They had a decent selection of mixed/made up drinks and the crowd was mixed. We got decently fast service at the bar, and my friends already claimed a table. It had just the right amount of people, which was nice, esp if you're just going to hang out with friends.

Bathrooms are decently clean. There are two bathrooms and each has a frosted glass, which means you can kind of see through where the person is in the bathroom. That's awkward.
author: Christina L.

description:
Hands up for the Lush Lounge! Definitely one of the best spots on Polk Street for bar hopping! 

My friends and I started our night with a couple... er, a handful of blood orange cosmos at the Lush Lounge. Never had one before, but it was quite delish! The beautiful bartender started my tab and fixed my drink within a couple of minutes despite the crowd on a Saturday night. Love! 

Half of our group was able to sit and chat while the other half crowded around the bar/dance floor for shots and to mingle. Good atmosphere! Met some really kind strangers.  Absolutely no trouble whatsoever. Love!

Caught up in the festivities, I forgot to close my tab! Luckily, the doorman and bartenders were kind enough to open the door for me and allow me up close my tab! Such a friendly staff! I was greeted with smiles and witty banter! Love! 

Would definitely come back the next time I'm in town again! :)
author: Mandy W.

description: The bouncers just throw my id away on the street because they thought I was texting when I was giving my id to them. They really suck. Also, they start yelling at me treating me so bad that I really do not recommend this place.
author: Wilmarí T.

description:
Five important things to note:

1) Influx of Marina boys
2) Surprisingly good music (impressive soundtrack of 80-00s pop rap)
3) Interesting men's bathroom (uncomfortable urinal situation)
4) PBR + whiskey shot special!
5) Cash only
author: Nick K.

description:
LADIES BEWARE ITS THE KIND OF PLACE THAT SHITTY PHONE SNATCHERS GO TO!!!

Avoid yourself a random night with weirdos.

I think the only good thing about this place was their mojito & my dear company. Apart from that it was packed with bro-ey douchebags (literarily packed to the point where someone was able to reach inside my purse on my way back from the bathroom) worst part, we were just about to take off..
author: Local G.

description: Great place for happy hour. Love the atmosphere. It's not a hipster bar--bartenders are down to Earth. They play games on the screen too but it's not really a sports bar feel...hard to explain the scene but it's pretty professional, young, lower nob hill crowd. The cocktails are really yummy (and deceptively strong). No food but they have pretzels at the bar.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Solid cocktails at reasonable prices and decent vibe.  Good happy hour!!!   This was my go to bar when they were across the street many years ago.  Still like it and whenever I'm in the hood, it's a great place to grab a drink and relax.
author: Matt B.

description:
This definitely isn't a place I would come to regularly, but I like it.  I went with some Hastings students for some tax law club "meeting" during happy hour, so drinks were cheap!  I ended up getting a chardonnay, which was delicious for me, but I'm no wine expert so it might be a good idea not to trust me if you're into good wine.

We sat upstairs in a nice secluded area, and it was a good place to really just get to know people / talk!  I liked that there was music playing, but that it wasn't too loud.  I mean, I guess that kind of makes me sound like a granny, but for real, I hate it when I have to yell over music at a bar... not even a club. 

I think what made me like this place more than I normally would have was that the bartenders were very nice.  I mean, the place was far from crowded so I didn't really expect them to be stressing or rushing / whatever, but I guess sometimes there are some that are just bored, uninterested, or just want to get your order over with so they can go back to watching the game.  The bartenders here were friendly and seemed pretty relaxed.  Sometimes I know it's hard to deal with customers like me because I have no idea what I want most of the time, especially when it comes to wine, soooo it was appreciated :)  Thanks guys!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Specially cocktails clearly really on sugar to be palatable.  The service is slow and a 20 dollar min for credit cards is not absurd.  What a fall for a bar that used to be fun.
author: Nathaniel H.

description:
I went here with a friend after lunch on a Sat. around 2PM. It was dead with one bartender and very few people. I ordered an old fashion and my friend ordered a whiskey sour. It seemed like it was a full bar and he knew how to use the ingredients (which, he did) but he kept adding more and more ice which DILUTES the whiskey once it's said and done I had a cup of watered down whiskey. No vibe to this place to even worth staying to chit chat and chill. Stayed for about 20 mins and left.

Next.
author: Victoria S.

description: We went to lush lounge this saturday for a few drinks. The crowd was good and drinks were pretty tasty. The reason I am leaving a bad review is what happened as soon as we left. Standing on the sidewalk outside, the bouncers started getting antagonistic because we were on the side walk. While I understand they would like the sidewalk to be clear, its not really their right to demand us move from a public place. However, calling my friend a C*NT and asking us to go back to Fremont (assuming some racial connotation there) was very disrespectful. Lush lounge is a pretty nice place, but having these kind of employees makes them look really bad.
author: Sahir S.

description:
HOLY HELL I'VE NEVER SEEN SO MANY HOT GUYS IN ONE PLACE. Started my night of bar hopping here. It was the only bar in the surrounding area that didn't have a line but it was packed inside. 

They had $3 raspberry lemon drop shots that were so strong I had to chase them with my friends beer. They have an upstairs area that is just as crowded. I think there was a bouncer on the stairs so you probably can't go up once it gets too packed or something. 

They check ids at the door and it might take a while to get a drink by no fault of the bartender. The crowd just gets really heavy by the bar area and you have to push your way through.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Didn't spend too long in here when we hit up Polk Street so maybe a better review will come once I get the full experience.
Decent music.
Huge Bathroom Line.
Two floors with decent amount of sitting space.

- Cash Only.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Polk Street has really blown up lately, hasn't it?  But I still love the lower Polk for a bar crawl, and Lush Lounge is my absolute favorite on the block.  

It's a chill place, drinks are cheap(er) and oh, the sweet tea vodka!  Try it, you will love it too.
author: Joanne G.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night and it was PACKED to the rim, literally bodies grazing bodies.  But that's what you'll need to expect if you go to Polk Street during the busiest time of the week.

Although I'm not a fan of collecting someone else's sweat on my clothes, I fell in love with the music and the drinks.  They were playing music from the 90's and 00's, which made me feel very nostalgic.  All the drinks were good and decently priced; I especially liked my cucumber ginger gimlet.

Head on upstairs and you will find additional seating and it's much more calm up there compared to the shenanigans going on downstairs.

No cover? Heck yea!
author: Michelle W.

description: The bar was cute and the bartenders were nice. Drinks weren't cheap but good. Only issue is we went on a Thursday night at 10pm and the place was DEAD!
author: Sheri A.

description:
On a lazy Sunday afternoon this place is perfect for sipping on a Pimm's  Cup or three, pinkee finger out of course.  Muddled mint, cucumbers and orange in a tall glass of Pimm's liqueur and ginger beer.  Refreshment perfection.

Lots of raw wood, a fire place, some zen-like deco and we've got a chill spot in the hizzouse.  It's clean and cool, kinda Rat Pack meets Clint Eastwood.  If I lived in the area, I would most def be a regular.
author: D.wight L.

description:
This place is a chiller place to hang out when you are making your rounds on Polk St. and I came here as a second stop when I was celebrating my friends 21st birthday. Although crowded, the vibe here is very calm, and you can have a conversation without having to shout it out loud...which is always a welcome change on a night out. There do tend to be a lot of people here though, so finding standing or sitting room may get pretty tricky at times. I think the price of drinks here are pretty average too. One of the downsides is that their restrooms are single stalls, so there can be a line especially during those busy weekend nights. Overall, not a bad place to hang out, and wouldn't mind if I had to come back here. 

A sad thing that did happen this night though is that one of my friends lost her phone, and when we called them the next day, no one picked up the calls after several tries. We even left a voice message, but no one returned the call either. True the phone is lost and probably not their fault, but it would have been nice for someone to have picked up their phone during business hours.
author: Daniel H.

description: Started my drinking tour here and the best of all. The bartender is so friendly. Happy hour drinks are the best. The atmosphere is perfect
author: Lauren J.

description:
Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday and here's what I like about the place:

-No cover! Automatic star for that
-Pretty cheap drinks! Well, not super cheap but definitely a lot cheaper than most bars. AND the bartenders are super nice (which, to me, seems more rare these days)
-Good music (although no dance floor because it's too crowded)
-Pretty casual. I like that you don't need to dress up to come here. It's more chill, it's packed, everyone looks like they're having a great time
author: Diana Y.

description:
I think the happy hour reflects the name of Lush Lounge. $4 glasses of champagne, $6 cucumber gin gimlet and other cocktails, $7 for a tecate and tequila or PBR and whiskey? I'm feeling lushful already...

The mood in here is kind of sexy with reddish lighting and beautiful seating. Head upstairs to the balcony-like area for extra seating if the downstairs is too crowded. You have to walk further to get your drink, but at least you'll get a sitting break in between rounds. And when you're on your 3 or 4 round that's quite important.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
This is technically 4.5 stars, because it's not the best bar in the world but it is definitely one of the best of San Francisco. If you're looking for somewhere less snobbish than Union Square lounges, but a little classier than your usual Irish bar, this is it!

The bad: the happy hour is a bit depressing and drinks are on the pricier side, as always (but not that pricey for the city)

The good: Around 8-9 pm, the music kicks up, the bartenders file in and Lush lounge becomes an awesome place to start or even spend the night. The best part about this place is the music- they blast some solid hip hop, 90's, and good time music (none of the hipstery house stuff) and it's a great place to meet up with friends, and enjoy a couple of good drinks. I was also impressed by how I shouted 5 drink orders to the gruff bartender who nodded and sped back with them drinks under a couple of minutes.

Ambiance: dimly lit, eccentrically decorated, awesomely music filled bar on Polk. A mix of college aged kids and mid 20's folks- on the younger side.

Overall: Mellow and unpretentious, great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night.
author: Jackie T.

description:
**FRIENDLY BAR WITH FRIENDLY PRICES**

CASH ONLY.

No stupid VIP lines. No stupid front men. 

My girlfriend and I squealed in delight upon discovering their offering of BLOOD and SAND, our signature drink of the month.

2 cocktails = $17
3 shots = $17

All in all, reasonable drink prices.

Ambiance was pleasant. Cozy fireplace with exposed brick wall. 

20 seat bar along with table seating and standing room for the weekend crowds. 

The combination of great cocktails and nice decor meant we had a good time.

RECOMMEND.
author: Betty N.

description:
Quite cool little place!!! Drinking before 4 in the afternoon? Aye aye... guilty as charged!

Together with some new acquaintances and friends after an afternoon of urban hiking about Russian and Nob Hills and getting our little hineys worked deserved some imbibing, oh yes....

$5 got me a nice chilled (just what I needed despite all the wind today in the City) blueberry martini. Wasn't bad, but also wasn't WOW flavor, gotta admit. My new friend, V, told me that the ladies really tend to like the cocktails shaken up by the mixologists here. I believe him!

Such a chill environment... two large flat screens, a real working fireplace in case the temperate weather should turn for the worse... Nice ambiance.. great venue for chatting and talking. Great chill time after our hike and sweat!

PS Hey, "Progresh"...we'll def have to meet again with J over at Viks!! My side of town..
author: Jana C.

description: I've been coming here on and off for years and have hosted many privates events here.  However after my experience tonight, I'll never come back. To be clear - I'm 38 years old. I forgot my id this night and they would not me in. I understand the need to be diligent as a bar - I also know if I verbally agree to being over 21 I'm legally responsible. The "manager" who happened to at the door wouldn't even look at me. And just said no - no. Sad to say - I'll never come back to this place. Regardless of the memories I have made over the years.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
This place is divey and dark in all the right ways.
Its good for groups and the drink specials are very nice considering they even apply on weekends (which like never happens).

I love the big window where you can sit and watch the crazies pass by. All in all a great ghetto placed bar.
author: Brittini S.

description:
01.10.13 etc.

Cool door, friendly bouncer, plenty of seating, great atmosphere, strong drinks.

Only downer?  Cash only.
author: Jenny L.

description:
-$10+ for a specialty drink

PROS
- Nice place to go for a casual night cap on a Thursday night
- Male: Female ratio is in favor of the straight female
- Atmosphere reminded me of "Bullit," very cozy
- Attracted many young (20s-30s) professionals
- Strawberry cooler= refreshing!

CONS
- Upstairs lounge area closed off
- Had to stand due to lack of seats
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I came on Saturday night on the night of Santacon, to join up with a friend's bar/lounge crawl. The place was literally packed with bodies. The line was the length of the place, but unlike my friends, I came later and managed to get in twice, never waiting that long either time.

Did not get any drinks as I was already quite sloshed, so no comment there.

They have good music here and a good atmosphere for dancing. I may have done the most public pooping of my life, accompanied by cheering, because there was no stall, just a room with 2 urinals, a sink and a toilet -_-
author: Michael W.

description:
Again- this review is super super overdue. I went to Lush on a Saturday night to celebrate my 26th birthday with some friends. First of all, trying to celebrate on Easter weekend is a bad idea...but that's not Lush's fault!

The fireplace makes this place entirely cozy- could absolutely be a cool date spot on a week day night. 

Didn't interact much with the wait staff, not sure how cool they are. I do know one of them wasn't sure what a Paloma was, and that just made me sad. :(

I'd go back to Lush if someone suggested it, but I'm not sure it would be a "go to" spot.
author: Annalise F.

description:
There is no cover which is a plus. The bartenders are very friendly and quite fast and efficient in helping each customer, even when the bar is packed. The bar is very small compared to most others in the area and therefore it was jam packed, making it slightly difficult to walk through and creating a long line for the restrooms. There is a private area upstairs which was nice for people watching and to escape the crowd.

The drinks are fairly priced and there were many good specials. The bar is cash only which is a bummer, but luckily I knew beforehand so I came prepared. The men and ladies' restrooms share a common sink area which made it even more crowded because the sinks had twice as many people using it.

The environment was very casual and relaxed. Most customers were young adults and there were a lot more men than women.

I definitely enjoyed my experience here and would return.
author: Nicole B.

description: Small place, gets crowded... hard to move around and takes forever to order drinks with people standing there drinking their drinks... (get out of the darn way so people can order... !) The upstairs is pretty cool... very chill, unlike the downstairs where it's like you're packed in a can of sardines.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Great place to come to pre-party, hang out with friends or if you want more of a intimate setting, you can go upstairs and suck drunken faces with your date.

Lush isn't super pretentious; it doesn't need to be. The workers are themselves; nice, friendly, polite just like any other normal human being and I appreciate that. The decor is seems almost feels almost western speak easy-esque; with it's distressed wooden shelves filled with liquor on one wall and a rustic brick wall on the other. (Minus the TV) The fireplace is a plus on a cold evening, but for a person who runs warm, like me, it can be a nuisance. It's all about being comfortable folks. And when the place fills up with human bodies + fireplace = GET ME OUT OF HERE MY ARMPITS ARE DRIPPING THROUGH MY SHIRT.(Not hot) Luckily, the ventilation seemed pretty decent so I didn't have that problem here.

The drinks are reasonably priced too. Bartenders are quick, and attentive.

Minus -1 'cause it's a cash bar only. I always run out of cash. =(
author: Joon Y.

description:
This is one of my go-to bars in San Francisco. The mezzanine is the best (when it's open) and the bartenders are great. 

They have a lot of custom cocktails and speciality drinks which is really nice as well. 

Avoid the place on a Friday or Saturday night when the crowd (and all of Polk street for that matter) turns from casual to a bunch of kids wanting Fireball shots.
author: Mafia M.

description:
This is my favorite bar on this part of Polk. The vibe reminded me of old hollywood mixed with tiki if that makes any sense. The huge list of cocktails is mesmerizing and the bartenders really craft the drinks here versus just mixing a few ingredients.

They were playing the fantastic late 60s movie Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice which was really great as background visuals to our evening. Natalie Wood and that dude from Ocean's 11? Alright!

I went in on a weekday, but I can imagine the scene here on a weekend is out of this world.

Definitely worth a trip if you're in the area and looking for a great cocktail!
author: Taylor A.

description: I came across this place on accident and it looked interesting from the outside so I figured I would check it out. They had an interesting list of mixed drinks so I opted to skip a beer and go for one of those. The service is quick and the clientele is a nice mix. It is a very social place where it was full but not overcrowded. It's the perfect spot for a quick drink where you might get sucked in or where you have other near by options to continue your night.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Whaaaatt?! I didn't know Zachary Quinto is a bartender here on Sunday nights! I kid, but the nice gentleman that served our liquor looked like the aforementioned actor, and I couldn't help but bring it up with him - though I'm sure this wasn't the first time nor will it be the last time he'll hear of it. 5 stars to him for being awesomely light about it.

The door to this joint is huge, resembling the entrance to an old church, but the decor inside channeled almost a speakeasy slash retro feel with their pictures posted up of Cary Grant and insanely attractive old Hollywood actors. There's a random bicycle nailed to the wall, and this awesome double fan circling above the bartender's area. I felt like I was in a speakeasy where it requires a password to get in. The ginormous barrels in the middle doubled as a makeshift table for three. The lovely part in all this is there's enough room to move around and not feel so claustrophobic.

How can someone not fall in love with this lounge?

Listed below are Lush lounge's happy hour times and drinks: 

Sunday noon-2am
Monday 3pm-2am
Tuesday-Saturday 3pm-7pm

-$3 Bud Light draft beer, glass of wine (Chardonnay,Pinot Grigio, Merlot,Cabernet)
-$4 glass of Champagne, Shot of Cuervo Silver Tradicional (100% Agave Tequila)
-$5 Blueberry martini, Blackberry Bubbles **(I recommend ordering both of these)**
-$6 Don Q Mojito, Margarita, Skyy Cucumber Ginger Gimlet

I've also tried their Dark and Stormy (which my friend described it looking as "San Mateo beach water" when mixed), Strawberry bourbon , sangria, and blood orange/raspberry infused vodka shots ($3 a shot!). I recommend all of these, b/c I don't torture myself with less-than-amazing tasting drinks that get you buzzed fast. Then again, I'm a 5'1 Asian woman, any alcohol will get me there.

A+++++ fast service, great drinks, will come back again! **CA$H ONLY*
author: Jaye C.

description:
Their drinks were quite good.
But the bartender was not friendly at all. She seemed pretty arrogant.
She checked our ID twice !!! Come on, there were literally under 10 people at the bar at that time, and you already forgot that we're old enough.
author: Alan T.

description: This place is pretty solid.  A little loud with the music but its a great spot for going out among friends or even a date spot if you have a loud voice.  The drinks are cheap to fair pricing and can be a bit stiff with the pour ratio which I don't mind but some of the ladies might.
author: Mike K.

description:
I'm in love with Lush. Great ambience, great music, great layout -- just an overall good time. 

I love bars with a loft setup, which means you can sneak away upstairs to have a quieter conversation, or in my case, gawk and make faces at everyone downstairs. Music definitely sounds like it's coming from an employee's personal collection. Good thing, in this case, because it's a cool kid mix of R&B, hip hop, and dance -- meaning it's laid-back but still party-worthy.

Definitely looking to come back for happy hour and check out some of the specials.
author: John C.

description:
I love this place on a weeknight - it's quiet, I can have a fancy cocktail, my pick from a nice selection of scotch, or a decent beer on tap, like a Matilda which reminds me of the good ol' days drinking Goose Island in Chicago.  There's always a spot to sit and catch up with a friend or noodle in a sketchbook.  On a nice day the front windows are open, and the crowd is a bit eclectic and older.  

On the weekends, I find it to be terrifying, packed to the gills with younger, hotter, clubbier people, they switch to plastic cups, and I have to shout to have a fair chance at being heard, all of which reminds me how "un-fun" I've become.
author: Megan K.

description:
Awesome place to go if you dont wanna get tied down to one spot (aka clubbin in the city). Came here recently on a Friday night for a friend's good-bye night out and it was a nice chill environment. 

They spin a nice variety of top 40 music to whatever you listen to off 99.7. Dranks? They have a huge variety with very good prices that won't break ya pockets. almost ALL their drinks taste really good, well ... GIRLY good. We all know the ladies love those tasty drinks but you can always order the regular redbull vodka / jack and coke. Not gonna deny it though, their mix drinks like the sweet tea is poppin. i can drink 5 of those and not taste the alcohol in there but it'll creep on you.

Bouncers at the door seem chill. 

-1 for cash only though ... some people NEVER carry cash. aka me
author: Kenny L.

description: Very yummy (kind of pricey) drinks and a good load of space. If you make your way upstairs, you can actually fit a sizable group at a table and have a good conversation. Downstairs gets super crowded as the night goes on, but what doesn't get crowded on this street. I had a very decent Dark and Stormy and tried some of my friends' other drinks which were pretty solid as well. Overall, spent the longest time on my bar crawl here and actually had nice conversations and a good time. Definitely recommend to stop by here.
author: Lulu P.

description:
The name Lush Lounge couldn't be more perfect for this hip bar in the Tenderloin. I hadn't been since they changed locations and let me tell you, what a difference the new venue has made. 

The decor is over-the-top awesome and most definitely feels like you've stepped in to some sort of lush haven. With quotes on the wall from Dorothy Parker like, "I wish I could drink like a lady. I can take one or two at the most. Three and I'm under the table. Four and I'm under the host," the walls provide you with perpetual amusemetn. 

Happy hours are pretty darn good:  $2 PBR and Tecate, $3 glasses of wine, $4 glasses of champagne and a $5 selected martini. Don't take my word for it, check it out!
author: Julia N.

description:
Chris, one of the owners of LL, is a thrill to work with. 

I needed a space with a mezzanine to rent out for the night for ~30-35 people. Not only does LL have an upstairs mez. available for events, there's no rental fee. Say what? No rental fee. We had a bar minimum for our private bartender upstairs, but it was within reason.

We partied on a Friday night and the bar was packed by 10ish. It definitley was awesome having the upstairs to ourselves while it filled up downstairs. #feellikeaceleb. The crowd was diverse, more men than women uh duh (we're in SF, no?). Drinks were stiff, affordable and tasty. I'm coming back for their sweet tea lemonade and their friendly bartenders. I'm booking the mez here! Thank you, Chris!

Parking: two words: Polk street. Just walk it/ bus it;. Or cab/Uber/Lyft/sidecar... or take all simultaneously heh:)
author: Rosa L.

description: Cool space with nice spots to hang out. Pretty wide range of cocktails, too. I have to say the mojito wasnt the best I've ever had, but it was decent.
author: Jack C.

description:
A cool place to hang out on a Sunday afternoon.  

Like, Easter Sunday afternoon.  It was a nice cash only bar, with an interesting decor and lots of space.  I suppose the lots of space disappears evenings and weekends.  I like all the chalkboards with the interesting drinks, and that they have drinks in every price range.  

The bartender was friendly, attentive and polite.  The other patrons were congenial, too.  

3 flutes of champagne and a glass of chardonnay = $15 + tip.
author: David D.

description:
good music, chill crowd, friendly/attentive bartenders

TIPS:
- cash only (there's an atm in the corner of the room)
- only two bathrooms which means the line gets pretty long
- avoid the watermelon shooters! the deal sounds amazing (something like 3 for $12) but it tastes horrible - it's insanely sweet and artificial but at the same time it can't overpower the taste of cheap alcohol
author: Stephanie C.

description: Horrible management. .... was there for a world cup game  a guy was taking pics of girls  legs n up skirt shots when was confronted manager said "ITS OK HE A REGULAR"  I didn't know being a regular allowed u to b a pervert n disrespect people!!!!!
author: Xavier C.

description:
A cool and fresh place to stop and get a drink.

As many of it's other patrons may say, this place is "Hip", "Yummy", "AWEEESSSSSOOOOOMMMMEEEE!!", and "Chillin" which I think anyone who's in the area should really stop by and check it out. 

If I was to compare it to a place (Or places) in LA, then it's a mix of Velvet Margarita and Cafe 24 (which are also both within a block of each other!)

Def check it out and get a drink, if you can get a spot by the bar, there's plenty of space. And their libations are on average $8 also note try to park close to this place, or any of the locations near here (it lessens your chance of getting your car broken into).... OR.... you can go New Yorker style and take BART and walk the 20 blocks.

Enjoy!
author: Kevin P.

description:
I love finding a place in the Tender Nob that rises above the stigma of being smack dab in the middle of the ghetto. I don't know if Lush had a change in management or got a interior designer but the new layout is a million times better than the old. The flow of the crowd moves both in and out, the art work is rustic and old, and the bathroom design is smart and functional. If you need to wash your hands, you don't need to stand in line and hold up the line-it feels Ally McBealish.

I'm a fan of their lounge feel and the coziness of the seating. My friends and I frequent this place early in the night when we can and I've just become a fan of their sangria. They're one of the few bars that carries a wide array of vodkas beyond the usual Chopin, Belvedere, and Grey Goose. (But no Jennifer, they do not carry Hangar One vodka.)

Come early to stake out a cozy corner seat and I can guarantee you'll not feel the need to do any bar hopping of any sort. The drinks are made well, the noise level is really kept to a minimum because of the high vaulted ceilings, and your empty glasses are frequently taken care of by the floating busser. Who could ask for anything more?
author: Jessica K.

description:
Maybe it's because I've been called a lush before, but I really like the new Lush Lounge digs.  Granted, I can't recall ever going to the old digs (hence the lush name-calling), but with cool decor, a fireplace, an upstairs, and good friends, I was pleasantly surprised by this place.

Great happy hour prices, interesting happy hour drinks, and happy times with friends?  Me happy.  

One suggestion?  I got the happy hour fruit bubbly drink, and it always wasn't consistent.  At one point very sweet, at one point very champagne.  I'm a fan of both, but these were dramatically different.    Consistency is easier to recommend.

I've also heard that it (specifically the music) can get incredibly loud on the weekends past a certain time.  As someone who is fast approaching my geriatric years, I like my places to have a chill vibe.  The frat sounds should remain in the marina.
author: Pam S.

description:
Came here on Cinco de Mayo, so a bit of a delayed review. I enjoy the atmosphere here (the upstairs/downstairs separation makes the place feel really big.) We were drawn in by sangria specials and probably had 2 or 3 too many, but boy was it tasty! I'll be sure to come back soon so I can write a better review.

I wasn't put off by the crowd here, unlike most other bars around Polk. I think that means a lot.

Come here after padding your stomach out with some kebabs / imperial rolls at Cordon Bleu! :)
author: Josh K.

description: The music is pretty good and the bartenders are quick and efficient, which makes for a super crowded bar.  It was insanely crowded on Saturday, which I imagine was the source of a couple of the fights towards the end of the night.  Some people attempted to dance here but were stifled by the number of people in the bar who passed through.  The upstairs was reserved for a private party, which was too bad.  There was some seating in the middle.  Getting in and out was pretty easy.
author: Chris L.

description:
The name Lush Lounge sounds fancy, it is not. More bar like than lounge like...or at least in my opinion.

Sticky floors & loud music. 

Lots of people, so a lot of the seats were taken.
author: Kylie L.

description: One of the main bars on Polk, but it was not super great. The bouncers were a bit unfriendly and rude, and it gets super packed here (good for the bar but not when I'm sober, hah). Probably won't be back. Music wasn't that great either. McTeague and Mayes (has cover) is definitely a better choice if you do come around, but this place is free cover so that's a plus!
author: Amanda C.
