description: I liked this bar a lot! I liked the jukebox and music selections, clean, good seating where you don't feel crammed in, good bartenders and delicious drinks. I will be back here again!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
The "new" Lush Lounge has proven to be an outstanding upgrade. Roomy and spacious, this bar was the bar of choice on NYE. $15 cover wasn't bad and the bar wasn't that overcrowded when we arrived. We found a little spot in the corner of the bar to hang out. Drinks weren't that difficult to get. I had a few of the cucumber ones and they were pretty tasty. My date bought us a bottle of champagne they were offering for $30 for the midnight toast. Good call on his part. Music was a mixed bag which was great. Something for everyone. One thing that sucked was the line for the bathrooms. There was only 1 bathroom each for men and women and it was horrible. 

I had an awesome night at Lush regardless and had one of the best NYEs ever. Even more awesome was my midnight kiss from the one person I most wanted it from.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
This bar was cool and accommodated our need for beverages on a late Monday/early Tuesday morning.  Around midnight, we wanted to find a spot to have some drinks and kick it...well Lush Lounge delivered.  The first thing that caught my fancy was this: when we stood at the bar to order drinks, the bartender looked us in the eyes and he DIDN'T IGNORE US.  Say what now?!  He won my heart.  And he made the best darn Strawberry Bourbon.  The drink was outstanding, reasonably priced, and packed a punch.  So much so, I ordered 2.  Lush also has an upper seating area, which was qqqquuuute.  Unfortunately It was roped off, but we sat near the window and had a great time.

Lemme tell you....Polk street is much more entertaining than any reality show on the market!!!

The downside: the bar only accepts cash.  But, in this day and age of bank gouging, I understand!  The upside: there is an ATM inside the bar, so you don't have to walk outside.

I heard some folks making negative comments about the area and the homeless people hanging outside of the bar.  Here's the thing: its Polk street, its Fillmore, its San Francisco...it's the world we live in.  So, tuck your gangsta' face & don't fool with me card in your coat/purse and flash them when necessary.  Go out and have a good time.  Otherwise, don't bother. #thatisall.
author: Shonda D.

description:
I probably spent a whopping thirty minutes in here after loading up on other alcoholic beverages at another lounge up the street.  I had a good buzz going and that came to an end after Lush Lounge's juke box played Miley Cyrus.  Instant. Buzz. Kill.  Even more so when four twenty-somethings decided to start dancing.  For the record, I was not one of them.   Had I had one more martini at the other place, maybe I would have been the fifth person dancing...or not.

Lush Lounge has one bathroom stall for the women (and one too for the guys of course) and a community sink to share with the boys.  I might come back here if I'm checking out other joints on Polk and want to try one of your specialty martinis...or not.
author: Joanne B.

description:
Loved the old Lush but the new one makes me want to become a lush! I love this new spot it is fabulous and one that should be a destination for the after work crowd or when you just feel like having a cocktail. I am in love with the cucumber kissed cocktail. Don't even know the exact name of it but yummy! In fact the cucumbers can be used for the eyes when finished as you can see from my photo. 

I have been twice in the same weekend and will be back three and four and five and eighteen more times! 

Oh and the help isn't too bad on the eyes either. You may need those cucumbers for the puffiness caused from the eye candy!
author: Scott P.

description:
love the drinks but wasn't fond of their cash only policy (really :/?)
the drinks were fairly priced and decent but the place is quite small.
author: Ru C.

description: The bar tender was clueless, but really nice and accommodating.  My hubby had to tell him how to make a Mai Tai and in return the drink was super strong!  The ambiance is nice, relaxed (it was a Tuesday night) with some good music playing (and for once not too loud to have a conversation!!!!). All in all I enjoyed the visit.
author: Sarah H.

description:
One of the few places open on thanksgiving...

This place is the shit!  And 2 blocks from the house

I would have given it 5 stars as it is one of my favorite neighborhood bars but they don't take credit cards!  And who carries cash anymore these days?!
author: Antoine V.

description:
Eh, it's a cool place to just hang, chill, talk. NOT intended for a girls night out if you want to get down and buck wild, haha! Not a bad night though, just got one drink for all the girls and left to get down, get down.

- Not too much of a line, got in quickly after 11:30pm
- Slide ID before entrance, so if you're not fond of that. Hm, don't know how to help you there.
- Was super crowded, no seats.
- Music was super lame, mixture of retail and elevator music, with a little bit of trance
- No one was really dancing
- Drinks were decently priced, bartenders were cool.
- Cash only bro
author: Christine F.

description: Came to this lounge after dinner. Great vibes and great energy. Even though, this place is decked out with strange pieces of collections, a black/white movie that was playing on the tv on top of the bar-that I didn't know what was playing while a guy at the bar asks me about the movie...and I had no idea what he was talking about...nodded and smiled. Either way, I enjoyed this place so. CASH only but drinks are stiff. So, don't worry....you'll get your money's worth. Stand there a bit, then if you want to mingle with the crowd, you can. I love that it wasn't the stuck up crowd, or the typical bar crowd, or the typical club crowd, it was crowd in between. Thanks Lush Lounge for turning the "in between" crowd to lushes! lol...We had fun!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
If I'm going out around the area, Lush Lounge is definitely my first stop of the night. It's relaxed, cool, and they have fabulous drinks! I love all their champagne cocktails- I haven't ordered a bad one yet! 

Always a mixed crowd, but that's the fun part about San Francisco! 


**cash only!
author: Christine A.

description:
Two stories of drunken hipster bliss in the heart of the Tenderloin.

I've never been here sober, so it's hard to know how accurate my memories of it are.   My drunken memory says that it's always packed and can be a pain in the ass to get a drink from the bar. Once you get a drink the best place to enjoy it is upstairs where there is a little more room. 

Most importantly, the drinks here are always poured with a heavy hand. Order a few and enjoy your memory loss the next morning.
author: Tom L.

description: The bar is pretty okay, but the staff is awful. the bartender not only did scream to me and my friends saying that he could not give us a beer because the bar was going to close in 20 minutes but also he was treating everybody around us pretty bad.
author: Má M.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite spots for a drinky poo!

THe stiffs are drink...

THe bartenders and super cool and very friendly...no attitude.  I've even brought my dog in here and not even the slightest bit of attitude.

the best part its a block from my house so i can stumble home.
author: Ripley B.

description: Its beautiful inside and clean. The drinks are nothing special, pretty average in that area and everyone who works there is an asshole. The end.
author: Dexter H.

description:
It's a chill place if:

You like $3 beers. 

Or you know, you're cold, because their fire place is really nice.
author: Emily D.

description:
Crowded, full of hip people, but cheap enough drinks. I got a Jameson and Ginger for $6 and a special for my friend $8. Cash only -- boo but that's how Polk is.

I'd likely drop by again in the area but truth be told, SF's bar scene is nothing compared to NYC or Chicago.
author: Pam M.

description: Deuchebags galore! If you wanna know where Deuchebags go to breed just step inside of Lush lounge.  The Marina frat bros and wannabe hard techies join together in a beautiful dickweed cocktail to grope on chicks and do their best impression of Frank Gore by just pushing you out of the way when they are weaving through this ridiculously over crowded deuchebag factory.  Even the bartenders are shady, paid for 2 drinks $15, she wouldn't bring my change back.  Instead she just goes to the opposite end of the bar and cleans.  I've seen seen enough V-Neck shirts and taco meat tonight to hold me over until the 2nd coming of John Travolta and Saturday Night Fever.  Won't be back.
author: Vincent P.

description:
I wanted to like this place--One cute bartender..and a nice fire place against the wall...but the crowd and the vibe was way random (weird)...we felt as it we had arrived at twilight zone..

Will go back again during the week and hopefully have a better experience...
author: Mimi T.

description:
I used to live on the same block as the old location.  I was disappointed when I walked up and saw the place torn up.  I thought maybe they had gone out of business.  A quick search on yelp revealed their new location just two blocks north.  

Their new spot retains some of the old kitschy charm in a larger, more chic space.  They have one of those fancy touchscreen jukeboxes now.  Also, the flat screens were playing a football game instead of a black and white film.   The drinks are just as good as always, though.  Hold onto your cash, they still don't take credit cards.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Bar hopping on Polk street for the first time in my life, and it made me nostalgic about this Sex and the City episode I'm going to quote, observe : "I scoured the crowd and saw them, people getting it, people trying to get it, and people who can't get it. No wonder the city doesn't sleep, it's too busy trying to get laid" 

I went with my best friend and elite yelper Tiffany [exclamation point ] Van and we both agreed that we have never seen so many attractive men (that smiled back at us) in the same vicinity. And here I thought so much of anything in the immediate radius only applied to spiders. 

Now on to the actual venue. The place has an upstairs complete with a banister that allows you to look down at the crowd and plot targets like a an electromyography exercise, in other words, you can spot the cute guy or girl and make your way down the stairs and move in for the kill. The place is modeled to resemble an old parlor and the crowd is about as electric as hipster district Valencia and won't fail to disappoint, whether you're trying to get laid or not lol.

Expect it to be crowded and expect problems trying to move through the crowd as blaring music will muffle any propriety such as "excuse me" or even in worst case scenario, they hear you and refuse to move anyway.

The drinks are reasonably priced, and by reasonably I mean reasonable for a place that doesn't list the prices at all on the overhanging menu.

The bartenders have a variable knowledge of pour mans friends and also showcased strong shots for $3 in lemonade dispensers. I'd stay away from those though because they tasted like licorice and gasoline.

One thing you may not know of is the ginger beer which tasted amazing! A strong and refreshing ginger taste, alcohol completely undetectable yet strong enough for a great buzz.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description: Great bartender - love the open window to the outside and blueberry martini is wonderful! Great happy hour even on a saturday!
author: Carrie M.

description: You know, this place isn't bad! I stopped by for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night. The crowd is pretty casual, varying from girls in stilettos dressed to the nines to hipsters who haven't seen soap and water for a week. The bar is cash only, but the drinks are actually reasonably priced. The bartenders are quick and generous with their pours. I actually got a nice buzz off of a single drink! Also, no cover!
author: Leslie H.

description: John was an amazing bartender. He knew everything I wanted to drink and more. Plus he always knows where the chickens from.
author: Stefan T.

description: Came here last night for a friend's going away party, and the 4 star review was for the roomy mezzanine where he had his private party.  Ample space, seating, music, and drinks.  The bottom floor felt pretty much like a standard SF/anywhere bar -- crowded, loud, and for some reason, this section of Polk Street just reminds me of college, haha. :)  Good for private parties though on the mezzanine!
author: Mel G.

description:
Polk Street has changed over the past few years and the not-so-secret word is "lines."

Lines for bars, lines for drinks and, given the influx of a particular breed of clientele, probably lines of coke off dirty toilet seats. 

But hey, I don't judge.

It's only when such lines come between me and my doing of things-that-I-like-to-do-for-fun-whatever-they-may-be do I feel a certain level of impatience. And when even local dive favorites like Hemlock start holding lines out the door, I grow a little disheartened.

Then there's Lush Lounge. With its tropical fans and pretty green plants, the bar's decor appropriately exemplifies its status to me as an oasis in Polk Street's new sea of oontz-oontz and drunken frat kids who can't let go of college. That's not to say Lush Lounge isn't packed with the occasional bro on peak nights. It is. But I never really have to wait to get inside and, once inside, I never really have to wait long to get a drink.

A bar is only as good as its staff, and, like my other local favorite bar, Koko Cocktails, Lush Lounge's expert drink crew are professional and friendly. Svetlana, in particular, is always wonderful to chat with. (Some of you may remember her as the friendly bartender from past Yelp Elite Events.) If you don't know what to order, I suggest you ask her. There is always a list of specials and she makes great recommendations.

So there you go. Decently priced drinks, a tolerable crowd and Svetlana. The faux-lush inside will thank you for it.
author: Keane L.

description: Been to Lush a couple times and its the spot on Polk! I love the variety of the crowd. Upstairs can be a bit crowded at times, but overall, I like this place!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Amazing Mojotos! 'nuff said??

This is a great place for an "I'm too old to rock it like I'm 21 but don't want to accept that my friends are getting married, procreating and being role models" birthday party. You can reserve a space for an event through Lush Lounge.

FYI: The bar is cash only.
author: Johanna W.

description:
This place is even BETTER when its not busy. Their happy hours are pretty legit. There are lots of drinks that they offer and all sound and taste delicious! 

The sweet tea vodka drink: It wasn't on the happy hour menu, but it is happy hour price: ask the bartender if you are interested. Sweet, not super alcoholic and comes in those cool glass jars 
Agave Margarita: strong! lots of salt and fresh lime
Mojito: delicious! One of my favorites: you can taste the fresh mint leaves and they give a good portion of alcohol. 
Cucumber gimlet: tasty but has a strong alcohol taste 

Con: felt like they put more ice than drink in the cups. 

Tables along the windows are WEIRD. They are placed very far away from the chairs. But other than that, it was  warm, cozy, chill and fun.
author: Amy L.

description: Great little spot on Polk if you're tired of your usual jack and diet. Come here for a specialty cocktail with champagne, bourbon, strawberry purée and a cucumber. They've got about a 15-20 to choose from . A drink will cost you $10. They have very few tables so come early if you want a seat on a Saturday. A line also forms at the door on a busy night .
author: Viktoriya Z.

description: The name is kind of misleading, I was expecting plush and velvet and white sofas, but it was more of a dive feel. Came in on a Saturday and it got crowded fast! Good thing there was an upstairs with more tables and seating. Drinks were pretty strong, some even came in cute maison jars. Music was mostly from early 2000, I mean Getting Hot in Here by Nelly is a classic haha. There's only a single toilet for the ladies, so expect to wait in line!
author: Karen D.

description:
Eh....Whatever.

Went here on a Thursday night and the place was pretty empty.  No music, just vibes.  The drinks are okay but the white bald guy bartender dude was a douche.  Manager, if you are reading this, please fire him as he does not know how to treat women.  He lost a star for your lounge.
author: Alex G.

description:
2 things make me really happy when it comes to bars: 1) 90s hip hop and 2) cool,specialty drinks that are not overpriced.

Lush Lounge, while a pretty small space, nails it. They play the down and dirty 90s hip hop I love and grew up listening to. Yes, the kind where you can't help but belt out the lyrics at the top of your lungs. Awesome.

Plus, they have really cool drinks. I had a blood orange cosmo and some lemon-raspberry concoction, both of which were delicious and only $7 each. You really can't beat that price. 

Only downside is that you have to pay with cash, which I never seem to have on me.
author: Shreya O.

description: Watching the sunday night football game here. Really cool spot, dive bar atmosphere but with a lot of space. The drinks here are good and the free popcorn is pretty cool too!
author: John H.

description:
small crowded and cash only... this is not the 1920s.. even the least high tech places take square.. what is this!?

At least drinks are fairly priced.. and we were able to catch the end of a couple olympics races during our crusade through polk friday...
author: James H.

description:
I love going to Lush Lounge for Happy Hour! They have a HH EVERYday. Tuesday through Saturday its 3-7, Sunday and Monday I think starts even earlier. They have a big list of the Happy Hour cocktails AND how much they cost. Is it just me that likes to know how much my drink is going to cost...? Anyways my absolute favorite is their Blueberry Martini. Its $5 and strong and amazing. Lastly and most importantly, the Happy Hour bartender, Sammy is super nice and attentive. Easy on the eyes too ;)

I think their non HH prices go up to $7 which still is a pretty good deal.
author: Kristen R.

description:
Meh. Would not return. There are way better places in SF/south bay/peninsula. Went there on a Saturday and they were playing the news on TV. I'm all for the news but at a bar/lounge?

- The crowd. Lots of dude bros. Kind of a skeevy feel.
- No dance floor but it was way too loud to have a conversation. Ended up spending the whole night yelling at people who were a foot away from me. Also, not enough seating nor standing room. What's the point of having really loud (also, bad) music playing when no one is dancing and no one can talk?
- Only one bathroom. 

+ No cover.
author: Jo W.

description:
If I lived in one of the houses on Scenic Dr. in Carmel by the Sea or Pebble Beach my house would be named Lush Lounge, so fitting.  Yes, a lot of the houses by the beach have names like "Sea Urchin" or "Periwinkle".

Awesome bar with a kick-back and relax feel. It was cold out so I stood with my drink in hand by the fireplace and it warmed me to my bones, perfect.

The bartender was very warm and inviting and seriously pleasing to the eye. I enjoyed a shot of Blood Orange infused vodka and a glass of Champagne. Great place to get to know someone (lady friends were flirting it up with the boys) and thus place works because it not too rowdy or loud so you can hear everyone around you. Killer bar to chillax.
author: Shiho F.

description: Chris is great! We had our engagement party there and reserved the upper level. He was responsive, accommodating and easy to work with. Sometimes he can be a little slow responding to email. He allowed up to cater food there at no charge, we had set-up time and space and he also provided tables. He provided us with a ticketing system and let me know when I reached my limit for the night, again very accommodating with the value of tickets, coordination, etc.  He is an honest guy...House specialty drinks were good....Ambient is great..cozy space. Only critic I have of the place is seems I didn't hear the music well, maybe they forgot to turn it up...Overall great experience.
author: Raj K.

description:
Very nice.

I like this place but I wished it wasn't cash only and so expensive. I dropped 60 on drinks, felt pretty steep for not enough buzz.. Crowd is cool. Seating is ok. No dance floor. Decent diversity. I love the pizza joints around the area. Perfect for late night eats after a belly full of alcohol.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Dark, low key, sensual, sultry, $4.50 fernet shots, small up and close tables make it more of a intimate date spot than a place for 6 of the fellas for an after work happy hour.

*Mental Note*, add Lush Lounge to the repertoire.

Lushalicious
author: Earl G.

description: Not a huge fan of the going out on Polk st. scene, but I have to admit I generally have enjoyed my times at Lush. I never plan to go here, but it always has a good vibe, the there is a good variety in the drinks and drink specials which aren't too expensive, and the atmosphere is always pretty fun and lively. It's got a bit of a divey feel to it without making you feel gross. It's got a fun vibe without being a rager crazy place. Would recommend.
author: Milan T.

description: No cover, no line, not crowded, chill! It was easy to order drinks and they have sangria ($5-$7?) and other lemon kind of shots for $3. They have huge TVs that were playing soccer when I went last night (Friday night) and the music is sick here! Old school rap and R&B! There are tables to sit and chill at. It's pretty chill and plan to come next time!
author: Veronica A.

description: The lady bartender was friendly. She mixed my surfer on acid pretty good. I know I'm at a great bar/lounge when the jukebox has a excellent amount of music selection in general and a great selection of electronic music including some dubstep!
author: Gerard Y.

description: Chill spot to have some good conversation meet new people and have a drink. The bartenders are nice and make good drinks! Can get crowded but that's standard for the bars on Polk Street. Also no cover!!
author: Celestine U.

description: All I can say is if you have a lot of money go there. It's over priced and drinks suck.  It's very over crowded that you can barely move.
author: Marcos C.

description:
Cool, nice place to chill, small area, but good enough.  Has a good, mixed crowd.  Drinks are decently priced, had some cheap drinks as well.  Tried the 3 shots of SoCo Lime for $12, but seemed to not have enough alcohol, so kind of a waste.  Had other unique drinks too, and well priced, like a blood orange infused vodka shot.  Bartenders are nice too, don't need to fight your way in to get eye contact.  

Only thing, no real dance floor, just a bunch of people standing around and chilling, hence it is a bar.  And BEWARE:  CASH ONLY!!!  

Other than the cash only thing, it was a fun night!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This place was fine.
Vodka tonic was good.
Drunk guy trying to feed me cupcake icing out the palm of his hand was gross.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
This pretty much sums up Lush for me: The biggest Pimm's Cup EV-ER! 

Seriously, for $7 it was well worth the cost. Plus the bartender there is super friendly and attentive! They have a great menu of cocktails, sangria, beer on tap, and blood orange infused vodka. Don't forget it's cash only (well if you forget, there is an ATM inside). 

It was pretty laid back and quiet on a Tuesday night- I enjoyed the calm atmosphere, & the tropical decor is sort of cool! Looks like they have an upstairs as well (wasn't open on my visit). 

I didn't visit the bathrooms, but I swear it sounded like people were using a giant blow dryer back there to dry off? 

I shall be back Lush to drown in a giant cup of Pimm's!
author: Catherine O.

description: It was a fun Sat evening, lively crowd... A lot of jostling though when it gets crowded, still fun to hang out.
author: Tanz B.

description: Probably caught the bartenders at a bad night. Watermelon shooters were pretty nasty.
author: Amy D.

description: I love this bar!  Best happy hour on Polk st!
author: John T.

description:
Since moving to the SF area from Alabama there have been countless nights where I found myself missing spiked sweet tea.  They just don't taste the same at home.  Lush has Sweet Tea aaaaand it's even served in a mason jar!  So perfect.

Came here on a Friday for happy hour and it wasn't over crowded, bartenders were really nice, and prices were super reasonable.
author: Emma G.

description:
Solid place to grab some drinks, assuming that it's not bursting at the seams with people.  The bartenders are generally friendly, and they have a number of frozen alcohol drinks to offer, which are pretty refreshing when it gets packed inside.  The drinks are fairly priced and well made, which is a good way to make you feel better while you wait for an opening to sit somewhere.

The crowd is rather eclectic both inside and out - they have a lot of scattered memorabilia and decorations on the walls, and the patrons range from 40-50 year old tourists looking to enjoy the local nightlife to the usual twenty-somethings bar hopping on Polk.  You'll even see some Marina folk overflow to the area, as well as patrons from the Castro as well.

Sound, chill place to grab some drinks...but if only someone could explain to me how this isn't a "bar" since there really isn't much space to "lounge"...
author: Mike L.

description:
I came here on a Saturday night with some friends after stopping by R bar. We beat the rush because after we showed up, a lot more started showing up and lines were forming outside! I checked in on foursquare and got a deal for a $2 rum cocktail. My friend just showed my phone to the other bartender and she got that deal too. It was pretty strong for a $2 drink so if you're sober, take advantage of that while you can!

Also, I saw that there were $5 raspberry lemon drops (or something like that) so it seemed like there were some good deals with drinks. 

There's space for dancing downstairs, but the music is just alright. Not too many songs I'd dance to myself. When it got crowded, we got tired of standing there with nowhere to sit so we decided to see if we could go upstairs. To our surprise, it was almost empty up there so we got some seats at a tall table. It was more chill up there since it wasn't as crowded. 

I like the decor. It's a nice place. I just wish it wasn't so crowded and that the music was better.
author: Connie Y.

description: I spent about 20 minutes here, which was about 15 minutes too long. Was skeptical about their quality of drinks after surveying the decor, but was assured they made "fantastic cocktails." Ordered a gin martini (this was probably my mistake) and it was a mouthful of vermouth. Seriously just horrifyingly bad. My friends ordered a round of Grey Goose vodka tonics and couldn't finish theirs either! On top of that, Lush only accepts cash. SERIOUSLY??
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Cash only!

~ $6 per drink, and they have really good specialty drinks..try the SWEET TEA

They play good music (last Saturday I heard alternative, country, bit of hip hop, and rock), and they have upstairs seating so you're not stuck around the bar. Glad I discovered this place. Thanks Yelp!
author: Elisa C.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this aptly named watering hole. It was Friday night on a Halloween weekend and the vibe just seemed super positive and friendly. The Yelp folks reserved the mezzanine for the evening's DYL and I'm really glad I decided to go despite my noncommittal "sounds cool" reply.

Decent selection of beer, excellent array of spirits and friendly bar staff. My drink of choice to start the evening was G&T with Hendrick's Gin. Bartender #1 charged me $5 for my first drink. Bartender #2 charged me $8 for my second. When I complained about this bizarre price disparity, I was informed that all top-shelf drinks are eight bucks. Sorry if I ratted you out barkeep #1, thanks for the discount!

On tap I spotted Deschutes Mirror Pond Pale Ale, Chimay and some kind of IPA. Definitely three choices I can work with! 

I went outside for some fresh air at one point and a drag queen in a banana costume flirted with me. Gotta love Polk Street on Halloween!
author: Nate R.

description: Came here at 4 pm on a Friday afternoon for some Happy Hour drinks and tried the Cucumber Ginger Gimlet. I had two of them and it was DELISH!  The bartender was friendly and helpful which was a plus.The crowd on that afternoon was pretty quiet though so I would like to come back and give this place another try.
author: Claudine V.

description:
I miss the tranny hookers from the old location. 

Don't get me wrong - I totally get them moving. They probably do 10 times as much business being a block north. And they still retain that whole edge of polk street not quite as douche-y vibe. And it's a bigger cooler space.
author: Matt W.

description: Lush Lounge is not a place that is generally my scene, but the drinks were good, the bar tenders friendly (one went out of his way to bring me back my sweater that fell on the floor) and though crowded, it wasn't too bad. I got the sense that it's a very popular place for singles. Cash only, but there's an ATM in the bar.
author: Kate B.

description:
This is a cool venue to rent out for parties or events. They provide a 30 person seating area at the front of the bar or a bigger area in the mezzanine. I went for their blood orange cosmo, which might have had a little too much bitters because it was bitter and sweet at the same time. I did enjoy it, but one was enough for me.
I also really liked the music they were playing. It's not the normal dancing music on the radio, which is refreshing. The place had people coming and going all night. All of my friends had a great time and I heard the mojito was delicious!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Free cover, good energy and busy! Drinks are a bit pricey and they only take cash. Interesting lighting, dim and rose colored. Plenty of space to move around and also a separate lounge upstairs -- not sure if it's reserved for VIP but we went up there close to closing.
author: Briget P.

description:
Had a joint birthday celebration just last night. It was really good because 

1. Great drinks! 
2. Love the chill and laid back atmosphere
3. They were nice to offer us table since we have a huge party 

Would most definitely come back here again for a chill evening out.
author: Catherine T.

description:
We were there on a Saturday night (some of us 10 could call themselves even "regulars" at the bar) and it was medium full I would say. Atmosphere and drinks are decent, nothing fancy, still kinda pricy (except happy hour) BUT the service at the bar and especially by the blowsy guy cleaning up the glasses from tables WAS BEYOND BAD, it was probably the worst "service" in the last 10 months in SF I experienced (and I go and eat out a lot). Why?

- The bar tending girl was at least only plain arrogant and unskilled.

- Yet, the blowsy cleaner took the biscuit. There was no pre-story or history to his behavior / no personal issues whatsoever. That is why I think the owner should know about the following behavior of him.

He pushed people (not only us 10) out of the way before cleaning the table and did not even excuse himself. It was so sad to see him being even extremely rude AFTER being clumsy. He touched and literally cussed people out and said that this behavior was normal in a public bar. He even told the security to remove the barrel table in front of us 10 people and made up poor excuses that they "need" the table outside of the bar where 2 other barrel tables were already uselessly standing around. No apologies, not even a try to talk things out. All that seemed normal for him and "customer oriented".
Well, we didn't think so. And so did the other guests around us... So, this location has seen better days and luckily there SO MANY OTHER GOOD PLACES that value customers, are fun and deserve your hard earned money and tips. 

I STRONGLY ADVICE YOU NOT TO COME HERE, you will be greatly disappointed. Cheers, George
author: Georg R.

description:
Whenever I don't feel like waiting the interminable 20-30min until I get home to drown my sorrows and/or the voices in my head encouraging me to kick puppies, I'll often wander over to Lush Lounge for a frou-frou drink or 3.  I nearly had a heart-attack when they "closed" for awhile as I had just discovered the place, but my fears were unfounded since they moved just up the street to a much bigger location a few weeks later.   

Like many places on Polk, it can get insanely crowded on Friday & Saturday nights, and it can also get incredibly warm so I tend to go early on those days, but happy hour is otherwise pretty chill and they're open in the afternoons (at least on weekends anyway - it'd be nice to find out for myself if they're open during the day as it'd make work more entertaining...for me anyway...until I'm unceremoniously fired which would be bad...but I digress).  

Nice staff, solid drinks, decent prices...I'm always going back.
author: Sus... B.

description:
We went here before a concert and really liked the ambiance.  The drinks were mixed really well (believe me - a LOT of places don't know how to make a proper drink) and the bartender was really nice and cool.  Bummer they don't have a funky food item (like chips or cheese curls) I think that would make it kitchier.  

There weren't a lot of people when we got there (again, before a concert) but I will have to check it out later at night when I'm back in SFO.

All in all, great drink combinations.
author: Susan L.

description:
Nice friendly neighborhood bar where dogs can come hangout. By dogs I don't mean guys. 

Happy Hour is 7 days a week!!

Round 1:
Decided on the Sky Cucumber Ginger Gimlet! Probably the best Gimlet I've had in SF. Gimlet was nicely shaken and frosty with little tiny ice bits.

Round 2:
Mojitos were pretty good! Bartender was on it.

Overall, this was a nice place for Happy Hour. They have a warm fireplace. Best seat in the house! I will definitely be back. Drinks are well mixed at an awesome price.

Bathrooms are nice and modern. They have communal sinks outside the mens and womens bathroom...so you can wash your hands and maybe strike up a conversation with a cute guy. 

Don't forget to bring you CASH ONLY. There is an ATM inside.
author: Cellina B.

description: Love the sweet tea here! The atmosphere is nice and isn't too douchey. Wish they took credit cards, though.
author: Michael S.

description:
Lush Lounge is one of my fav. spots when my BF and I visit SF. It's one of the first bars we went to when traveling together after we first met. Four years later it still is. Very tasty martinis and the ambiance is perfect. Very romantic. Love, love, love it. Good times and good memories. :) 
As a matter of fact my profile pic is a tasty martini from this lovely place. The owner is very nice and there is def. no pretentiousness in this bar. Do yourself a favor and check it out.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
When I see "lounge" I don't think of jampacked like sardines can't get through the door. I am not into shitshow bars, but it may have just been the night we were there. I like the decor and the space of this place, but I don't like the name. We only stayed for one drink, so I can't really review it much.

Communal sink in the bathroom is a little awkward. Hello, the bathroom is where the girls go to do girl talk!!!
author: Carrie G.

description:
The new location of Lush Lounge is one of my favorite places to dog watch.

(No.  That isn't some sort of euphemism.)

Day or night, the people watching from inside the bar out the big, often open front windows is only average.  Even from the second floor level homosapien activity is predictable.  However, just after opening until early evening, the various breeds of owner and staff dogs are a pleasure to watch scamper after tennis balls, lay about huge as their human, or to be greeted by at the door with a canine smile.  Yes, yes.  No matter your preference, the bartenders are usually younger and easy on the eye, the drinks are nicely made and poured, the set decoration eclectic, the old movies still playing (thank goodness!) along with sports on another screen.  Still, the dogs--not too many at once and well-behaved--provide a true element of happy.

And I'm a cat person.
author: Poet D.

description:
Intoxicated me and cell phones have a long history of becoming separated and last night was no exception. Lush Lounge was my last stop on what was a really fun Polk street bar crawl and somehow I managed to leave my cell phone and jacket at the bar. Upon realizing this today, I stopped by the bar fully expecting them to tell me they did not have it, per my usual experience. Fortunately, the incredibly nice owner had kept my things safe and happily returned them to me. Additionally, the patrons who were there at the time were so genuine and friendly that it made me want to hang out for a while. 

Overall, I think this is a great bar. It's spacious, beautifully designed, reasonably priced, and well-run. I highly recommend trying it out if haven't been and definitely say hello to the owner for me.
author: Mandi A.

description:
We strolled on into this place, after a YEE that ended nearby... 

Great place to catch a football game! Although, I couldn't hear why a call was called, and the Closed Captioning wasn't on... 

they have a lot of $5 specials... the BLACKBERRY BUBBLES was tasty, like a mimosa with blackberry juice instead of OJ. 

the Blueberry martini, however, tasted like dimetapp... next! 

overall a nice place to catch up with a small or even a big group of friends. the atmosphere is definitely inviting, and not pretentious... nice place. :)
author: Judy N.

description: Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We ordered drinks at the bar and right after I drank my drink I needed a lime right after so when I saw that they were in front of me in their separated trays, I grabbed one but the bartender (tall lady with blonde hair) shoved my hand aside or should I say almost slapped my hand aside and started yelling at me!!!! First of all, I didn't know that I wasn't aloud to do that. Second of all, NEVER touch a customer or YELL at a customer. She was the rudest bartender I've ever dealt with. With that being said, I'm never going there again and I'll make sure to spread my experience at Lush Lounge!
author: Tida P.

description: On my first night in San Francisco, my friends and I dropped our bags at the hotel and ran out to the bars down the street on Polk. The first bar we walked into was Lush Lounge. It was packed (good sign) and had a very cool, casual feel I'm not used to. Wait, I can wear THIS and still go out? Folks, we're not in LA anymore!! I ordered my favorite drink, a kamikaze on the rocks, and I forget how much it was now, but I remember being shocked at how cheap it was! Maybe $8-10? It was good too!! The place was so popping that it was a bit hard to move about or find space, but I definitely recommend coming here if you just want to chill and have a drink. Granted, you probably will be standing with your friends as you chill, but regardless, real chill and cool atmosphere. Friendly crowd and cheap drinks, go!! When you're done here, walk out and visit the numerous other bars next to it, across from it, etc.
author: Angela H.

description: Friendly staff, and a local watering hole during the week.  It can get hopping Friday and Saturday nights.
author: Patrick P.

description:
Out of all the Polk Street bars I visited one night, I have to say that the boys at this bar were the cutest. Except for one guy who thought he was Barney from How I Met Your Mother. 

I would have really liked to stay and drink... but you just made it impossible! Let me see if I can explain this well: There is a divider (was it a table or something?) in the middle of the space parallel to the bar. The space from the bar to the divider was about 20 ft? Maybe more but I couldn't tell with all the people crammed together. This meant that in order to have access to the bar you would have to maneuver your way around the divider. Unfortunately, Californians are lazy and they refuse to leave the bar after they've received their drink making this little area a freaking mosh pit. This divider also conveniently located in the walkway to the bathroom. 

I really wanted to stay, Lush, but you just weren't laid out right.
author: Angelina K.

description:
This place is nice, but really NOISY. My friend and I sat by the fire, but had to yell to each other the whole time. This place seems better for groups rather than an intimate date because of the noise. 

The drinks were good though. If you go before 7pm, you can get a delicious blueberry tini for $5. Yum.
author: vira k.

description: Ahh, I love this place! Every drink on the menu sounds delicious so if you're feeling a cocktail, I'd definitely check this place out. Despite being busy, the bartenders are really attentive and I didn't have a problem flagging one down. The only downsides were that it gets really crowded (a lot of times I just end up skipping Lush when we're out on Polk because it's way too crowded) and they only take cash.
author: Alli Q.

description:
The big wooden doors, and open-window seating area is what lured me in here. What a great happy hour. They always have some booze pouring out of these spigot-pitcher things during HH. It's around 7$ for a shot and a beer. 

The upstairs location is kinda cool also. Lots of seating. I really enjoyed the champagne blackberry cocktail (and I'm typically a bourbon kinda guy). Right next to hemlock, blur, mayes and McTeagues. Another great bar to add to your pub crawl.
author: David N.

description:
This lounge was real crowded on a Saturday night.  I guess that's the point right?  Well, I thought it would be a more chill bar, but i guess not.  The drinks were cheap and yummy, but it was an adventure to get there. People didn't know how to move...or was it that they were too busy making out with each other? There were like two different hardcore duos lip-locking it up.  Also, this one guy stripped down to his undies and followed a girl out.  

Maybe I'm not hip to the single and ready to mingle scene, but all i wanted to do was have a drink and celebrate a friend's birthday. Maybe I'll go again.
author: Lisa X.

description:
I went to Lush Lounge simply because all of the other bars in the area had lines down the block. I used to live in the area and had walked past it many times but never gave it much thought. 

It was much bigger inside than I expected, and had a pretty good crowd. The drinks were great, especially the Alabama something or other, which had sweet tea vodka, my favorite! Highly recommend this place if you're looking for somewhere new and different.
author: Megan S.

description:
Not really impressed with this place, but then again, I went on a busy Saturday night with a group of people. Just your typical "lounge"...except there really wasn't much lounging? Hardly a place to stand at the bar, let alone sit. Good beers on tap, nothing too crazy, not sure what the prices are as I did not pay. I may be back to check out happy hour but I won't be making an effort otherwise! Clean bathrooms were good...but only one handwashing sink? 

GTL dude GTL
author: Leigh W.

description: enter and first table at entrance a group of hipsters....skinny jeans, big oversized glasses, shirts too small, etc...hipsters, right?...fairly empty early evening...standard and wooden bar....enter a flash mob of twenty plus with a mission...a mission to drink and be foolish....pbr cheap before seven pm...hence a pbr boat race...a lush!...some spillage, human totem poles up to the second floor loft area, dancing, shots and more...bartenders cool with smirks...non-fancy great happy hour bar 'til seven pm...
author: Hen A.

description:
Lush Lounge is becoming one of my favorite places to grab a margarita. They are really tasty and during happy hour only $6.00! 
The atmosphere is very relaxed and simple - including the staff. 
At night they have the fire place going and during the day the place opens up with the huge Polk St. windows. 
I'm sure they make other great drinks but I keep returning for the margaritas!
author: Janell D.

description:
My homegirl decided to celebrate her birthday at Lush Lounge last Friday night, so I went there for the first time and I must admit I had a pretty good time there.  Our party was chilin' in the upstairs area which, in spite of being a small space, suited our gathering pretty well seeing that there was adequate room to accommodate all of my my friend's guests.  However, the bar area is rather small and was pretty cramped, mainly because of the set-up; there is a counter right in the area by the bar, which creates a small space on both sides of it that one must navigate through in order to get to the upstairs lounge or the restrooms.  

The fact that there was no cover charge and that the dress code doesn't seem to be too strict were both definite pluses.  Although I didn't try many different drinks, the tequila sunrise I had was tasty; since I'm a lightweight, it also gave me the buzz i needed to relax.  The bottom line is that I would say the Lush Lounge is a cool place for hitting up when you're in the mood for chillin' with your friends and enjoying a drink.
author: Tito The Incognito ..

description:
I was never that crazy about the old lush. Overpriced, cramped, semi-friendly service. But the new spot is straight pimp. The entrance is akin to a Scottish castle and inside the space is intimate, cozy and dare I say romantic. Then again I was was with the amazingly sexy Bradley P. and the wine and conversation reminded me of the week we spent staring into each others eyes in a chateau in Switzerland. Okay... snapping out of that, the bartenders seem to be alot more polished and professional and the overall improvement to this business is a 180 degree turnaround. A great date spot or even a good spot to pop some vicodin, sit by the fire and reminisce on hot Swiss nights. 

Hot Swiss Nights... Can I trademark that?
author: Dru P.

description:
John (the bartender) made us a killer martini.  Don't remember what it was but it was full octane and chocolatey.  Good thing I was already buzzed to not be able to taste the alcohol anymore.  It's a fun place to get drunk.

And yeah.  That's all I remember.  Move along.  Nothing to see here.
author: Henry L.

description:
Had my 25th birthday celebration here. Chris and his staff (bar tenders) we're very nice and accommodating! I was able to have the upstairs and it is BEAUTIFUL!!! They were also flexible with the music which was a plus and made my gathering even more fabulous. The drink prices were very REASONABLE!!! My guest had to have spent over $400 lol but hey it was all worth it and we partied right! 

Oh! We came on a Sunday night (day before labor day) - parking was easy to find and the people (customers) we're also really friendly

Definitely wouldn't mind coming back :)
author: Cee J.

description:
Love the new location of Lush.  Honestly, I had probably only been to the old location less than a handful of times, but I looooove the new place. It's about 3 times as big, the bathroom situation is a lot better, and they even have an upstairs.  The music selection consisted of a little bit of everything, from B Spears to MGMT, to the Yeah Yeah Yeah, and even some oldies were thrown into the mix!

The bartenders (all four of them) were attentive, didn't make you wait long at all, and were all HOT, in very different ways.  My g/f and I walk in after an extended happy hour and burritos and became angered when we find it's cash only!!! WTF! Why are most of the bars on lower Polk cash only? Super annoying.  So we walk outside, and one of the adorable bartenders follows us outside, tells us to take cash out of their ATM and he'll charge us a $1 less per drink. Pull my arm, OK done.  My friend and I were drunk and he was cute, so we went back in and took him up on his offer.
author: Jenny W.

description:
I've only been here for Happy Hour. I'm talking 3 ish till about 7 (ish.) 
The HH specials are the tops. If you don't get the $6 cucumber gimlet, you lose. I know enough to understand that venues don't put candy everyone wants on sale. They push the stuff they need to sell. But the cucumber gim looks as good as it tastes. I took pictures of the frothy green goodness and everyone in my social network was perving it. I mean... making people think your cocktails are better than theirs is always a good time.
author: Lianne S.

description:
Lush Lounge has slowly become one of my go-to places when I'm barhopping on Polk.  The layout is cute..I like how they have a good amount of seating up and downstairs.  I love their chocolate martini!  It tastes like a milkshake but it's deceivingly strong for how girly the drink is.  

They have a foursquare special but I remember the drink not being that great...can't expect much for $2 though.
author: Jane N.

description:
During out night out for Last Comic Standing we went bar hopping on Polk and Van Ness.  Lush Lounge was the best bar we stopped at.  It was early around 5 or so but the bar was lively but not crazy, the music was good but you were still able to talk, rustic bar, brick wall, upper level with a very nice clean atmosphere.  The place was nicely decorated with lots of chotchkies but everything was show cased perfectly.  And for happy hour pricing you can't beat $2 Tecate beers in the city.

Next time I'm back in that area I must try one of their special martini's.  They had flavors I haven't seen before, like cucumber and melon.
author: Dianne M.

description:
Seriously one of my all-time fav's, this place is awesome b/c it has two modes, crazy busy w/ peeps on a Sat & Fri night, or chill'n and down to earth on every other night, the fact that they don't hassle you at the door w/ ID's and crap helps but the real gem is the fact they have a kick ass bartender in Barry, who also has a thick Irish accent, overall the place makes you feel at home while still feeling like an upper class bar/lounge.
Go there, get a nice Old Fashioned for yourself and a Sweet Tea cocktail for your lady. Oh but remember, Cash Only... Yo*
author: Sean V.

description:
Went on a Tuesday night. Great drinks, reasonably priced. Easily smashed on an agave margherita and a couple of yummy blueberry martinis (includes real blueberry)!

Good crowd, nice upstairs area, friendly bar staff. Not sure if it was just the night we went or if it's every night - but weird music choices going on. From feet thumping pop rock to growly metal playing. Added to the fun though.
author: Lisette P.

description:
With the exception of the tweaker chic who walked us in and started asking us what we liked...  this place was pretty freakin awesome.  Really,  who the hell are you and why are you asking us these wierd questions?  You obviously don't work here.  

As my friends and I ditched the wierd chic (with a backpack) and made our way to the bar, we were mesmerized by the efficiency and the generosity of the bartender pouring our drinks.  Seriously, he poured nothing but vodka into our vodka tonics and dashed it with a little tonic as a top off rather than a mix...  Dang, this is going to be a hell of a night!

The place was pretty packed due to a birthday party going on upstairs but the atmosphere was fun and inviting.  Definitely a cooler spot to socialize compared to the other  bars in the area.
author: Danny L.

description:
Great chill lounge that isn't very packed (at least when I went.)

If you are drunk with your buddies (because this probably your last stop in your barhopping) and you feel like having a deep, friendly and incoherent conversation on jurisprudence.

Then this is your place. Grab a drink and sit down. Just remember that you still gotta get home.
author: Alexis R.

description:
They told me that I couldn't fit 6 puppies in my thong, but who's laughing now?

Not me or the puppies, that's for sure.

Listen:

This is the kind of thing that you too might try after leaving the [aptly named] Lush Lounge. 

Their drinks are stiffer than [insert cliche] on a honeymoon.

But their real charm is the space. The design and decorating are amazing, complete with a fireplace and spacious seating.

Reminds me of that week that Bradley P, Dru P, and I spent in a chateau in Switzerland.
author: Justin S.

description:
Isn't it strange that the bartender doesn't know they have a particular single malt whisky, and so says to the patron after the patron asks for it, "We don't have that", to which the patron replies, "Yes, you do", and proceeds to walk around to the other end of the bar to point it out to the bartender?  Huh.  Isn't it also strange that the patron feels he was overcharged for his selection?
But, hey.  They've got great hanging stuff in there which made for some cool photos...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Dropped in one night about two months ago while I was on vacation. Affordable and expertly made mixology-oriented cocktails. I had a ginger-cucumber gimlet (wasn't available with gin, only a house vodka infusion) that was fantastic as well as a delicious sazerac. Will be sure to drop by again later this month.

The only cons I can think of are the cash-only business and that the music was a little overbearing the night I was there.
author: Vicente L.

description:
So a couple weeks ago decided to do happy hour at a different location than the usual places in and around FiDi. We decided lets do Polk St. Look online and decided on Lush Lounge. 

Place wasn't packed for happy hour which was actually a good thing since we had our own group and they had a bunch of great happy hour specials and the drinks were great too. Bartendars were quick and poured great drinks. The space is decent with like a wood theme which was cool. The cool thing is if you can snag a table by the window on a nice day you can sit with the windows open.

So good drinks + good happy hour+ many other bars in the area to hop around to = a great time. 

The funny thing is our group left and kinda dispersed depending on what they wanted to eat for dinner and we stopped in a couple other bars but we all ended up back at Lush Lounge.
author: Hyung L.

description: This is definitely a hidden gem during happy hours.  Beyond the large, medieval doors, you'll find a cool place to chill by the fire place with barrels as tables and stools to grab a few drinks.  The place is hip with a rustic feel that gives it its charm.  More importantly, the service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  The bartender can find a drink or create a cocktail that works for just about anyone.  Parking is tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Came here with some newly single girlfriends to scope out the sea of male prey, and boy, was the sea vast.  The male to female ratio at this place was about 5:1, and yet my girlfriends somehow left with their dignity intact.

Bachelorette #1 wanted someone tall, dark, and handsome.  What a surprise.

Bachelorette #2 wanted someone she'd like to include as a character in her book.

Bachelorette #3 wanted someone hairy.  Really, really hairy so she could have something to grab.

I just wanted a stiff drink for less than $20.  I love the Alabama Sweet Tea and the bouncer who told me I look just like my 16-year-old self on my driver's license.  I'll drink to that.  That and a bar bathroom I actually want to pee in!
author: Jen L.

description:
I don't know why my friends LOVE lush lounge.  I swear they end up here every week.  It's not so bad, but I'm not a big fan of the crowd of the Polk street bars in general.  It's always a bunch of fratty college boys who can't strike up a good conversation.  However, I do like how Lush is set up.  We always end up sitting on the upper level with our group and it's good times there.  

Helpful hint:  If you check in on foursquare, you get a rum and coke for $2.  It is STIFF, so beware!  It tastes like shit, but if you want a cheap buzz, then this is a good deal.
author: Kimba V.

description:
The first stop on my list of the Polk Street nightlife has to be Lush Lounge. Great drinks, great bartenders, and a nice mix of people that make this place a great lounge to start the night off right. I went on a Saturday night and the place was packed with a little elbow room to wiggle around but that didn't hinder me from getting my drink in a good amount of time. If you really want to get away from the crowd you can actually go upstairs area which overlooks the bar. It's much more relaxing there and you can carry on a conversation there without screaming in your date's ear. Up above the bar you'll see the list of mixed drinks and cocktails that are their specialty. If you choose any of those, I assure you that you won't be disappointed. Most of the drinks are girly, I'll admit but damn are they delicious.

Overall great place with good drinks that are reasonably priced. The bartenders are sweethearts and know you're there. Next time I head over there I am definitely going to try whatever they have on display on their drink menu. And you should too!
author: Leslie K.

description:
I recently went here for a friends bday, and was less than impressed. We happen to be here on a night that was very busy, which was unfortuante b/c this place might be cool on a random week night. 

The selection of alcohol and beer was solid, my boyfriend was happy with all the bourbons they carried. However, the bartenders were horrible. My gin gimlet on the rocks was made different everytime I ordered it, and never was made correctly. Also, the prices were different every time we ordered, like the price was at the whim of whatever bartender we could flag down. 

The place was way to noisy, the music was loud, and it was near impossible to carry on a conversation without screaming. I don't mid loud music, at a club where people are dancing, but not in a bar/lounge scene. No one was very friendly, and everyone was in a bad mood from constantly getting bumped.

There are just too many cool places in SF to go here again....
author: mary ann b.

description:
Wow, as if it weren't bad enough that this place only takes cash, Lush also takes short-changing customers to a whole new level. I came here last night and handed my bartender a $100 bill for two drinks -- she came back with $8 in change... Needless to say, I got the ADDITIONAL $80 back, but that was just criminal. 

Summary - This is San Francisco, there are plenty of other bars to visit where you won't get ripped off and that take credit. Go elsewhere.
author: Simon L.

description: This is a pretty cool dive bar. One of favorites for happy hour with plenty of drink specials. The music is usually a mix of rock, pop and rap... and the crowd is pretty chill. It gets kinda loud inside but that's probably from ppl trying to talk over the music. Only downside about this place is it's CASH ONLY. There's an ATM near the door, so it's not too much of an inconvenience.
author: Marie T.

description:
What a cool, hip, nice place. I've walked past this place millions of times and never thought to go in. The old ugly super cheap sign sent out vibes of dirty, divey, sketchiness. The GNC and the dark doorway don't help.

A few weeks ago I actually looked inside and saw a good mix of people including a fair amount of scantily clad BeBe dressed Marina bitches and popped collared Jaegar bombing douche bags - so I thought, this place can't be that sketchy if these ex-sorority and fraternity gods took it upon themselves to travel down from Mount Olympus and mingle with us normalings.

Checked it out last weekend during the afternoon. What a nice place.  Wonderfully decorated. Nice chill music. Huge windows and window seating, perfect for people watching while sipping your $6 Sweet Home Alabama Tea deliciousness.

Last night I went back again. My friends were having a joint birthday party. Man, was it packed?! Great mix of people. Good music. Nice bartenders and bouncers. Despite the huge crowd, I had no problem getting a drink. 

Good place. Yep, I am a fan!
author: Kiristen R.

description: Was not sure what to expect when someone invited me here for happy hour. Its a GREAT neighborhood bar with amazing happy hour specials! Casual, nice bartenders, not snobby but they make great drinks! I appreciate the extensive cocktail list for HH. BRING CASH!
author: Amber M.

description:
I'm on the fence about the new Lush.  It's big, it's busy, and it's not the eclectic bar it was just a block south.  I understand why Steve moved it and I'm still a fan.  But it seems oh-so-much-more conventional, and, well, it might not be, it might be, and if I figure it out, I'll you know.

I still like it.
author: Laurel B.

description: I usually come here on week nights when it's about a third full. I recently came here on a weekend night and it was super busy. Something about the architecture amplifies sound when there's more people in here, but the selection of drinks is great, prices reasonable, and the service is good. It's one of my favorite bars on Polk.
author: Dani D.

description:
I was an attendee at the previous location. The superior lounge was the best purveyor of superior cocktails on the hill. It was not a regular stop for me as it had two primary problems, the space was very small and the clientele was a bit FIDI and low brow. 

  The new LUSH location has remedied both of these problems. First the location is just up the street but the size has been increased by 500%. I am quite taken with the new space. Beginning with the citadel strength doors that bar the entry portal to the two story open main room, a loft level located towards the back, a fireplace directly across from the bar. A perfect ambient level of light, dark but not so dark. The size of the room does a good job at mitigating the din. 

  The clientele now is a lovely mix of local color. A comfortable and welcoming balance of every gender, orientation, creed and profession. I believe the Gulch has finally found the all encompassing social hall. I fear that it will be short lived as it will no doubt be invaded by the unsavory Marina sorts, hipsters and their ilk, so I advise to enjoy while it lasts.

  The cocktails remain superior, mandating fresh squeezed juices and the cocktails be hand made with craftsmanship. Considering the quality the prices are most reasonable. It pains me to write a review as I hate to put it on the map, but seeing that I no longer reside in the neighborhood and am infrequently in the hood( regrettably) I shall hope this recommendation will find its way to the eyes and ears of the sophisticated and happy socializers. Enjoy.
author: Christopher N.

description:
I joined Yelp just to let the world know how terrible Lush Lounge is.  This place is especially rude to their customers for no apparent reason, and to make matters worse, the bouncer allowed some girls that were clearly underage inside last Saturday night.  Coincidentally, he also let in some sketchy dude that skeezed on one of the girls and must've put something in her drink.  I saw the whole thing happen and she was basically carried out by this creep, and hopefully her friends got her back from being essentially abducted.  Very sad story, and even more sad that the butthole bouncer was such a dick about it.

All that aside, try the Disaronno on the rocks there, it's fantastic.
author: Colton W.

description:
Stumbled in here after the Giants parade on a Wednesday afternoon.  The place was full of Giants fans playing hooky and the City Hall ceremonies were live on all the TV screens, plus there was still room to grab a spot to sit.  Big glass of cold beer on tap $5 and well worth it. The bartenders were fast and efficient and super nice to boot.  It was a great vibe inside and lots of fun decor to look at behind the bar.  
I remember the 'old' Lush Lounge fondly and while this new version is different, its still lots of fun and worth checking out.  Score on all accounts!
author: SFnativeGal ..

description:
September 5th, 2010 @ 12am. What does that mean?
I AM LEGALLY 21!

First stop to pop my legal drinking cherry? LUSH LOUNGE! I happily showed me ID to the bouncer who wished me a happy birthday and my friends began to buy me drink after drink. They all came so fast and I downed them so fast, which meant the bartenders were quick! Greatly appreciated! They have a lounge area upstairs, which is where we spent most of our time before hitting up the bar next door. I really loved the ambiance here and I actually liked the crowd...at least from what I can remember.
author: Surge C.

description:
We decided to go out in the hood after work after walking by the Lush Lounge's new location for way too long.  To sum it up  MOJITO!   The lush lounge still lives up to it's reputation of making great drinks with fresh ingredients.  I made a mojito myself recently, and they are a workout, especially if you pulverize the mint by hand, the way Lush lounge does.  

 I was a little nervous about the crowd after reading the other reviews, since the bar has always been gay friendly and popular with the after show actor and stage crew types.   We arrived around 5:30, and it was a little slow, but within an hour it began to get busier with a friendly mixed after work crowd.  Actually this is a great place to meet after work, it's classy (I know that this sounds weird for lower Polk, but the Polk is a changin).  My suggestion would be to liven it up a bit with some good classic music videos, etc,  no need for the news or sports.   Also would be great to have some vodka drink specials for happy hour.
author: Robert R.

description:
Happy Hour:
Tecate in a can for $2, what can get better than that?  Tecate in a salt-rimmed can with lime for $2!

The new space can actually accommodate the work happy hour chenes crew, seats and all.
author: jane d.

description:
NOOOOOOO! Crying and stomping feet. Stop this! 

So over this. I love/loved Lush Lounge.
...............................

Okay, rumor is they are moving. All right. We shall see. Enough is enough. Stay gold Pony Boy. Or else.
author: wendella a.

description: Pretty relaxed bar, I went on a Sunday (early evening). Quick and efficient service. My drink came in a cute mason jar mug. Will definitely have to come on a busier night next time.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Once upon a time, my friends were born.  Which means they have birthdays.  Which means they, and I, drink heavily on those days.  As a result of this, I found myself at Lush Lounge on Saturday evening, along with a zillion of my closest friends.  Or mostly people I've never met before.  However, after my knob creek manhattan on the rocks (which, at $9 for essentially a double bourbon was a STEAL), they BECAME my closest friends.  WHEE!

It gets a little loud and a little warm, but the fireplace is a nice touch.  I'll be back.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Love this place for several reasons: 1. I can walk from my place. 2. The drinks are good and they aren't $15.00 3. There's a fire place. 4. It's a big space so there's most always room for you, your friends and the new group of friends you collected on Polk st! Also, there's a picture of Audrey Hepburn in the ladies room which makes this place even more awesome.
author: Natalie M.

description: Came far a birthday party - the party took over the upstairs. The space was fantastic -the drinks even better.  I loved my mojito and my friend's cantaloupe margarita was amazing as well.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I never went to the old Lush Lounge, but I guess I should have, my friend says the drinks are the same or similar as the old venue, and I really do enjoy a "girly drink", as I call them.  Basically they have many delicious cocktails such as blueberry martinis with real blueberries in them, a chocolate martini I tasted that my friend ordered, and some pretty great gimlets where they squeeze their own fresh lime juice into.  I told my buddy I'd like to eventually try each drink on their menu.  She tells me their cantalope martini is very good.  We shall see!

The inside is pretty roomy with an upstairs area I have not been in yet, but you can see it from downstairs.  There are a few little seating areas that are pretty cozy.  The bathroom situation is interesting, guys and girls have to wash their hands in the same area with 2 sinks, I couldn't decide if it was cool or annoying . . . but it's  . .interesting.  

I'd say the best thing about the bar is the drink selection. I definitely go there when I really don't want a lame old beer or boring drink, and I'm sick of wine.  Worth a try.
author: Muriel D.

description:
At this point I was pretty sauced so I'm giving them four stars.  

Nice drinks and great variety.  Props to the cute bartenders who must be from Florida b/c it was f*ing hot in this place and they didn't even break a sweat. 

If they turned up the air in this place I'd give it a 5 for sure.  Not the place you'd go to meet someone, but bring someone you meet from another bar for something that isn't the usual vodka-redbull/rum and coke we are seeing so much of these days.

Nice change of pace.
author: Mike V.

description:
One of my main concerns about a new Lush location was what I assumed would be a major change in ambiance and space. So I was surprised when upon entering, I not only felt the space welcoming me, nay, demanding that I find myself a seat, if not by the fireplace, by the window or the bar, but I felt the Lush had been waiting. 

Drinks are still stiff and well done but the space, oddly enough, feels the same, yet more, which is not an easy thing to accomplish. 

Gone are all the Dorothy Parker placards and many of the photos of old actors, but there is a much nicer bathroom (and you can see where you're whizzing!!!) not to mention a Dyson Airblade with which you can dry your hands. 

Looks like the upstairs lounge area is about to open. Also, the new wood door make the place motherfucking pimp. In general, it's like the old place with just enough breathing room. Awww... who's all growns up.
author: Roy M.

description:
The new Lush Lounge is going to make it hard for me to drink less. I really like this space. By really like, I mean I'd really like to move in and make it home. Big and spacious, with a lofted space up top (when you're rolling 30 deep like we tend to do, a private space is instrumental in keeping the tribe herded together), it's kind of like they inflated 80 Proof and moved it to Polk Gulch. 

The bar staff are excellent. By excellent, I mean they'll make you a good cocktail and won't ask you (me) to leave if you happen to slap one of the cute ones on the ass. Drinks are a little pricey and it can get a little crowded, but I'm still down.

Great spot for an impromptu party or after-work drinks. Fan. Like. Drink.
author: Autumn K.

description: Eclectic decor, never too crowded, delicious cocktails. I love this bar!
author: Cynthia L.

description: Lush Has lush drinks at stripped down prices.  Sammy mixes a cocktail like nobody's bidniss!!  2-story knotty pine interior, with spacious bar, great long wooden tables with a feel like a ski lodge, psuedo fireplace and warm atmosphere.  My new favorite drinking spot on Polk!
author: Nate H.

description:
I'm sad to update my review because Lush has always been one of my favorite bar destinations in SF.  What I used to love was the intimateness of the little corner bar and admittedly the crazy passer-by, heh!  But now, it's a full blown Club-O-rama, which can be fun, I guess, if that's what you're looking for, or if your in the mood for a pick up joint with amazing tasty cocktails that gets mad hot really quick... The bartenders are still really friendly though.  I'm just saying I don't recommend Lush if your looking for a similar cozy experience you may have enjoyed at the previous location.  The patrons have changed a little too.  It seems to draw a rowdier bunch...yeah... just not the same.

P.S. One bathroom stall per sex is kinda CRAZY for such a HUGE place, just sayn'!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I LOVE THE NEW LUSH LOUNGE!!  The space at the new location is absolutely great!  It is by all the other Polk bars I may want to visit if for some reason I feel the need to hop around and check out who's out and about.  

I invited some folks out for Valentine's Day drinks at Lush and the owner and bartenders were completely accomodating!  We had the perfect space for hanging out.  The whole set-up is cozy for mingling.  I feel like all types of people are attracted to going to the new Lush and the couple of times I've gone it feels like the crossroads of the City.  The diversity of people represented there is pretty cool.

Drink specials are as awesome as they used to be and creative.  You get your bang for your buck at this place.

Sammi was a pretty cool bartender and added to the Lush feel.  I'm heading back for sure.
author: Jessica G.

description: One of my preferred places on Polk St. They're always bumping great music and the drinks are great. Place get's pretty crowded on Friday and Saturday nights, so get there a little earlier if you want to snag some seats by the windows or along the back wall. Otherwise you'll end up standing around. Bring cash and some friends for a good time.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Absolutely gorgeous space, unfortunately lost a bit of previous charm in the process.  Two huge losses:

First off, what's with the big screen TVS blaring the sports? If my memory serves me correct, the old location would play old movies- It was really great that it didn't draw that sports crowd...

Also, what made Lush a standout in its round 1 location was its phenomenal drink menu.  When I rounded up a group of people to come check out the new digs, I wasn't able to remember any of the good drinks, there was no menu, and a new bartender who didn't know the old drinks?   I'm sure there's a menu on the way, but it was a letdown for the group I had persuaded to come try the most creative and delicous drinks in town.

On the plus side, the new space is beyond gorgeous with a fireplace to boot, the best bartenders from the old location are back in town and serving up the works (unfortunately just not for said experience)

All in all, still one of the best bars on Polk- I anticipate this becoming a new hotspot once word gets out it's re-opened.
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Nice big space from the old Lush Lounge. Its nice and the bathrooms are unisex. Cocktails are really good and so are the bartenders.  Still one of my favorite places to go when I'm wandering around Polk St. Prices aren't too bad....wish it was a bit less. I wouldn't call this place a dive because it is still classy.  Its in between a dive and a sheeshy place.  But I love its a diverse crowd and fun on weekends and even at happy hour!
author: Gina S.

description:
Gasp!  

Lush Lounge, what happened?  You have a great new space but your new clientele have been chased away by hordes of zombie clones from some marketing department.   What happened to your old clientele of the locals who live in the hood?  Polk Gulch has lost a really great bar...

And no more Apple Pie Martinis?  Why?  Those were great!

I will stop by again to chat with Artie, but it will be on a Thursday night when you are not hosting some AIG type awards banquet.  (sob)
author: Kristine K.

description: Great place to have a drink, the bartenders were all very nice and got the drinks out quick. I was there on a Saturday night and the place was pretty crowded, I was thinking it would take forever to get a drink. This was never a problem, I will definitely stop by next time I'm in town.
author: S S.

description:
Not only is this a fun group hangout with lots of people watching (ie. boy watching for my single girlfriends), and a cozy fun atmosphere (dim lighting, tall tables lining the window for good street people watching, lush plants to make you feel cozied in but several of us in our group also felt it was a good date spot.  With the array of drink options, friendly bartenders and fun people, even if the date was a doozy, ditch him or her and make some new friends!  

You would never know what fun awaits you behind the tall wooden doors, if you didn't go in, at least to run away from the he/she yelling at you for walking in her way.............
author: Denise B.

description:
I love LUSH! I moved to the area just before Lush opened and figured McTeague's would be my local watering hole.  I was soooo wrong.  Lush is everything you could want and more.  

First and foremost, the drinks are delicious.  I had the lemon drop $5 happy hour drink.  Perfect mix of lemon sour and sugary sweet.  Next, I asked the bartender for a suggestion.  He made me a cucumber gimlet.  The most amazing delicious fabulous heavenly gimlet in the world.  It's actually my favorite drink.  But so many bartenders butcher it, I rarely order it.  The only place (prior to Lush) that I would even consider ordering one was at Le Colonial.  Well, now that's all I will ever drink again.   All the drinks are handmade, shaken, stirred and scrumptious.  My friend had a Manhattan and she said it was excellent.  They use fresh fruit, real cucumbers, etc.  It's swanky without the snobby.  Oh, the happy hour specials vary.  One day it's blueberry martinis, the next lemon drops.  So, you can easily find a reason to go, you haven't tried the new happy hour drink yet!

Second, the bartenders.  Not only are they nice to look at, but they are also ridiculously approachable and friendly.  I didn't feel rushed to figure out what I wanted next and they happily recommended drinks based on my tastes.  They are great at what they do.  We actually went through three bartenders (no judgment, it was a rough week).  All three were equally nice and good at their job, making good solid strong drinks.

Third, the atmosphere/crowd.  My biggest issue with McTeague's are the pseudo wannabe ex-frat hipster folks.  I knew I was in trouble when a Britney song came on and the high pitched excited screams were not from a group of gay men.  Plus, really people, let the leggings and 'stache go.  It's sooo 2008.  Lush is the perfect mix and represents every reason I moved back to San Francisco.  You have hipsters, Irish dudes (cute ones too), lesbians, gays, straights, the random weird couple making out in the corner, and every other label I can't think of right now.  Everyone is friendly (except the weird couple, but eh, what can you do).  Each time I've gone, I've met people at the bar.  Just a good bar that draws a good group of people.

Fourth, the decor.  It's just light enough to see your friend or what's in your purse without holding it up to your face like your trying to eat something out of it.
