But not so light to keep you from making a mistake by going home with someone that in the daylight, you might wonder what you were thinking.  The tables are set far apart and there's lot of options.  Tall tables, short small tables, tables for 6, a long table for 12 (or more), a nice long bar and a large upstairs for more private personal settings.  The jukebox plays good music and it's at a level where you can hear it, but you can also hear yourself think.  Plus, the have a FIREPLACE.  It's fabulous.  I warmed my hands and toosh and then headed out home.  

Fifth, the owner.  He's local (yay local small business owners) and I think I might have heard he also owns that great shop Leftovers (just down the street at Bush and Polk and then a large one on Sutter just down from Van Ness).  He was so nice and genuine, plus he said I have a great figure and his friends said I had porcelain skin.  Really, they had me at hello.  Compliments aside, he cares about this place and wants it to be successful.  It was refreshing to hear.  He's got my happy hour business for sure.

Overall, this is a great bar for happy hour, first stop of the night or somewhere towards the end of your night.  They have a jukebox with great music, everything from Morrissey to Snow Patrol to Lou Reed.  The drinks are very well made and don't take 20 minutes like other places (orbit, bourbon, I'm talking to you).  The crowd is eclectic and friendly.  The decor is fun and cozy.  The owner is nice.  Really, would even want anything else in a bar?  I think not.

Note: this place is cash only, but they have an atm machine in the bar.  The fee is $2 which isn't that bad since one of the convenient stores down the street charge like 3.25 or something ridic.
author: Emily G.

description:
I miss the trannies and older gay men and the piano area of the old location.  But I was glad to hear that the wonderful owner (who is originally from Florida, hence the groovy tropical drinks) was still the owner (at the old location he made me the best mojito I've ever had, he puts a splash of coconut milk it in!)

Somehow at this new location it's gone loud hetros on pussy/dick patrol.  One tranny in the entire bar, and I gave her a sympathy wink and smile.  A handful of aging queens, and the rest of the patrons were a bit too Marina for my taste.

But the cocktails still reign supreme.  And they are generous with the booze.  Shit wine (come on, step it up!) and some mediocre Australian faux champagne (come on, get something better!)   A few of the bar tenders were attitudinal and I'm not impressed (she says longing for the old queens from the old location)  The guy at the door was cool, yakked with him a bit, he's the apex of diplomacy which is so vital for a job like that.

I wish the owner's presence & vibe could have been felt more.  The art work in the very back, near the bathrooms is a sort of reminder of the old Lush Lounge   . . . .
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Ended up at this bar  while searching for a place to sit and relax with a drink to ease our post-Day-2-of-Outside-Lands fatigue. We passed it the first time, assuming it wouldn't be so great judging from the dark, run-down feel of the outside. However, we noticed there was a constant flow of people wanting to go in, so we decided to give it a try. I think it was a bit early in the evening -- around 10? -- so there was ample seating upstairs. We scored the corner booth seat and grabbed a couple beers (mediocre variety to choose from) from downstairs. The music isn't so loud that we would have to yell to be able to hear each other yet just loud enough to give it the divey feel to mark it a good night. As the night progressed and each time we went downstairs to get more drinks from the bar, it was getting increasingly more (very much more) crowded. We ended up having a lot more fun than we had expected and will definitely be trying Lush again in the future.
author: Lynn K.

description:
It's a good place.
My only concern is about the public. I was stolen there while I was with my crossbody purse all the time. It was faster enough that I can't realize when someone got my phone and wallet inside my purse. It was awful. 
When I said what happened to the security, he just told me that I was the second person on that night. 
Obviosly, it was not Lush lounge fault, but its public. So, if you go there, don't forget to be aware.
author: Gleicienne P.

description:
"I don't know where we wrong but the feeling's gone and I just can't get it back."

I was never a regular at the old Lush Lounge.  I've gone maybe 6 or 7 times in the past couple years.  But it was a reliable place to get a drink with a diverse crowd in a cozy space.

While the new space is certainly beautiful, it didn't feel like "Lush Lounge".  It was too big, and the crowd was kind of douchey.

But it was crowded so I'm guessing the owners got what they want.  It seems like a nice enough place but it's lost it's charm.  Sad.
author: Evan L.

description:
I live nearby so I walked by Lush's new place to see the progress of construction pretty much everyday. We were all worried (or I was) that new bigger place may loose the cozy cuteness full of pretty stuff feeling the old Lush had. I was peeking from the window to see what kind of table they will have and bar stools... interiors...and mmmm....

Now I went 3 times since they reopened. Weekday and weekends.
First of all, I really like the new heavy wood door. It's like going into a castle. New Lush makes me proud! I would still name Lush is the best bar in San Francisco and Sami's Coconut Mojito is the best in the city.
I truly can not wait to see their new menu! Hurry up!

It's a bit weird to compare but just it's just like going to Starbucks to make sure you get (or Peet's if you prefer) a good cup of coffee, if I want to make sure I get great cocktail, I go to Lush. 
You can tell the bar and bartender there loves cocktails. They always inventing new stuff and they are creative and all tasty.
Not only that, they are nice and friendly, too. How about that!

Anyway, We Lush lovers are so happy the new Lush is giving us the satisfactions of comfort and fun time and alcohol cravings. You know!
author: Green Mango Y.

description: I really enjoyed having a big joint birthday here. Everything about it was good from the drinks, to the music, to the space, to the ease of working with the staff. Cantelope martinis 4eva!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Now I like Lush. Will I go again on a Saturday night? Not likely. But on a quiet weekday evening? Yes. The cocktails are really tasty, especially the girly ones that are my style. I tried to order the Lychee Pomegranate Martini and the bartender was cool enough to straight up tell me no. He told me that he could guarantee I wouldn't like it and just waste my money. Even though I like both of those fruits, I trusted his opinion and went with the Cantaloupe Cosmo, wow. Mmmhm, a winner in my book (or in my mouth, depending on how you want to look at it). 
It's also super chill on weeknights- good for conversation and quick service. The only annoyance is the complaint I tend to have about the mirror being between the girls and boys bathrooms...don't people realize it's kind of awkward to look at yourself in the mirror while guys are coming in and out? Haha, last night one guy gave me a sheepish smile while I was attempting to fix my hair...yea mirrors in actual bathrooms are much cooler.
author: Sonya D.

description:
I'm glad it's back, but to me, it's now just a regular ol' bar--just like the rest.  Sure, they still play the old movies, and some of the interesting wall pieces are back up, decorating the place.  But their old location was small and intimate; there was a certain charm to it.  It was the one bar in my neighborhood that I enjoyed taking others to.   

At least they haven't moved very far, which still makes for interesting people watching on Polk.
author: Marsha Z.

description: When I am in this bar, I find my eyes darting around catching glimpses of strange southwestern skulls or bones...  twisted ropes, wood sculptures. Cool fireplace.. The wood church pew seating was alittle hard on the arse so we had to leave. The drinks were good too. I did not want to leave. I was enjoying the music. My rear was not enjoying the seats.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
How can I not like this place!!!  Lush has delicious beverages, great bartenders, and you can bring in your doggy!!  

Recommendations:
Sweet Tea Vodka beverage- Makes me think of chicken & waffles 
Blackberry Bubbles- Delicious & refreshing
Blackberry Lemon Drop- Sweet & tart ...just like me

Cash Only Bar!  Lush has an ATM so don't fret !
 
Price Point = good for the struggling post-college adults
author: Em A.

description: I was referred by a colleague to book this venue- without realizing that it is catered in only.  That was no big deal- there's a great Thai restaurant, Modern Thai, next door that serves great food!  One thing to look out for - cash only!  If you are someone like me who takes the convenience of credit cards for granted - this was a bit shocking - so make sure you plan ahead! Great venue though!
author: Brittany H.

description:
Last night, I finally checked out the new location a bit further up Polk, between Bush and Sutter. Happy hour called, so I met up with my drinking companion after work. The space is much bigger, with a second-floor loft, but the bar still retains some of the old location's wall kitsch, which is very good. I did notice more of a mix in clientele (read: more peeps in nicer digs), so I'm guessing the move from the seedier block has upgraded the place a bit. 

I'm still a big fan of this place, although I missed the corner booth in the back of the old spot. The new bar, though, has a cool little wooden L-shaped booth near the front, as well as a circular table near the window that looks like a fat tree stump.

Hooray for Chimays! (And very nice company...)
author: Cheri R.

description:
There's a lot of space, but on weekends it can a little insane to navigate through here. It looks like the smallish section upstairs can be rented out for private parties, at least there was one up there one night when I was there.

Weekday nights are much different, much more relaxed and spacious. 

Oh yeah, the drinks are good! And the overall atmosphere of the place is nice.
author: Ken L.

description: I stopped in here one night for a drink with a friend. I ordered the blood orange cocktail. it was strong (which I appreciate) but it tasted like the wax on the outside of the orange. Pretty disappointing. I have not been back since, I would be willing to try it again because it seems like a fun place to hang out, but I would stick to beer not mixed drinks.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Smaller than expected, super pact with what appeared to be a fun group of people. Really great service for how busy they were.
author: Mike P.

description:
i love lush lounge on weekends. probably my fave place on lower polk.

+cool, relaxed vibe, and they play good music. 
+drink specials, like tequila + tecate for ridiculously cheap ($10 or less, depending on the night)
+it never gets THAT crowded. seems like the crowd comes and goes, but i never feel like a stuffed sardine here

-one toilet for women, and one for men. I've never had to wait in line that long, though.

i've only been upstairs once, and it was for a private party. it's nice up there, and I know you can rent it out for a nominal fee. perfect for a birthday party!

FYI cash only.
author: Patricia Y.

description:
Friends and I went here after dinner on Thursday night.  What a great space.  The male bartenders were very friendly and generous, but the female bartender was bitchy at best and made crappy drinks!
We'll definitely be back, but only will approach the male tenders!!!
author: Annie S.

description: Chill bouncer. Genuinely friendly bar-tenders. Dim lighting. Outgoing patrons. Strong tangerine martini. Candy sweet lush mojito. Cash only.
author: Brenda C.

description: There's not many seats in this place, but the crowd and decor is nice.  Drinks are reasonable also.  It gets super busy later in the night.
author: Byron L.

description:
This is my new favorite spot on Polk! The decor is absolutely beautiful. It's like a grown-up version of the Blue Bayou Restaurant in Disneyland. There are plants everywhere and dim, red lighting. I love it! There's a good amount of seating all over the bar, and even an upper deck area. 

But my favorite part about this bar is that they always have great films playing above the bar. There are just so many things going on that I always have a great time!

I'd passed this place a few times because the name makes it sound sooooo lame. Just ignore it and walk right in, you won't be disappointed.
author: Victoria A.

description:
I think my review is a bit higher than I think I would have done simply for the fact that I'm nostalgic for the "old" Lush Lounge when it was on the corner of Polk and Post.  I was never a bar person to begin with so when an old boyfriend introduced me to the Lush Lounge, it was love at first sip.  

The drinks were spectacular and was matched in its fabulosity by the bar patrons.  A mix of older gay men, trannies, rent boys, heteros and homos in all shapes, sizes, and color.

Last night I took some friends visiting from England to the new location and I just knew it was going to be different.  Right off the bat through the door the vibe was different.  More Marina types than any other in the whole room.  Gay patrons yes, but the crazy mix of people I loved was gone.  Instead of the old black and white films playing on the flatscreen, they were instead playing "Saw."  This is definitely not your father's Lush Lounge.

The drink I ordered, a Bellini, was in a smaller glass instead of the tall champagne glass of old.  Sigh.  It still, however, tasted wonderful.  

They say all good things must come to an end.  And sadly for all of us that miss the old Lush Lounge, this is very true.
author: Gordon A.

description:
AHHH! I love you LUSH LOUNGE!!!!!

so hot so fierrrceeee just like that golden mannequin hanging from the ceiling.

fabulous bellinis, and fabulous bartenders.  Interesting crowd too.  my guy friend got invited to the bathroom around 10 times by a sauced gentleman.  we were also offered a ride on a motorcycle.  

it was a good night.
author: Amanda D.

description: Not a bad place for a Friday night. Loud, crowded, clean bathroom. Nice upstairs if you want to sit and talk.
author: Colette C.

description: Laid back spot, cool vibe. I've never seen it packed shoulder to shoulder, and the upstairs seating is fantastic. The bartenders are a little rough around the edges, but in turn they get your drinks out fast so you can go have a good time. Great place to start the night.
author: Keegan R.

description:
I was truly sad to see the Lush Lounge move from its previous location the corner of Post and Polk. I think it was the slightly more seedy locale that kept the Marina crowd from slumming there.

Now that it's moved...well, that chapter has ended for me. I'm sure lots of people enjoy it now that they've discovered it on Polk street. Good for the owners, woe to all of us who loved it when no one else cared or knew.
author: M O.

description:
I love this place. It is where I like to hang out on my days off even though I live in the sunset. I am a bartender right up the street from here and it is great to have a place where friends and I can meet up.

Good strong drinks and great happy hour crowds keep me hanging out here. Sam and Chris are just so damn cool. All of the staff are cool but them as the week day crew make the place.
author: Whisky T.

description: Spontaneous Monday night. Not bad for a weekday.
author: Emmeline A.

description: Chill atmosphere, great drinks and in the middle of everything. Great for small gatherings and meetups!
author: Paul R.

description:
Lush is definitely one of my favorite places to start off the night.  What more convincing does a girl need than tasty drinks with names of the like of oatmeal cookie, apple pie, and peppermint patty (Not to add that the prices are not bad at all at about $7-$8 per cocktail)?  And after you get a pretty good buzz on, you can either hop next door to Vertigo and dance the night away...or because of its central location in the city, take a short cab ride to a multitude of other places!

In terms of drinks: Despite all of the unique drinks Lush has to offer, I have to say that my favorite is still their lemon drop...but it is my favorite lemon drop in the entire city.  Something about that fresh squeezed lemon!
author: Andrea W.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago to watch Brett Favre and the Vikings blow it against the Saints, and while the game was totally depressing, I really enjoyed Lush Lounge.  After stopping by a different bar on Polk Street that didn't have any more seating, my friends and I found a place here in the loft area to sit down and enjoy a drink while watching the game.

The space was nice and stylish, and comfortably populated on this particular Sunday afternoon -- not too empty, not too crowded.  They had some good drink specials.  I'd definitely come back here to check out their happy hour.
author: Jamie T.

description:
There are very few things in life that make me truly happy.  Bubbly is always going to put a smile on my face.  Now when you add the Bubbly with fermented peaches (yes they have been soaking in alcohol...I'm not sure what kind) and Cointreau you have Lush's Bellini.  It was delicious.  I was able to enjoy this divine little concoction, two in fact, with one of my best friends on a quiet afternoon. As the sun hit our backs through the large glass windows we were able to catch up on life before she had to catch her plane home.  Lush's Bellini and quality BFF time when you haven't seen the girl in months when for one the bar has yet to turn rowdy are the little things that make me appreciate my life.  

And I have to mention that the bartender who served us was back from a hiatus / life elsewhere. He was funny and charming and boy did he have a fan club.  Clearly he had at one point been a regular bartender because the happy hour crew of business men were so excited to see him I thought they were going to wet their pants.  His girlfriend better watch out! Men in suits?  That's some heavy competition right there.  Yes he mentioned to the happy hour crew he had a girlfriend. I'm not a stalker, unless you want me to be.  *pulls out safety scissors*

The happy hour options, however, weren't that great: Blended margaritas from a machine for $5.  At happy hour, they should at least have happy hour specials like at Blur.  And I imagine this place gets packed at night, but that I will have to check out at a later date.
author: Justine D.

description:
I just had the best experience at this bar a couple of nights ago! Not only were my drinks delicious, the bartender gave me a few for freeeee!!! Plus he was extremely friendly and sociable. We were also able to seat 4 of us easily at the bar. I seriously love this place. I can't get over how little they charge for such delicious drinks.
I have to recommend their mojitos. Just give it a try. You won't be disappointed!!!
author: Felicity M.

description:
Where to start for St. Patrick's day? Polk street is always a safe bet since you can just make your way from bar to bar in either direction. Lucky for us it was 6:30pm so we were able to take full advantage of Lush's happy hour:

- $2 PBR's
-$4.50 glasses of yellow tail champagne served with blueberries (cute touch) 
-$5 frozen martinis

The place is small and the hanging plants are interesting and abundant. The decor is a little off kilter from the red and black signage outside to the wacky oval mirrors in the restrooms. Large cocktail menu with pretty much every martini you can think of. The bartenders are nice and once Happy Hour sadly ends you can still get a wonderful glass of Watermelon Sangria for only $4.50. Popcorn is provided at the bar...yummy salt. 

**Note: if you're hunger grab one of the yellow Hanks menu, call in an order of tacos, wraps, sandwiches, fries, etc from across the street and you are more then welcome to munch while you cocktail.
author: Theresa T.

description:
This is another one of my favorite bars on Polk St. 

it's very cozy, but still very fun. They have a nice warm fire going at night and it's a good place to grab some drinks with friends (and actually be able to carry on a conversation with them).

Their Blueberry Martinis are to DIE for. They're delicious. And they also serve a Mel Gibson: A Tecate, a shot of Well Whiskey, and a racial slur.

Great bar.

CASH ONLY
author: Lauren F.

description: Sidecar was pretty amazing, but there were WAY too many people there.
author: Amanda V.

description:
OMG, for months i thought that Lush had closed.  Then a friend informed me that it had just moved up the street.  Phew!!!! The current located is awesome, tons of space, great lighting and as with the previous space awesome drinks!!  I love the natural wood tables.  My favorite drink here has to be their sangria and second would be the sweet tea drink.  As for the scene,  it's younger.  Makes sense, since it's located on Polk.  But the crowd isn't too obnoxious, which can't be said of some of the surrounding establishments.  

While at Lush, You might see the owner's dog hanging around below the seats.   Cosmo's his name and he's a cutie!! 

If you're in need of a good drink and  a venue with fun vibe, head on over Lush!  They just might make you blush with their drinks!!
author: Ka C.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LUSH.....

my favorite lounge in sf. the drinks can be on the pricey side, but that happens after a few martinis. 

the service is always fantastic, the martinis to die for, the mojito is heaven and the patrons are friendly and eager to chat it up. 

my type of place and always my first stop when i come back to sf.
author: Shy A.

description: This bar is fantastic! The music and decor are very cool and it attracts a slightly classier crowd than most of the other bars along Polk Gulch. The barstaff are totally awesome as well: fast, friendly, and they all know how to mix a mean drink. On the subject of drinks, the cocktails here are top class-  the Sweet Tea in particular. In summary if you are looking for a hip and classy spin on the Polk Street experience then the Lush Lounge is where it's at! Highly recommended.
author: Matt H.

description:
I could drink their mojitos ALL day long. They are amazing and for 8 bucks they are pretty strong! I would come here all the time with my friends and grab a couple rounds of mojitos and enjoy the people. Theres this odd little corner with steps and a bench that we would like to sneak into, it's interesting.

Anyhow, the ambience is nice and the bartenders are really mysterious sometimes! We once saw a bartender jump out from inside of the bar, out of the door and yell at a bum who was trying to get inside! It was intense!

Their happy hour specials change I believe, I went once when they had their speciality martinis for 5 dollars and they were all amazing! Yes, I had to try all of them on the menu!
author: Debbie P.

description:
Maybe it was the beer goggles talking but wow, the new space that lush moved to is absolutely GORGEOUS.  It had beautiful exposed brick walls, a nice fireplace, a loft, and the bars are made out of full cross sections of tree trunks.

Even the shitter was nice.

So good for these guys.  With this economy, being able to upsize is a pretty impressive feat.

It seems like this strip of Polk street is really getting to be a happening place.  And to any idiot that complains about gentrification... SHOVE IT, this is much better than crackheads and empty storefronts.
author: Rocco B.

description:
I know it's a good night when I step outside for a breath of fresh air (gets toasty inside), immediately get involved in a conversation with a cross-dresser named Alicia who, for some reason, keeps calling me Twiggy & asking if she can borrow my boobs for 20 minutes, during which time she swears she'll earn my rent and hers.  [Breathe]  Of course she follows me back inside where I introduce her to my friends, like we're the best of friends.  We drink more of the fabulous cocktails they serve here, but as usual, I can't remember most of what I tried because, well, the drinks are *really* good.  I do recall the lychee martini being excellent: not too sweet as I expected, but with a tart aftertaste.  [Insert dirty pun about cross-dressers here.]  

Drinks are pricey, but delicious and strong.  Space is narrow and can get crowded.  Bathrooms smell like urine, but are otherwise decent.  Local eccentrics are friendly and gropey.

Hey Alicia!  Where's my rent $$?  You didn't borrow my boobs, but you did grab mine and my friend's.  Dunno what the going rate for that is, but it should be good for at least another drink for us to share!
author: Ravena F.

description:
Meet and Greet

Great place to mingle EXCEPT on sports nights. Everyone is welcome: gay, lesbian, straight, bi-sexual and TS. Bring cash. Good drinks at a reasonable price. Just come and be yourself. Friendly, mixed crowd. 
Suggestion:  No TV.  On "game nights" the security turns "ugly"  toward everyone whether they are drunk or not. Tip/warning: don't fall for the last call bell. It means you have to be OUT in 15 minutes. Don't order a drink. Just leave.
author: DeAnna D.

description:
I only went into this place briefly last weekend, but really enjoyed it. Great atmosphere, good vibe, bartenders were nice and helpful, quick service even though it was busy. There is plenty of space to hang out. You don't need to yell to be heard by your friends. Good crowd.

I definitely want to go back and stay longer next time.
author: Amanda U.

description:
This place was good.
It was good because it wasnt completely mobbed.
It was good because it felt friendly and welcoming.
It was good because there was even a little eye candy.
It was good because the barmen were slick, efficient, no nonsense - they poured a mean pint of Guinness. Wham. Bam. Thankyou Ma'am.
Its hard to describe the clientele in here. A real mish mash. And really international. How often do you get accosted by a brummie in the toilets?

...Talking of the male toilets, why not put the light switch in an altogether more reasonable place for a semi drunk dude to find?

[Bar #3, 8 pints down]
author: Michael H.

description:
Lush Lounge is a place we can all get down.

I wouldn't make a destination of this place, but some of my best nights in SF have been at Lush Lounge. There is something so warm and comforting about the decor and when you're at the bar drinking a bellini being treated like gold by the bartenders and listening to LCD soundsystem and Debbie Gibson's "only in my dreams" comes on you realize you're in a special place.

Crowd tends to be an eclectic fun mix of gays, polk gulch regulars, russian hill peeps, and then there's always a couple people from the marina out there slumming it. 

Big downside is there is one regular bathroom and it's hot as hell in there and there's always people hogging doing god knows what.

The drinks are deeelicious.

The crowd immediately outside the bar is not so savory.

Go here, cross over to Blur, and head down to 800 larkin and you got yourself a night my friend.
author: Andrea S.

description:
This is where you can find me Friday afternoons. The place is usually empty when we get there around 4 pm for happy hour. It fills up around 5:30 or so and it isn't a huge spot so get there early if you plan on staying for a while. 

The drinks are sorta pricey, especially for happy hour. But you cant go wrong with their Blueberry Cosmo or Melontini....I believe they make them both with real fruit...maybe that is the reason for the higher priced drinks...nnooo can't be the beers are even on the expensive side....and they don't take credit card... cash only. 

Either way I still like the place. It's right across from the Hemlock so if you are looking for a much quieter, friendlier and more convenient spot then Lush Lounge is your place .
author: Jen N.

description: I am extremely grateful for the staff at Lush Lounge. Not only did I have a great time with friends there on Saturday night (enjoying the quite reasonably priced $3 PBRs) - i lost my phone that night too. Thankfully a friend called my phone this morning, they answered and told my friend where my phone had been found. I told them I'd be over when they opened, and true to form they were there at 2:30pm. I will always make Lush Lounge a stopping place for my outings on Polk St. Many thanks to Darren and Frank!
author: Mac M.

description: The bouncer is nice, spacious, cozy, interesting drinks, cool bartenders, there's good looking folks, plays very good music, and it's chill. Perfect spot to start the night, end the night? Maybe not.
author: Stephanie M.

description: The mixed drinks were pretty bad for the price. I ordered a margarita and it was super sweet, almost what you expect with a $2 margarita on taco Tuesday's. So I asked for more tequila, still didn't help. Then I ended up paying an extra six for a tequila shot to add. My friend had the same problem with the dark and stormy, she got an extra rum shot. Bar is cool, drinks not very good. Just go with plain drinks
author: Laura B.

description: Your "run of the mill" lounge/bar.  I don't even really know what to say, they have a decent happy hour and the bar is clean.  The bartenders were average.  They only have two, single restrooms, which kinda bugs since it isn't a small place.  Anyhoo, three stars.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This is a really fun place to go for drinks.  They have cool drinks like The Mel Gibson.  I love their Cuban, cabana feel.  I love their ceiling fans.  I recommend this place for a fun night out.
author: Victoria C.

description:
So we walked in to this bar and really liked the mellow vibe and setting with its framed prints and photos on the walls and great blown glass pendant lamps over the bar.  My friend ordered a mojito and I had a Grey Goose and tonic. Turns out that the vodka drink had little vodka and the mojito was sickeningly sweet and they had used coconut rum (apparently, their mojitos are their unique specialty).  My friend was really repulsed by the drink and went back up to the bar and politely asked if she could exchange the mojito for something else as it was too syrupy and the following unfolded:

bartender: "well, I can 'soda' it down for you
friend: I guess we could try that, but I'd really just like something else instead if possible.
bartender: well, these are our specialty and I already made this one and put it in the computer.
friend: ok, can I just get a bailey's on the rocks then?
bartender: ok, I will have to charge you full price for another drink though. Just throw me 4 dollars, they are usually 8."

To me, it seemed a bit petty for the bartender to have engaged in this whole exchange over a lousy drink.  A good bartender would simply have tossed it and made a new drink free of charge.  The moral of the story is always run your business in absolute good faith because you just never know what yelpers may be lurking in the corner....
author: Rick H.

description: Disgusted with my experience here last night; and, beyond that, I'm angry.  The two bouncers: 1) double-chinned white male with black glasses, and 2) short-haired skinny white male were very disrectful.  As my friend and I were walking past this establishment, these two bounces started to mock the debate my friend and I were having.  My friend and I were passionately debating politics while walking down Polk Street minding our own business, and as we walked past Lush Lounge, the two bouncers started mimicking our conversation.  Just wanted to bring this to future patrons' attention and inform this establishment about this event.
author: Mason B.

description: This place is a good scene, although I wouldn't say it's my first choice when going out on Polk St.  I do like that this place is roomy, so the crowds of people aren't too overwhelming, and they make a great drink with sweet tea vodka.  I'm not sure if this is standard there, but when I was there the bar was cash only, and I was not a fan of that. The music they play is awesome though!
author: Bridget B.

description:
What is the essence of intelligence? Some say that the moment you here or see something, another related piece of memory flashes in your mind. The better the quality of the related piece of memory(association), the better the intelligence.

Let me explain further. When I first heard about Lush Lounge, I saw a picture of a lush, green forest in my mind's eye. Then I got reminded of  "grrrl friendly" parties like Lush and Pleasurezone and fond memories filled me with happiness. Hence, when I saw Jill's invitation to lounge at Lush post movie, I decided to trek couple of blocks from Franklin and land up at Lush.

Our experiences not only widen our capacity for forming mental associations, but also "assimilates" into our neural networks and deepen our intelligence. After my experiences at Lush on Friday, if I hear the word Lush Lounge, the picture of attractive women, drinking amazing fruit-based cocktails, competing for men's attention with the Divas across the street or the delicious taste of $ 3 frozen mango martinis tingling my taste buds or the smell of lingering pot or the touch of   promising promiscuity towards the end stamps on my mind a rich multi sensory aroma of   memories and I feel I have taken a strong small step in my journey of evolution and change.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
-Cucumber Ginger Gimlet
-Blood Orange Cosmo

Drinks are great and creative, atmosphere is good, eclectic mix of people, fills up at peak times. Clean and nice ambiance.

Downside - cash only.
author: Lina L.

description:
My date and I ended up here on Wednesday night, and it had been a very long time since I had been to Lush.  So, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I immediately felt at home in their cozy, 'lush', comfortable atmosphere, and then after ordering a drink from the sweetie pie bartender, who was not only hot, but very nice (he let me change my mind 3 times after seeing him make other cocktails), humble and helpful, I had the distinct feeling that I had found a new favorite watering hole.  

They have a great list of specialty drinks, and you can even ask them to tweak them to your liking.  I don't like really sweet drinks,  and like to taste the tequilla in my Margaritas more than the sugar, so the bartender happily made my watermelon marg exactly how I wanted it....and it was REALLY good.  I moved on to my favorite drink, a basic Bombay Sapphire Martini, slightly dirty, and he made those perfectly as well.  I don't get that very often, so I was really pleased. 

What happened next could have turned a wonderful evening into a nightmare....my date returned from the bar to find his wallet missing.  Granted we were sitting at a table right next to the window in the TenderNob area and he left his wallet on the table (dumb), but we all have a lapse in judgment, and even moreso after 4 really stiff drinks.  

Everyone around us, and I mean EVERYONE rallied together to try to find it...even ventured outside and did laps around the block hoping the thief had just taken the money and discarded the rest of the wallet in an alley.  But no luck...UNTIL the bartender overheard what was going on and said a neighboring bar had called and said if anyone was looking for a wallet, they had it.  How wonderful is that??!?!?!

4 stars to excellent service, excellent drinks, and a really climactic end to an evening!!!  

I would give 5 starts, but my incredibly hot date got more attention than I did as it seems to be more of a gay bar. It didn't bother me at the time because I was with Mr. McDreamy, but it's not a place I'd go with my girlfriends if we were looking for some male admiration.
author: k. w.

description:
Lush is probably my favorite spot in the Polk Gulch/Tendernob area. The bartenders are friendly and efficient, the drink selection is great, and the people watching is entertaining to boot. The crowd here is definitely a motley crew: gay and straight, young and old... you name it, Lush has it!

One of my favorite cocktails here is the Cantaloupe Martini: citrus vodka, watermelon schnapps, and orange juice. It's sweet, but not overly so, and tastes remarkably like cantaloupe!

The proximity of this bar to Divas across the street (http://www.yelp.com/biz/aVO_-SlozVuQnTJctQ0MiQ) ensures that a night at Lush is never boring. Be sure to check out the movie memorabilia covering the walls.
author: Jill M.

description:
I live nearby and this place can sometimes be part of the McTeagues, Hemlock, stagger home.

It's hit or miss.  I don't go enough to know the bartenders or anything, but I have met some interesting characters here and have had some good laughs.

Late at night if you're bored, there's always the tranny hooker show going on outside the Post Street window.  I hear they are moving so not sure what kind of street entertainment will be happening outside the new place.

All good, and "A-OK", things must come to an end.
author: King O.

description:
Great girly drinks, hot bartenders, and the best, gayest decor ever. Would make Bobby Trendy proud. If you even know who Bobby Trendy is, then you're just as cheesy as I am. Let's be friends!

For those of you who don't know, this is a gay bar & you'll often be sitting next to very well dressed drag queens sipping mojitos. The vibe on the weekends can get very annoying so I prefer this place when it's quieter, when you can marvel at all of the classic film memoribila, chat with the friendly bartenders and sing along to Madonna. Occasionally you can chat up one of the old gay locals, who will reminisce about what the neighborhood used to be.
author: Maria D.

description: Fun stop on your night out along Polk gulch. Bring cash, cause that's what they take. Can't go wrong with a tangerine martini! Lots of plants and kitchy decor. Bar tender was friendly. Easy crowd. Looks like they're moving though...
author: Naomi K.

description:
Very cool dive bar! If you are in the area it is definitely worth checking out. I happened to stroll in on a Hawaiian theme night but even though I had forgotten my flowered shirt I did not feel out of place at all. The only reason why I did not give Lush 5 stars is due to the long wait and obscene effort I had to make to get a drink. I know it is a game of survival of the fittest in a bar on a sat. night but this wait was just a little too intense for me. Over all it was a great time (particularly because it was a celebration for my sisters birthday) and I would definitely return!

Drink Recommendation: TRY THEIR BELLINI! IT IS AMAZING
author: Ryan W.

description:
Pros: 
-cool/hip interior- but not clubby/trendy
-good selection of beers
-well-mixed cocktails
-nice, clean bathrooms
-friendly, chill bartenders

Cons:
-watery sangria 

Verdict: totally solid happy hour, pre-late-dinner spot.
author: Maggie M.

description: Nice place with a reservable mezzanine that fits around 30 comfortably. Drinks are well-balanced and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and attentive even when it was busy, though I found it odd that a bar with this much atmosphere (albeit a little rustic) is cash-only but they do have an ATM on site.
author: Bill B.

description:
And a Lush is what I will be if I continue to hang out with this crowd (yelp..er...gulp)

nice bar ~ good tenders ~ tasty drinks ~ too crowded?
author: Liza B.

description: Chill, bring your dog and friends kind of place. Only down side... cash only. Their HH specials are decent and just remember... CASH!
author: Eva Y.

description:
Some of the best cocktails and bartenders are in this tiny bar.

The all male bartenders are always sweet, charming, and welcoming.   I think it used to be a gay bar, but it's mixed now.  Our "Girl's Night Out" tend to start at the Lush, great place to kick off the night or end it. :)

The room is warm and cozy and the variety of people in this bar is fun for people watching.  The age range is huge and the aura of comfort it gives off is great to vibe off of.   It's easy place to meet natives or travelers and striking up conversation seems easy.
author: Mary R.

description:
Many label this place as a gay bar but despite the decor, it's not really trying to be. It's gray with a mix of fun people.

Give the the watermelon and raspberry slushy drinks a try.

Try to score a seat in front of their large windows. Polk St. traffic is even more amusing after a few martinis.
author: Adam W.

description:
$3 frozen mango margaritaaaaaassss????  let's get drunk!

ok, maybe not (would be a harsh hangover..)

i like this place for an early 'classy' drink with a couple of girlfriends BEFORE going crazy somewhere else.

the atmosphere is ok, nothing to get that excited about., but they have good music that remains me my pre-teen years (hum...neon socks and headbands...i so miss it!). 

the whole place is very intimate, just a couple of high tables and chairs along the bar.  

staff is cool and friendly, as well as the people that hang out there. it's quite easy to meet other regulars.

like me. so see ya!
author: Margie B.

description:
Ok, so I was told that the garnish was a long-forgotten work of art. I mean, half the time you go to a bar and they attempt to throw in a 1/58th piece of lime. And they're like, "Ok...with the garnish, that's 8 bucks." And you think, "Why don't I garnish your face asswipe?"

Well, my friend talks and talks and talks about this place and the magical garnish. So, I'm like "What...they give you two limes?" The first time I go, I got nothing. Nada. No garnish. Come to find out that this particular bartender isn't a big garnisher.

Second time I go, I order a cactus margarita. Well, hot damn and hallelujah. They garnished the fuck outta this thing. Seriously, they used blueberris, raspberries, pieces of orange, strawberries, and I believe a few blackberries, and the guy made a bridge around my drink with these fruits and some toothpicks. A frickin bridge! I mean, we were joking that I was disappointed in the garnish last time. Perhaps he went crazy on me? But seriously, I was like..."Wow." We sat near the window staring at it, afraid to drink the Sistine Chapel of alcoholic beverages. It was...truly magical.

Now, I paid for the damn thing so I did drink that. Don't think I'm wasting perfectly good liquor cause it's "pretty." The drink was rather tasty, and I had three woman ask me what it was so they could order one themselves.

Awesome place. A little small, but in that neighborhood, I'd call it cozy. :)
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Apart from the shockingly stunning bar staff that work here, the awesome and ever so entertaining location, the super-cool public bathrooms, the all night happy hour cocktail special (ok why did I list the toilet before that..?) and the awe-inspiring decoration complete with framed quotes from all your favorite 1940's movie legends: This place ROCKS!! And I so very rarely use all uppercase like that.

Let your hair down after work one night, this corner location with surrounding windows on either side provides the perfect setting. It's the most open minded 'gay bar' in the whole world! It's just so great to see so many liberal Californians mixing and mingling with us gay fellows. Close minded suppressive republicans are not welcome (well, not officially but I would imagine the lack of biblical references may be somewhat underwhelming) - It would be like that day I accidentally walked into Walmart, I shudder...
author: Jack G.

description: This place is slowly becoming one of my favs...I say slowly cuz its too small. I like the crowed, great drinks and laid back oh ya the music is awesome too! what else do you want?! oh yya its COZY!!! real cute!
author: Kajal P.

description: Great ambiance with wonderful drinks at reasonable prices.   Bartender Sammy is very good at what he does.  We will be going back.
author: Scheryl W.

description:
The New Old Lush Lounge!!!! OPEN NOW
OK the bar looks great, love the booths and all the chairs. I really love the big window and fireplace (great choice). And the drinks well great!!!!!!!!!!!!
But that large table is to close to the bar, when people are siting at the bar and table you can't get past ( and the guy I was sitting across from said his knees kept getting hit and beer was spilling - sad- he was just trying to watch TV). Plus put some chairs or tables in front of the great fireplace of yours ( standing with no table, well it's just weird). 
Overall a great new old start for the Lush Lounge!!!!
author: Brandi R.

description: good local spot, good new belgium weekenight drink deal.
author: Misha T.

description: Cool spot. Yelp shows pic ls if this place really bust but every time I go it's pretty empty
author: Victor G.

description:
I LOVE THIS BAR! I wish it was located in LA. They play the BEST jukebox music and they have drink specials. The night I went was $7 patron shots along with their special cocktails. The place is a little small, but it's cute and has plants in there. 

We went around 11ish and it started to get crowded. There's no cover charge and i just adore this place!!

NOTE - IT'S A CASH ONLY BAR.
author: Kathy C.

description:
I came here for the first time yesterday during the day and I was totally digging this place!    It has lots of great energy; loud music, crazy,funky, decor dripping from every wall and hanging from every party of the ceiling, plus I liked all of the plants everywhere...I have thing for indoor foliage and I'm still trying to figure out why?  The place was pretty crowded for being the middle of the day...but then again it was 80 degrees in SF, so everywhere was pretty packed. My friend warned me of the usual clientle of older gay men that frequent this place, but if they were around, I totally didn't notice them.  Plus, I like older gay men -- they're usually quite entertaining.  

We had Bellinis and Mojitos and everyone enjoyed their drinks.  Lush Lounge gets an extra star for the bartender who carded me and then with an extra-wide smile, told me I looked great for my age.  Thank you for making my day hot bartender!  Nothing like a little mid-day flirting to compliment a little mid-day drinking.
author: LaSha G.

description:
I like this space.  It reminds me of the bars of my youth--Badlands in it's Western early phase, with raw wood and license plates (this place has no license plates) or the Mine Shaft;  cleaned up, reorganized, prettified and with interesting light fixtures.  The problem is, it isn't the old Lush Lounge.  There are bars, and then there are Bars.  In my life there is Hula's Bar And Lei Stand, under the Banyan tree--where I came out, and the Lush Lounge on Polk at Post, where I rediscovered bars.  This Lush Lounge is no doubt someone's special place, but while it's a unique space on mid-Polk's bar scene, it lacks the intimacy and campy elegance of the old space.

This is sad for a lot of reasons, especially given its new, west-side of Polk orientation which protects it from the sun which used to turn the old place into a sauna.

I have nothing negative to say about this place, it's just that it doesn't carry forward the magical, mystical place I used to love across the street.  Oh well. Maybe there will be some other special place, but it better hurry up or I'll be taking my gin through tubes and needles.
author: Paul T.

description:
I like this bar. It really defies definition. I mean yes it is a gay bar, or wait maybe it isn't. Everyone likes Lush Lounge and everyone feels comfortable going here? Perfect.
The fancy cocktails are well made and delicious, because sometimes you really want something with fruit juices in it, usually this happens when you are about to get scurvy. 
They also have a nice selection of tap beers including PBR for those of you who are classy.  
The prices are fair, not dirt cheap by any means but fair and the bartenders are all decent fellows some of whom have buns of steel. YaY! 
My favorite things however are the plaques with classic one liners peppered throughout the decor,  like this one:
"You can lead a horticulture but you can't make her think" 
Funny stuff.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Had a buddy of mine in town and decided to hit Polk for a change.  Heard about Lush and decided to give it a go.

The Sazerac is one of my favorite drinks, but few if any seem to do it right in this town.  Absinthe is about the only place I've had a good Sazerac.

Well, they got it pretty correct here.  Decent Rye whiskey (Rittenhouse?).  A touch of anis liqueur.  Peychaud bitters (critical - as the hint of anis is very important to the flavor profile and develops further with the addition of Peychaud).  Touch of sugar.    Lemon twist (oils into the glass and rub the rim).

Our bartender also made sure to stir (and not shake), which is also important.

Then ... the only mistake in my mind.  A martini glass was used.  It needs to be a tumbler glass.  But all was forgiven as the drink turned out fine.

Recommended.  Good atmosphere.  Spacious.  Low key crowd.  Fireplace.  Upstairs area as well.  Smiling bartender.  All good.
author: Patrick K.

description:
Lush gets a solid 5 on consistency alone.  I've never had a bad time here.  I've never brought anyone here that didn't love it too.  Lush is the place I bring everyone with full knowledge that any and all will be pleased.  I like it less crowded than more crowded.

Most recently, I brought 7 folks from all over the place.  We were accommodated easily.  I've never used it as a pickup joint, but I can see how someone could easily do so.

Bonus points for the trannies outside who hit on my 100% oblivious straight friend who is new to SF.

Lush is MY bar.  Great all-purpose meetup spot.  The drinks are creative, the bartenders are awesome, and it's convenient and easy to find.
author: Jillian W.

description: We met up with some friends here and it seemed like a nice, chill bar. I think it's a prerequisite for bars in the city to play the weirdest movies. Lush is no exception. While we were waiting for our friends to arrive, they were playing some pornographic foreign films with some added violence for good measure. Needless to say, it provided material for some interesting conversation. We didn't try any of the drinks but they did look good and they seemed reasonably priced. If you're a single guy, this would be a good place for you. We noticed the ratio of male to female was pretty unbalanced. They play decent music here too which is always a plus. Parking in the area is pretty tricky but it's definitely not a bad place to meet a few friends and enjoy some conversation. I even ran into an old friend here so it's one of those sort of neighborhood bars.
author: Amy J.

description:
The cocktails here are DELICIOUS. Really. I used to be a, do a shot, chase it w/a beer kind of girl because I didn't understand prolonging the awful taste of getting nice and boozed up by adding some crappy fruity flavors and sugar.... the harder most people seem to try to spruce up a drink, the worst it ended up tasting. Now I love Bellinis, Grasshoppers and even the cliche Lemon Drop, oh my. The Oatmeal Cookie is off the hook! Rimmed w/brown sugar it's one on the top of my list. A close second is some Chocotini which they shave a Hersheys bar to garnish the top. This place actually makes these drinks taste as good as they try to make them look. Because of them 2 years ago, I can now appreciate "bitch drinks".

BUT you must get the right bartender, or they WILL taste like crap! Wish I could remember dudes name, all I know is he was there Mon-Thu nights. He's a real short guy, but he owns the bar when he's behind it so it should be easy to spot him... and hopefully he doesn't read this and have a height complex or else I'm not sure if he'll be serving me again. Ha.
author: Miss Jessica S.

description: While waiting for the next showing of Bond at AMC theatres, we walked over to this lounge & had some drinks.  At the suggestion of the nice female bartender, I tried the lychee pomegranate martini, and loved it.  Extremely fruity and that's what I like, so I had two of them.  The glasses are uniquely shaped, and fun to drink out of.  Many colors of drinks/selection, and I was tempted to try them all...next time.  It's a laid back bar, with good company all around.  There was a black and white movie (starring Marilyn Monroe) playing at the time, and interesting 80's music in the background, with a tiny disco ball shining towards the restroom.  I enjoyed this little, cozy joint.  Remember to bring cash though...if not, there's an ATM inside.
author: Christine R.

description:
I've been here seven or eight times so I feel confident giving it five stars. This is why I like Lush Lounge, and this is how they earned each star: 

1) Interesting decor with a definite theme, but that does not overwhelm.

2) A strong gay contingent. I'm not of that tribe, but I like bars that are frequented by gay and straight alike. It tends to keep away the macho jerks with environment-killing transport/"high-class" hoochies in search of said jerks. It's very mixed in all senses--hipsters (which I might be mistaken for sometimes), people in definite dress-down mode, fashionistas, etc.

3) The Cable Car. I'm talking about the drink, folks. It was invented in San Francisco and is a little sweeter than drinks I usually go for but it's awesome.

4) Nice bartenders. Always friendly, always good pours. 

5) There's good music but this is also a nice place to chat, sit at the window and people watch, whatever. It can get pretty crowded but the vibe always stays friendly and peaceful.

That's it, what more do you need?
author: Josh K.

description: This is such a chill place. It's great for happy hour or as the first stop on a night of bar hopping on Polk street. There's never a cover and you can always find a seat whether it's at the bar, along the walls or upstairs if you want a more intimate setting. However, the main reason I come here is for their Alabama Sweet Tea! It's not too sweet and you don't taste the alcohol, but after one or two it hits you! The one thing that would make this place better is if they had dancing! I would definitely stay all night if they did.
author: Danielle W.

description:
I love their drinks, the atmosphere and random programs on the tv. The last time I was there (which was much too long ago) they were playing Elaine Stritch's one woman show "At Liberty". That's class.

It's kitchy, glam, cheesy and laid back. It welcomes all types and the bartendars are sweet. I like to sit at the high tables and stare out the window while munching on the bar's popcorn.
author: Jessica P.

description: Once you go through their giant wooden doors, the bar almost has an island nightlife kind of feel. Rough-hewn wood everywhere. Large barrels as tables. Dark inside but in a chill way. When I've been there, it's generally been a twenty-something crowd. Good music. Not super crowded. A handful of good drink specials. I personally think it's a bit over-priced for what they offer but the place itself is pretty fun. The bartenders serve pretty quickly regardless of how packed it is.
author: Jen H.

description:
If you're in the mood to wait 15 minutes for some sort of fruit juice concoction hand squeezed into your glass, then covered with so much fruit you'll never be able to drink it, this is your place.  Actually, it's not such a bad place.  It's a really small place, and I'd imagine it's great on quieter nights.

I went in there with a bunch of Yelpers after seeing the Borat movie on a Friday night.  The place was super crowded even before we arrived.  Also, it seemed understaffed.  Most of their popular drinks require a lot of time to prepare and there just weren't enough bartenders.

I'm not really a fan of really sweet drinks, so the house specials were pretty much lost on me.  But if you do like that stuff, try the margarita.  It's extra fancy.
author: Dave G.

description:
I only like this place because of the variety of she-male hookers we have to walk by to get into the bar.

My lady friends and I ordered a couple rounds of fruit-flavored martinis from the Russian bartender and were crazy underwhelmed.  I had a cantaloupe martini, and while interesting, it was heavy on the cantaloupe and way too light on the alky-haul.

The bathroom is almost completely dark, which is fun, except that I could only see a faint ectoplasmic glow of  myself which is a waste of the wall-sized mirror they have in there.
author: Holly B.

description:
Maybe I'm jaded, but lately I'd become accustomed to paying $12 -15 for a drink. So how great is a bar where you can order a round of drinks for seven people for $45?!

They lose a star for being cash only.
author: Deb I.

description:
I love this place. They're always showing classic movies, playing great tunes, and have personable bartenders that make great drinks. I've gone here every year for my birthday since 2001? Wow, I'm gettin' old. See you there next January 9th.


They've moved up the street to 1221 Polk.  Very nice space. Can't do it if my B-day falls on a weekend tho'. Too many douchebags about.
author: Daniel S.

description: Came here and slammed a few back before a concert! Friendly service...hell I have no complaints...nice place! it was on a week day so it wasn't crowed but it was laid back! I would definetley come check the place out on a weekend...see if it's still pretty chill!
author: Ty B.

description:
More space, same feel

Great move and keeping the ambiance of the original Lush
Cash only bar still
Like I said, same feel
Drinks were good - $9 a pop for hanger lime & soda

Upstairs is a good place to kick it with the crew
Nice mixed crowd
author: Po L.

description: We came here to watch the 49ers Game! It's a nice atmosphere. Like the interior. They also allow dogs which is cool! Friendly staff! The restrooms were clean. Upstairs seating areais great!
author: Katja J.

description: The place had some good music when I got in.  Not too crowded so you didn't feel stuffy.  Drinks were okay.  Don't mind coming back
author: James P.

description:
K: How far is this place?

D: Just three more blocks.

K: I gotta pee.

D: Me too. Let's duck in here, I've always wondered what it was like.

K: Okay.

they enter The Lush Lounge.

fun ensues. laughter is had. new castle is drank. there are not-trying-too-hard-to-be-hip-late-twenty-somethings within. there is an equal ratio of girls to boys. the bathrooms are clean.

and their bladders were happy.
author: Darrell L.

description:
It's all about the really cheap frozen mango martinis... nice. Popular with both guys and gals during a night out on the town.

I've been to Lush a few times, and every time I go I really enjoy myself. The last time I was there I went for a birthday celebration. It turned out that another party was celebrating a birthday there as well. We all ended up sharing a delicious red velvet cake together and having a big party.

All in all, I'd say Lush is your friendly neighborhood bar - nothing too exciting or crazy, but always reliable and fun.
author: Ava S.

description:
Delicious drinks!

the thing i like about this bar is that they put time, effort, and love into their drinks. and you most likely will get some freshly squeezed juice in a drink too.
author: Ameer N.

description:
What a great little find!

This bar is bright and welcoming. I loved the lights hanging from the ceiling and the various tasty martinis for under $7.

Our faves: cantaloupe martini and "the cable car."
author: Misha F.

description: After starting the night at Kimo's down the street, this is the next stop!  This is a very trendy and stylish bar with great music.  It is always packed and the drinks are quite good and not too expensive.
author: Cullen A.

description:
love it.
when i want a girly drink this is the spot for me to go. twice tonight. 
i've been really diggin' margaritas lately, but i sprang for the cucumber gimlet (delicious!) because i need to branch out...but when i came back for the second time i got that margarita and needless to say it did not let me down (divine)
and bartender Jack is super awesome (and way cute! think sylar from heroes just even better looking)
will i be back?
yes. especially for happy hour.

the ONLY reason i didn't give this place 5 stars is because i am poor. so really it should have 5 stars and i should have 2. so im gonna fix that before i send my review.
author: sara m.

description: This used to be one of my favorite bars. But during my first visit to the new location they were playing the movie Y tu mamá también. I thought the 3-way (two men, one woman) sex scene was too much to be shown at a public bar. When I complained to the owner, he harassed me via text, email, and voicemail by telling me "get yourself a big fucking life." I have reported him and the bar to the Better Business Bureau.
author: Bronwyn G.

description:
Great mojitos and if you can get a window seat, you'll have a great view of the action going down in this part of the TL.  The decor is an interesting mish-mash of all kinds of cool vintage film knick-knacks and every time I've been here some old-skool movie playing overhead.

The last time I was here, the second I got up to go tinkle, a creepy old guy with stringy hair in a suit that had been hungrily eyeing up my date, brazenly took the opportunity to come and chat her up!  I came back as he was handing her his card, she was cowering in the corner ...and guess what? He completely ignored me and that I'd been there all along and continued to chat her up!! haha. So I had to "save" her and rock outta there pronto. I think he was harmless but definitely socially "off". Its kinda random & funny in hindsight, and just part of the local scenery.
author: I. O.

description:
Fellow yelpers liked this place so I thought I would check it out with some friends. 5 stars for the best Margarita I've had in a long time! Really, they put little blueberries in the bottom of your glass. Even if you don't like blueberries, it's so entertaining to try to retrieve them with your straw. My friends also really liked their drinks. 

I just wasn't feeling the vibe on a Saturday night. The crowd was a little older than my group (aka late 20s, early 30s). Not saying that in a bad way, please don't be offended. It was just more subdued than what we wanted that night. --Maybe the "Lounge" in the name would have given me a clue. It is a small place. Literally, there's a bar and then a few tables and some nice bartenders. So if that's what you want, then Lush is the place for you.
author: Ali L.

description:
I have to say that this is the "go to" place for me and my friends when we can't think of where to go.  Somehow we are always able to get a table that seats five or six, even on a Friday or Saturday night.  We also love the cheap ($5 for a large, and $3 for a small) frozen drinks.  The bartenders are very friendly as are the people that hang out there.
This is a great place to go if you just want to meet some friends after work, or potentially begin an evening of fun partying.
author: Jane A.

description: Started a Friday night Polk Street crawl at Lush Lounge.  Very chill spot with a lot of seating (for a bar).  The bar area was very open, and we were able to get drinks quickly.  Loved the drink specials - beer and shot of whiskey for $5, my favorite!  Don't really remember the music, must not have been very impressionable.  All-in-all, a lounge-y spot that's solid for the start of a long night of drinking.  I can't speak for the late night scene, but chances are good that I'll eventually be back.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Warm nights always put me in the mood for an icy drink. And Sunday was of course, quite the balmy evening. So, what better excuse do I have then to head over to one of my favorite places to consume a few drinks on a "school" night?

My friend and I met up and sipped on Watermelon and Mango frozen martinis while chatting the night away- just what the doctor  ordered. The bartender definitely made our night that much better when he doled out some popcorn for us and offered us a glass of red wine on the house (some girl had ordered it only to discover that she would be getting the boot for being under 21! meh, more for us. haha!).

Still love ya, Lush!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
It's Sunday, 4pm - my cousin spent most of the day on the phone fighting with her man and sobbing. Finally we leave the house to search for some good eats and other general distractions in the TenderLoin.
We come to the corner of Post and Polk where the jungle of indoor plants adorn the window of this small but lively TenderNob tradition. It's now 5pm and we are in need of some drinks to pass the time and heal the heart of my sad cousin. The handsome Dutch bartender fixes us the most incredible watermelon martinis at the price of $3 each, with some snacking corn too! After a round of these sweet adult slushies we are laughing and things feel normal again. Maybe it was the cheap but strong melontinis that did the trick or maybe it was the warm and inviting atmosphere of this Polk Street gem.
author: FA B.

description: Classy Joint.  nice bartenders.  I love that they use fresh grapefruit for their greyhounds - not that shit from a bottle.  I also recommend the sweet home alabama tea... Delicious!
author: Sage S.

description:
I went to Lush for my birthday.
I had some good drunken birthday fun so I'll give this place 4 stars.
Minus one star because they seriously need air conditioning and it's really small. Luckily my friends are I got the table in the back corner, but other than that, there are only stools in the "lounge." It was not lounge-y at all.
Despite how small the place is and how HOT it was inside, I loved the decor.  My friends also said the bartenders were nice. They helped in setting up for my  "surprise" birthday cake as well. They even lighted the candles a second time after I blew them out on the cake and put them in a shot glass. That was cool. =) And they didn't kick me out when I was trashed and throwing up in the bathroom.
Oh, and of course, great delicious cocktails/drinks.
I agree with some of the other reviews.. great place for the ladies!
author: Jamie W.

description: It reminds me of those local bars friends go to for years. There are two levels, a large open space downstairs and smaller upstairs areas with more tables/booths. There are many drink specials and are great. Bring cash!
author: Tif L.

description: Lush Lounge....errr...it certainly is...when we are on the premises....stop on by....$2.00 PBR, et all, til 7pm...nothing wrong with that!!  (~_~)
author: Karen S.

description: Descent layout with good drinks.  I bought a round of orange cosmos for my girls, and we thought we were going to bounce after that.  Instead, we wound up staying here the whole night.  I'm going back to check out their happy hour.  :)
author: Lainey D.

description:
Well considering I'm still tired from my visit here last night, I'd say I had a good time. I've passed by this place a lot and never went inside. I'm glad I finally did, as they have a nice happy hour, a good atmosphere inside and really nice bartenders. I enjoyed the frozen strawberry Martini and the "award wining" Lemon Drop Martinis (maybe a little too much, should have tried more food than just the popcorn perhaps, haha). 
I would definitely go here again!
author: Lynda O.

description:
i used to pass by the old lush lounge spot all the time since my gym was a block away. i was never able to check it out. i was probably missing out because the new location looks awesome. it's very spacious, with a large downstairs bar-area, and a sizeable balcony area. 

the decor is very cool and the staff was very friendly. the bartenders were cool and they made some pretty stiff vodka-soda's. prices are decent, even at non-happy hour times. the place was packed and the scene definitely looked good.

i think this is definitely a go-to spot in the polk district. my only complaint was that they carded me at the bar even though they already have a big-ass bouncer doing that at the front door.
author: Andrew T.

description: My brother and I would stop by LL for a nightcap before going back to our hotel {The Opal} after a night on the town. This was 5 yrs ago. Loved the fresh  squeezed juices for cocktails done with a strong arm. My brother loved the Manhattans, delicious cold and up. Steve was the owner then, is he still there? If so tell him Larry and Kevin say hello!
author: Larry P.

description:
********************edit 7/6/07***************************************
Wow.  I can't believe I had to take away my original 5-star rating and put it at 1.  This is how angry I am at the way I have been treated the last two times I've been there.  I don't know what happened to the nice bartender, perhaps he works a different night.  But last Friday took the cake.

I guess you are getting your wish, Lush--maybe if you continue to treat *shock* *gasp* straight, cute women like dirt and make a point of ignoring them while they wait to be served at your empty bar, they will stop coming.  I know I will. 

Even nicer was how the bartender looked at me with my money out, ignored me and went to talk to his friends at the end of the bar.  I also love how the 2nd bartender or barback, saw me, then proceeded to vaccum the floor behind me for 5 minutes, then ask two guys next to me if they wanted anything else.  

When I was a bartender, I only ignored patrons that stiffed me or were rude and obnoxious.  As I had just arrived and did not do either of these things, I can only think of it as discrimination.  Nice bar, you jerks.
____________________________________________________
Friendly bar staff.  One bartender always remembers me and that is cool after only being there what 3 times?  Yummy, cheap frozen martinis (made with grain or Velikoff I'm sure) that give you a quick buzz.  Good mojitos, love the yummy Mango margaritas.  Popcorn and movies during happy hour. Not bad.
author: MakeUp M.

description: I was surprised by cash-only restriction, but after a hectic time at another lounge, the  chill, relaxing vibe of this one was very welcome. There might not be enough room to sit down, but there's plenty of room to mingle and talk with friends without moving around for passerbys or being crushed by the sheer amount of people.
author: C P.

description:
This is THE perfect bar:

1.    Near my workplace, perfect for kicking back after a tough day
2.    $4 frozen mango margaritas - you can feel the alcohol in it
3.    Free popcorn during happy hour
4.    Great music - usually 80's stuff
5.    Cute bartenders (and they're nice and generous!)
6.    Old movies played on the TV
7.    Live plants in the window - how can that NOT make you happy?
8.    Good mix of patrons
9.    Interesting window watching - somethin' always going on outside on Polk + Post
10.  Perfect for meeting up with a group of friends, on a date or even by yourself.

Go check this place out now!  You'll find me there on Thursdays.
author: Lily C.

description:
Someone described this bar as "The Girly Drink Mecca of San Francisco" so I guess I was in touch with my inner girly self the evening I went to this place. If you're up for a strangely wonderful happy hour, get your butt over to Lush Lounge. This place is small but so cool and friendly. It's DIVERSE with a capital D. What a great people-watching bar. I was with two friends who hadn't been there before, and the woman in our group went a little ga-ga for Sami the bartender. He's middle-eastern and Italian and a lot of fun. Also fast and smart with a big smile and good vibes. We were feeling pretty fubu as I said above so we all had the watermelon frozen martini. Wowsa, what a tasty drink.  Thanks to the Lush Lounge and Sami.  It's a cool place for sure.

Note: I haven't been to the new Lush Lounge location up Polk Street, so I'm wondering what's happening there. I'm reading some of the more recent reviews. I'll let you all know when I visit there.
author: Tony G.

description: Being new to San Francisco, as many are at some point I didn't know this bar was a $20 card minimum. The bartender looked at me after handing him my card and told me of the minimum charge (not sure how hard it is to swipe a card these days, a charge is still a charge) and told me "there is an ATM over there, I suggest you use it.". . . As a bartender as well, I understand the busy environment, an off night, all of the excuses I know them, and it gets irritating repeating rules however, it was early in the night and I am curious to know how telling that to the 50th person went by the end of the evening. . . I can't imagine it was much more polite.
author: Alexandria D.

description:
Checked out Lush based on the yelp reviews, but those that I read didn't mention the roughness of the blocks immediately around Lush. 

Sure, being on a block loaded with pan handlers and drug addicts is hard on a business, but the bar tender at Lush has a unique approach for keeping the patrons feeling... er....safe.

When a man who appeared hungry and in need of a bath walked in, our bartender shouted "GET OUT" and then leapt onto the bar, and jumped down to confront the unfortunate beggar.  

I was reminded of the way I ran whooping after seagulls on the beach as a child, but only because of the way our bartender flapped his arms during his leap from the bar.  

Why does this story belong in a yelp review?  Forewarned is fore armed... you might see some homeless people here, but don't invite them inside, unless you'd like to hear some shouting!
author: Jay P.

description: Cool spot. Unfortunately we came on an off day. The place was nice, and the bartenders were cool. I'll have to drop by, again, in the future.
author: Jay P.

description:
I love this place.  And frankly, I don't even know why.  I mean, there's nothing that specifically stands out about it, but I've never had a bad time here.  Maybe it's the combination of really strong drinks and very cool people.  You get all walks of life here.  
Tuesday afternoon you'll see a drag queen (or is she a pre-op or a post-op?  So hard to tell...) sipping a fruity cocktail.  Evenings and weekends you'll see a great combination of straight preppy folks, hipsters, gays and lesbians galore and anybody else who falls through those profiles.  It's just a fun place!  
However, and this is a fair warning to ya'll: if you see me slipping off my chair because I'm so drunk, and I start hitting on you, just tell me to piss off.  I say this because frankly, everytime i'm at this bar I'm shit-faced drunk and i'm always perpetually single.  You've been warned.  :)
author: Zev K.

description:
This is a nice little neighborhood spot. A lot of people end up here on weekends because vertigo gets too crowded and you can actually move at this bar and chat with people. The drinks are good and they have great deals. Going there for happy hour around 4 to 5 PM is a little weird since you see a bunch of dirty old man there looking at you and winking at you. 
The bartenders are nice too but one time I went there and I bought a bottle of water. I wanted to leave after that but they would let me leave for some reason. I argued a bit but didn't want to go over board since I would still come back to this place. I found that very awkward.
I do like the frozen martinis/margaritas/sangrias they have and I will continue to come here because it's a pretty chill neighborhood dive bar.
author: Nir B.

description: 4 stars for a great happy hour!  Drink specials until 7PM, and it wasn't too crowded.  I think it is a dog friendly bar because there were a few dogs running around... that's cool I guess.  The bartenders were nice, good crowd too.
author: stacy b.

description:
Sometimes of the smell of hot fart can be welcoming...or so I'd like to believe was the marketing ploy of Lush Lounge this Friday night. 

My buddy and I were killing some seriously misplanned time before the Cold War Kids show at GAMH, and wandered down the road to Lush Lounge.  We spotted the open door to this joint and peeked inside - a nice mix of folks that didn't look on the verge of derelict state.  

Then it hit us: mildew buttbomb.  Not sure where it was drifting from (and I won't put it past my friend for just slipping one one out and blaming it on the establishment), but honestly - it was a bit chilly outside and the thought of catching a buzz in a massive dutch oven wasn't the worst thing on my list of to-do's that night.

Past the gassblast, this was a fun joint.  We sat down at the bar and had a couple of cocktails, followed by their nightly special - some sort of strawberry cowboy koolaid served in a sugar-rimmed martini glass. Good vibe, good service, good music - all around goodtimes.

We searched again for this place on Saturday night, but apparently my sense of smell was off.  Couldn't find it.  I'll take my Naselex next time and try again.
author: Brett L.

description: I love Lush Lounge because I am Linh the Lush.  LOVE the drinks, and the people that you meet are hilarious.
author: Linh D.

description:
Very cozy neighborhood bar with the most attentive (and CUTE) bartender!!  They make crazy good bellini's (with pieces of peach in the bottom...soooo good) and very sweet, but good mojitos.
I went here with some girlfriends and had a great time chatting it up.  The crowd was eclectic and mixed and it was surprisingly empty for a Saturday night...though I was probably just there too early.

Did I mention they have a hottie bartender??
I might have to come back regularly...for the bellini's of course.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Cool place in an area growing in popularity. Drinks are good, slightly pricey ($7-$9 but bartenders are quick which is nice. Sweet tea vodka is pretty good. Funky atmosphere, with a lot of random stuff. Has nice fire place as well.
author: Eddy N.

description:
Updated 2/9/08: No more David, the bartender :( This makes me pretty sad actually. I still come here now and then during the week but steer clear on weekends. It's way too packed and the crowd is weird. I use this place as more of a sit and have a drink alone while thinking at the bar. Basically, Sunday-Wednesday would be the night to go for me.
------
My friends and I found this bar while on a Tenderloin Pub Crawl. A year later and we have become regulars. Maybe it's because my best friend and her sister live right across the street or maybe it's because the bartenders are hot and nice and well--when the bartenders think you are cool, all in the world is right for a drunkard, if ya know what I mean.

There are tons of girly drinks, including two slurpie machines that are contantly churning cheap chilled boozie goodness. I've done more shots here than I can count though so you aren't relegated to the foo foo stuff. I usually just trust the bartenders to get me drunk off whatever they want to pour and I've never been let down. 

Go here. Say hi to David. Maybe you'll see me and my clan of drunk girl friends sometime.
author: Cindy P.

description:
Bambi came by got sloshed at Lush and staggered out after 4 margaritas to head to the movies...the rest I can't remember.
