Always a great spot for happy hour. Can get busy on Friday and Saturday nights as expected. Service is always prompt and the staff is friendly.
author: Teddy d.

description: Lush is probably one of the better bars on Polk Street to go to. The venue is quite beautiful and does not feel as dirty and cheap as its peers. They have a great set up of tables and a long table to hang around. More importantly they have great drink selections and specials that other bars do not offer. Can get a little pack on the weekends but cool place to lounge around.
author: Ed L.

description:
I love this bar, I really do. It's got a good vibe. It took me about 4 visits to realize it had a rainbow outside. Either way, there's such a good mix of peeps here. I always meet some foreigners here and Katie M. knows how I feel about accents. They've always got some fruity cocktail on special and they've got a decent selection of drafts as well. There is always some random movie playing on the TV. 

Minus one star for being a cash only bar. They do have an ATM in the back, but that just adds $4 in fees to my evening. 

Minus another half star for always being so damned crowded, but I'm not going to dock them for that! I like to round up.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Loved it!
Um, can we please discuss the effing RED BATHROOM?!?

Ok, now that my bladder feels as stylish and as sassy as I did at Lush, let's get to the point. So I've been on this pear vodka kick thing lately. Now you as well as I know that Verna is not into the girly drink nonsense, but pear freaking vodka? UHmazing! Had it at a bar in LA a year or so ago and have been waiting for it to be available in SF. Finally.

The bartender was awesome. I told him to make me something with pear vodka. It resulted in this fabulous cantalope, pear, lime, amazingness. We were going to name it. But it didn't really happen. But he said anytime I or anyone else wants it, just ask for the Cantalope Martini with Pear Vodka. So there you go. Let me know if you get it so that I can start charging for popularity rights. :)

Also, I'm sorta hesitant to admit this, but I haven't had a Long Island since graduation weekend in college. I know you know what I'm talking about. It's like once you graduate, your days of Long Islands, AMFs, and Jungle Juice are over (except if you're in Vegas).... (or in the Marina....) OK OK, simma down, I'm JK, not Marina bashing. You all know you love a night in the Marina every once in a while so don't get your panties in a double knot.

Lush made the Long Island make me happy. And deliciously so. You could poured that huge ole glass of smackingly good LI into a martini glass and served it at Gary Danko's.
author: verna b.

description: Homemade margaritas @ The Lush Lounge are fantastic. Fresh lime, agave, and tequilla in the heart of San Francisco, what's not to like? Remember to bring cash... No cards.
author: Heath P.

description:
Such a great place to spend a sunny afternoon enjoying a perfect Bloody Mary or two... Wonderful decor, good music, cozy size, good location, fun clientele, great bartender.

Considering I enjoyed Lush Lounge so much during the day, I certainly need to see what the story is at night. I will update...
author: Aaron J.

description:
Went here thanks to Yelpers uniting to direct my friend and I to a fun place on Saturday night. We posted a list of things we were looking for and Yelpers came through for us! Well...there weren't as many cute boys there as I'd like to have seen...but you can't win them all.

Dig on the $3 frozen watermelon martinis, the rockin' oldies/motown tunes, AND the seats at the bar.

I'm sure I'll be back here.
author: Diane S.

description:
Great atmosphere.  Very comfortable.  Defies categorization.  This is the poster child of SF lounge, hip, night culture.  

There's no pretension, no judgment.   It's all just about lounging, being w/ friends, meeting new friends, and drinking great cocktails.
author: Rod '.

description: if it weren't for the rudest most stuck up bartender i have ever been in the presence of i would say this place wasn't so bad.  yeah, you know who you are (skinny, dark straight long hair, braces).  "We all make margaritas the same way."  No you don't.  If you weren't too busy flipping your hair around and sticking your nose up to the air high on yourself you would have taken a minute to listen to my request.  Your very nice male counterpart had made me two top shelf margaritas with very little sugar and other ingredients that I am sensitive to.  the next time some once kindly says to you, " I don't mean any disrespect, but would you mind if the other bartender makes my drink" you might want to get off your high horse and think about someone other than yourself.  instead you slammed down the well tequila and started pouring my drink pissed off and ego hurt like blabbing about how you all make them the same at the same time pouring something completely different from what i was drinking.  such a B.... that I had to walk away from you because I can't handle that bad energy from someone serving me something i am about to ingest.  when i tell you how i feel you then snap your fingers at the bouncer to throw me out because you can't handle being wrong.  not sure how you even have a job treating people that way.
author: C B.

description: Man with Lush Lounge's new location they really went up twice in my book.  Before even walking into the bar you get this warm cozy feeling- I love the huge doors, and once inside the lighting and ambiance are perfect for any season.  We came for happy hour and the deals were great!  We came in 15 minutes before happy hour ended and the bartender allowed us to buy 2 glasses of wine each.  They also had good specials and deals after happy hour ended.  The bartenders were very nice, you can even rent the upstairs area for a low minimum or nothing, just come in and spend your $ at will.  I will be back!
author: Megan L.

description:
It's a pretty tiny place to lounge around and hang out...if you have concerns about people invading your personal space (like I do)....you don't want to hang out here for longer than an hour.

The walls are cluttered with photos and weird decorations and it's dark inside. I liked my little corner and pretty much hung out there the whole time I was inside. Parking kinda sucks, too!

If you have good company with you, you would enjoy being at Lush. I got distracted with all the clutter and people invading my space.
author: V M.

description: I'm mostly a fan because I'm in here a lot. That might be a bit of understatement but it does ring true. It's nice, if you can grab a seat by the fire then it's super cozy, and the drinks are pretty decent. Or so I hear from my friends because I'm always getting the sangria. Tis a friendly place with a nice ambiance to it (especially if you can beat the crowds).
author: Shauna S.

description: I just moved into the area a few months ago and found Lush to be a great neighborhood bar.  The vibe is unpretentious and the drink specials are really cheap.  That said, the bartenders here still try to style up their drinks in their own way.  The place isn't very big and usually has a decent crowd of locals, but you should be able to still pack in a few of your friends for a great time.
author: Aaron W.

description: All I can say is blueberry martini! The bartender here is awesome. Perfect blend of blueberry vodka, bit of lemon juice, and 3 berries. They also had these tasty slushy vodka mixes- I highly suggest the mango. I love the quirky art hanging all over the wall and ceiling. Very kitschy. Music wasnt too loud. This place has an air of history, very nice. Nice to get away from Castro sometimes..
author: Thomas L.

description: Cool bar on Polk Street. Drinks are priced well, crowd is pretty relaxed. My friend had his birthday party here and he is a regular so anytime we go out we usually come here. Definitely a place to check out.
author: Darius A.

description: Been here many times. And will return many more. Nice atmosphere great service and never had any problems with clientele. Other bars in the area can't seem to hold a candle to this one.
author: Joseph B.

description: Bewildered that I never wrote a review before. Old location had a shady scene but always entertaining to watch the "working ladys of night." Bartenders performance is phenomenal. They always seem to control the crowd and keep cool.  The rasberry truffle cocktail with real shaved chocolate is "Awe" ......"Some" The new location is devine. with pool tables upstairs and cozy fireplace downstairs. I even like the gothic front door that resembles a castle. good investment to move. but the douchebags may be more prevalent on weekends. wait im done writing. I think I'll grab a few libations at Lush now!
author: Alex S.

description: Amazing! Love the decor and atmosphere of this place. Dropped my id here on Friday and they mailed it back! Thanks Lush!!
author: Joann L.

description:
The drinks are still great but it's not like what it used to be when they used to have live music on the stage above the bar.  Without the music it's just a standard bar with good drinks and a movie decor.   There's a bunch of bars in the area which are walking distance which is a good thing too.

Update: 8/12/06- Went there with some friends of mine and I ended up seeing 2 groups of friends by coincidence.  I had a great time.  The bartenders are great (gave me a free beer at the end) and it's never too loud so you can talk.  A great hang it is.
author: Mitch A.

description: Very cool bar in my hood, McTeagues is my local haunt but Lush is up there & definitely a contender. Great wood finish to the bar & follow that up with awesome bar staff & your in for a great nights drinking.
author: Jennifer R.

description: No cover, mellow crowd, drinks are cool, music okay nice area for bar hopping!
author: Rhea F.

description:
Headed over here after a show at the Shooting Gallery (which I do recommend you checking out if in the hood). Had dinner at Thai house which was excellent BTW!. 

We managed to score the corner booth in the window at Lush and that is what kept us there. However the drinks were horrible!!! I first ordered a mango margarita - Aye disgusting - tasted like watered down peach schnaps - ugh. they did switch it our for me (I have NEVER) returned a drink before BTW. I got a seabreeze and again it was terrible - didnt bother with a third try.

The frozen martinis looked good but didn't have the strength to try after that. Maybe I'm getting old and just can't drink mixed drinks or cheap alcohol. bar had good vibe but wouldn't go there again unless I already had some drinks in me.
author: carrie m.

description: My friends (San Fran locals) warned me not to go in here because of the notoriously rude bartenders, but it look relatively non-crowded inside and I was looking for something a little more chill.  I should have just listened to them because sure enough one of the bartenders was straight up MEAN to me. He was taller, and thin and a brunette, I really wish I had gotten his name so I could have informed management. I ordered several rounds of shots and tipped well over 20% so I don't know where his animosity was coming from when I asked him for a Sprite to chase another round of shots with. I waited and waited and finally he grimaced at me & literally shouted in my face "DID YOU NOT SEE ME POUR THE SOAD, DID YOU NOT SEE ME, SERIOUSLY? WHY ARE YOU STANDING HERE?" I've never been spoken to like that, especially not from someone who virtually lives off tips. His rudeness ruined the entire experience. I still tipped him well though, I pitied him, honestly.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Wonderful, can't beat em, seriously good Mojitos.

The atmosphere is fun (in an entirely Asia SF on hard drugs kinda way), which can get a little tiring after a while. And the cash only, somewhat expensive drinks, mean you gotta carry some cash in (or use the expensive ATM there).
author: Matt C.

description: So crowded, so loud. Not my thing. The decor is cool, the drinks aren't anything you can't get anywhere else. We stood up on the balcony, and watched people pushing and shoving below. Seems like a scene for single twenty-somethings. They have a decent happy hour, so I will probably try again during a less hectic time. I'm never going to be back on a weekend night though.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
Medium size hole in the wall kind of chill out place. Pass by lush very often but never found the occasion to step in. 1 minute after stepping into it, realized that one doesn't really need a special reason to enter. 

Very cozy environment, love the setting and lighting. Mixture of fake and  potted plants. Ideal place if you want to chill with friends.

My favorite drink was the chocolate martini and frozen martinis. They are awesomE! Reasonable prized too.

Staff are friendly and honest. Very responsive to your needs.. enjoyed my night.
author: Yu Qi T.

description: Lush had super friendly bartenders, super friendly customers, and super friendly drinks! Their signature mojito was out of this world, as well as some crazy margarita (I forgot the name - see the picture). It's a little on the small side so it gets crowded quickly, but the people are chill enough to make it bearable. I also want to comment on all of the plants in the window! Huh??
author: Susan L.

description:
He says :  I took "she says" here on our first date.  OK, she'll probably debate that it wasn't our "first"  hahahaha.  Anyways, I love coming here because the drinks are so dang tasty.  The bartenders really put their time into making their drinks like my favorite, the Mojito.  I know most bartenders just want people to get in and get out (is that why a vodka redbull is so popular?  hmmmm) but come on!!!   

Yes, this is a diverse place with a collection of gay, straight, hipsters, and more.  Open your mind with some great people and awesome drinks.

She Says:
Given my visit and location of this joint, I'd say they do cater more so to the gay community... although He Says tries to deny it.  It's okay... I know he likes to hang out here because he's secure about his manhood.  Hah!
author: Miss Bonnie B.

description:
Really love this place. 
Nice bar tenders, decently priced cocktails, fun/mellow/quirky/eclectic atmosphere. "B-52's dressing room decor"

Love it.
author: Julia T.

description:
While home for Thanksgiving Travis and I met up with some friends here.  This place is super chill, and has $3 PBR, so it already fit most of my needs.  It did get a little crowded, but they also were playing old movies (one of which being The Maltese Falcon) on the TVs above the bar, and playing lots of fun music, so clearly the slight crowding wasn't that bothersome.  In fact, it was never so crowded that I felt uncomfortable, but it did get a little noisy at times.  

Minus one star for parking being kind of a bitch (welcome to San Francisco), and in a bit of a shady area.  We got lucky and parked on Hemlock, but I wouldn't count on being that lucky on a regular basis.
author: Catherine K.

description:
It was OK. The scenery and look and feel were nice. We were there on a Sunday so it wasn't too crowded. 

For gays, it's very friendly and there were a few gay couples there.

For Straight, you can come too. it's nice and open friendly atmosphere.

CASH ONLY but they have an ATM.

The bartender made me a white russian that was mostly cream. I asked for more vodka and he didn't look happy about that. The white russian was weak, ok?

Overall, not so bad. Drinks were more than I wanted to pay but the location was good and was a good after dinner drinking place with friends.
author: Adam C.

description:
I happened to stumble into this bar last night with a friend on our way back to her apt,  I can't really remember why we went into it in the first place.  Oh yea it was a Sunday night and bev mo was closed and we couldn't wait until we got back to have another drink, or maybe we had to pee too.  

Anyways it was a slower night but there were people scattered around so it wasn't awkward.  We just had a beer and bolted.  But I'm pretty sure the first time I went here i had some specialty drink and it was pretty darn good.

A good spot for a quick drink if you are waiting for a movie or even a nice meet up spot with good music but not too loud so you can't hear yourself talk.
author: Diana D.

description:
First time I went there on a Wednesday night with a friend who grew up (yup, pretty rare!) in Tenderloin but now lives in Vegas. I was going to take him to Bourban and Branch, but he picked this place because he missed it.

We each got 2 shots of Knob Creek, the pourings were HUGE, it was more like 4 shots each. We sat down on the corner wood bench, kept our legs rested on the stool, I LOVED IT! The bench is designed differently, like a V shape so you could rest your butt there comfortably, without having to keep your back straight all the time.

2nd time I went there was a Monday afternoon after going to Brenda's for a late lunch. I have to say it is pretty strange going to a bar at 3pm on a Monday. This time I wanted something girly because I had rehearsals later, and found out that they actually have a very exciting cocktail menu!! I got the lychee pomegranate martini, delicious! But I couldn't taste lychee or martini...at all. Strangely enough, 3 hours later in my rehearsal I started burbing lychee, well, still delicious!
author: Yuchi C.

description:
I don't know about you but I love this place. It's never insanely crowded and stuffed full, the patrons and staff are all super friendly, and the specialty drinks are fabulous.

I think the last time i had some sort of dark chocolate berry something martini.. wow. Hit me like a ton of bricks once I got to the middle of it. Strong and tasty and ohhh it took me awhile to sober up once i left!! 

I think what I like best is that it really is pretty loungey and mellow, it's a good place to have a few drinks and catch up with your friends without having to shout over a huge crowd or a bad jukebox! PLUS there always seems to be a movie on the tv screens overhead!
author: Diana R.

description: This was a good spot to start the night and start off slow.  It was kick back but popping.  The crowd was a good mix and it seemed to be a cozy place.  It was pretty loud and crowded on the lower level.  There is a 2nd level that my friends and I were able to have a corner to ourselves where we can just chill be comfortable and chit chat.  I wasn't feeling the music in this place.  But not sure if they change it up or if it's always that type of music.
author: Beverly F.

description: There is nothing Lush about this place.  Drinks were cool, but not as cool as all the ghetto ass Tenderloinin muda fukas who pick pocketed me inside the joint.  I was there on a very packed Saturday Night, at least half the people inside were a part of my friends birthday party... AND they kicked him out because he was too drunk.  Its like WTF?  Give him some ice water and find him a seat.  Douche Bags.  My first time in the neighborhood and it was all so tragic.  When in doubt... stay at home in the castro.
author: J T.

description:
If I could give .5 of a star lush would get 3.5. I highly recommend the mojito...supposedly one of the best in the city, hot damn, I agree! I have this friend who thinks I put too much pressure on the joint and the drinks and set my expectations too high...I totes disagree and think people should go to yelp expecting a damn fine mojito and that's what they will get. Oh, and the bartenders were uber cute. The space is a tad small and I started to feel all claustrophobic...but clearly I should have had another beverage. the jungle atmosphere was a bit disturbing but the old movies playing in the background was a great touch. 

3.5 stars all the way.
author: Natalie C.

description:
With all their delicious and affordable drink specials you can certainly be a lush at this electric neighborhood bar. Lush is an everybody bar not just gay and not just straight ---this is San Francisco does it really matter? 

Last night my friends (me straight, one gay, and one is a confused bisexual) tried the blueberry martinis and then a mango frozen martini. Each martini was $5 or under. The bartenders nor is the crowd is pretentious and the scene is def. more "friendly" than a pick-up spot. A very comfortable place to grab a drink after a movie, work, or just to catch up on conversations.
author: Kat F.

description:
A friend introduced me to this place years ago and if I'm ever in the neighborhood I always try to find an excuse to come here - the huge crazy fruity drinks are good, there is always a pretty diverse crowd, everyone including the staff is friendly, and motorcycle parking right out front - what more could one want?

I've never stayed for long there, just a drink or two before heading out (or home).  Good meeting point to start the night or a nightcap to end it.
author: Doug M.

description:
GREAT DRINKS!!! so totally starting off with what a nice and chill atmosphere you are presented with.. Bartenders are sweet and know how to make strong drinks, and love the energy they provide...have one for everyones type!! always fun music..great for those moments when you need to sing along.. love the neighborhood feel and the regulars, and you know who you are... :)  love the relaxing feel that this place has.. totally best during the week!! 

Fav drinks: bloody marie, dirty vodka, mango & watermelon frozen martini!! love it is like drinking an alcoholic slushy in a martin glass.. go for the double totally a great buy!! half the fun is watching them make your drink for you, true bar-tending...over all cant go wrong.
 

Has been a major stomping ground on my nights out in the city..over the past few years.. Totally love the gay decor and vibe, though have been noticing the straights are totally taking  over!! Totally enjoy the mix bar that this place was, but now the bouncer guy?? what has this place become. have to admit though i will hold a close place in my heart for the great times had laughing and drinking...an great people watching!! 

I feel like i need to voice out a shoot for my fellow gays to make our presence better known.. Worried that we may be pushed out..Love this place to much!!

Glad to see business is huge, just concerned with the changing taking place... really do enjoy having the crazies walk in and shoot at us the paying consumers and the total drunks trying for one more drink... that trashy feel is what is all about the area!!  kinda like getting a show for free!! :)

All in all if you are still reading this, please go and enjoy your time here!! talk to others totally a kick back environment. just please go and be yourself it a great neighborhood spot!!
author: Danny B.

description:
For some reason, I always find myself back here even 2 nights in a row!  No cover. Hardly a bathroom line. The most delicious, seductive cocktails I've ever had. Oh and of course, Nichy, the "kawaii" rebellious bartender who took care of us.  The music isn't loud so I can actually hear my conversations even though I have deaf left ear.  It's AWESOME!!!

I went back to hang outside of Element Lounge, but I came right back to hang out until last call here.  Am I just a lush?

Ok off to Napoli
author: Yoko H.

description:
I've been here twice and I have very mixed reviews. The first time I went I enjoyed the drinks.. that's it.

Second visit.. bartender sucked! I'm a huge mojito fan, and I've had my share of good and bad mojitos.. This was overly sweet.. Can we say sugar rush?! The music is very hit or miss, I'm a huge fan of 80's but sometimes it gets a bit over the top cheezy. 

The crowd is this place is soo random! 1) I witnessed a woman being smacked on the ass with a stalk of celery  by her "friend".. funny 2) homeless man getting kicked out 3) Eurotrash tried sending his wife over to pick up on my friend and I 

Entertaining/creepy crowd? Yes. Drinks.. guess it depends on the night. I'll go back if I have nothing better to do.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I don't know why all these reviews say it's a value because $6.50 for a Jack and Coke doesn't seem like a big value to ME, but whatever. The ambiance is lovely, the clientle was varied, the specialty drinks are delicious, the owner (?) guy was friendly, but daaaaaaaaaaamn -- one of the straight-guy bartenders who came on later in the evening was cranky. 

Minus three stars for being reprimanded (!!!) by the bartender, but I'll give one back because we *were* drunk, just not THAT drunk.  

And just so I end on a positive note -- the frozen watermelon cosmos (or whatever they were) were good, surprisingly potent for a slushy machine drink, and rimmed with cinnamon sugar, which was an unexpectedly delicious flavor combo!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Lush Lounge has a really laid-back, varied crowd which makes me a very happy girl.  Grab a drink and chill out on the steps in the back corner with your friends.

All these reviews talk about people in drag, but I haven't seen anyone in drag there.  Maybe it was the wrong night.  Maybe they just look convincing.
author: Tamara M.

description:
Hi. 

I really like this place because the doorman is always doing some sort of crossword puzzle or something intellectual. It makes me feel smart. for going to that bar. like a professor is the doorman or something. 
Lush Lounge is where you can begin the night because they have some snazzy delicious cocktails, then proceed to literally crawl around Polk St. and guzzle beer at R Bar/Hemlock/Vertigo, and end up here again after your TL pub crawl so you feel like you ended the night with cla$$iness. 
However the one gripe I do have is one of the bartenders isn't exactly Mary Sunshine, but perhaps he's just one of those good-looking-straight-bartender-don't look at me-worship me type of guys.
Overall, it's a nice place to chill with friends or a date because it's cozy and unpretentious and it makes me happy.
author: Christina L.

description:
I don't really remember much about this place but what I do remember is that its an average spot. I was here for my night cap on a friday night of drinking. I ordered a beer with my friends and we were all chatting. They do have a few beers on tap and my friends had some martini's, which I appropriately made fun of them shortly thereafter. I'm sure this is a great place for a couple drinks on a date...but don't come here with some friends looking to continue a good buzz. Now to the story.

So I'm writing a text message on my phone and I look up and see a guy turned around at the bar staring at me. I ignore him and continue to message then I look up again and he's still staring at me!!! So I yell out, "hey I ain't calling you", at that point I expected him to get in my face, which usually happens at other bars, but he looked like a yuppie who was really scared at that point. He then turned around to face the bar and my friends and I joked about the situation. He didn't look at us the rest of the night.
author: D J.

description:
I dropped by Lush on a recent Saturday night. The area is a little sketchy, but you can find parking within a few blocks. The cocktails were pretty good. The shots were a little pricey ($9-10 avg). 

I can't say much for the crowd. It was about 80% guys that night, but probably due to a friend's birthday celebration. It was a little cramped in there, but there were a bunch of seats all around. 

fyi - Someone tried to pay with credit card and they said cash only!
author: Ring K.

description: This place has super yummy drinks and super low prices. Went with a bunch of girlfriends and would definitely go back.
author: Kathryn M.

description: REMEMBER TO BRING CASH!  I really love this place.  Singles ready to mingle, good alcohol selection (Chimay beer!), nice decorations.  It is always an interesting interaction in the bathroom though when the boys and girls doors are right next to each other and you share a sink.  Funny though.  Definitely go check it out.  And if you don't like it there is a larger bar next door that is also super fun (I found myself at a dog fashion show there one night.. literally people modeling down a runway with dogs).
author: Melissa B.

description: A dog friendly bar in the fun area of Polk St? Perfect.
author: Matt P.

description: When I'd recommend "Lush Lounge" to friends, they'd automatically assumed this was a douchey, Marina-esque bar. But don't let the name fool you. Lush is not your typical bar. It's a bar that's over-the-top everything. From their hanging plants, vinyl records and framed pictures that cover the walls (let's not mention a flying mannequin!?) to their unique drink concoctions, Lush Lounge is a one of a kind find. It's also a bar that attracts the most interesting crowd: college students from USF, senior citizens, dogs?, trannies from the TL and Polk street bar dwellers. So if you're that easily distracted / entertained, people watcher type of drunk, Lush Lounge is a MUST to get lush at.
author: Alex H.

description:
Ive been here before but could never remember the name.  Went last night and it all came back to me...great cocktails, excellent (friendly, knowledgeable and cool) bartenders, fresh squeezed juice, good beats and reasonable prices...

The atmosphere is great - although all the random plants are a bit weird.

If you dont mind braving the TenderNob...get to Lush Lounge...its worth the trip.
author: Ken S.

description:
I used to love this place when it was gay. Alas, it's been discovered by the masses, and now I have to make sure to have my anti-hipster spray in tow whenever I visit. (Which is rare these days.)

Still, it's worth the trip just to see the 1970s dried-pasta collage poster of Nancy Sinatra at the Fillmore. Flawless.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description:
Daveeed, where the fuck did you go? Was it because we stopped missing your Tuesday nights? Was it the requested over-abuse of the old Bowie b-sides? Was it because we didn't fawn over your hair enough? Dammit man, where in the world is Daveeed San Diego? 

Some things have sooooo much promise... take the band Kinski. Fun rollicking guitar driven droning rock. Periodically, the band tries to sing. Dear Kinski, please don't rely on the vocals to carry any of your tunes. The charm of Kinski is not the front man. I know that statement makes me somewhat of an asshole, but what makes Kinski's music special is the strength of the music (Edge Set, Wives of Artie Shaw, The Party Which You Know Will Be Heavy, etc.) Really, take the lyrics out of Newport and there's absolutely NO degradation there. Alpine Static remains the standard bearer.

Lush seems to suffer the other extreme. The lynch pin here is the bartender(s). Lush has the ability to be a cool place to have a drink or two (or four). However, a poor bartender here (and I realize that "poor" is subjective in this biz) sucks all the joy out of stopping here, especially since this is a mixed club (homo/trans/hetero). I argue that the bartender at a joint like Lush serves as an even more important facilitator of the social glue. So Daveeed, where the hell are ya?
author: Rob S.

description:
Lush Lounge is fine. It's not someplace I'd go out of my way to get to, but since it's a block or two from home and I don't have any serious qualms with it, I'll keep going back.

I'm not sure if it's me or the menu, but I've struck out with Lush specialty cocktails. The key lime martini was super sweet and syrupy, not tart at all like I was hoping for. The blueberry martini was better but didn't really taste like blueberries... I should remember this each time I go in and order beer instead, but the martini menu is just so alluring. I bet I'll find a good one sooner or later... I do want to try to jalapeno-infused tequila.

The crowd seems to change a lot. I've seen everything from uber-drunken women in their 30s draping themselves all over men at the bar to bikers chillin' with buddies to "normal" peole just hanging out.

I like the vibe in there... reddish lighting, dark wood, and old-fashioned bar decorations. One of these old-fashioned decorations is a cigarette ad with a woman that looks a lot like my mom... even more so after a few drinks. Weird.

It's definitely an added plus that you can order dinner or snacks from Hank's across the street and eat them at the bar. They even make it easy by having menus all over the place. Try the blue cheese tater tots... yum. Now if Hank's would only deliver...

Long story short, Lush is not phenomenal, but it's a decent bar to have in the neighborhood.
author: Carmen B.

description: I almost feel like they should start a new review list for the new lush- its really a different bar.  Yes, the same awesome bartenders are there, but the bar itself is a lot different.  It has a lodge-type feel with a fireplace and an upper story with tables and benches.  The restroom situation is a bit odd- they have separate bathrooms for men and women but a common sink room.  For those women who feel compelled to fix makeup that might be not cool.  Fortunately, I'm not one of those women.  On the plus side, it allows us to verify that the menfolk are washing their hands.  Dirty boys.
author: Amanda B.

description: I have been here several times and LOVE it!!  The drinks are amazing (try a blueberry or chocolate martini or a margarita) and reasonably priced and the ambiance is fantastic.  Lush lounge is a lot of fun no matter what time of day you go;  during the afternoon you can chill in a seat by the open windows and people watch while you relax with a few drinks, or after dark the bar gets crowded and you can party with friends.  Everyone that works here is nice and they provide great service.  Great drinks, fun music, laid back, good atmosphere, and great service; what more can you ask for in a bar?  This bar is definitely one of my favorites!!
author: Emily W.

description:
One of my favorite places. Good looking crowd with great drinks!

http://www.lipglossculture.com/2011/street-pop-san-francisco-local-favorites-where-to-shop-eat-and-party/4/
author: Katie G.

description:
This place was much better in it's old location, I would have given all five stars.  Since it's move across the street, I've found the people in there are not the same.  Not the bar's fault I know, but this used to be my favorite bar in the city, and now it's just a quick stop on my Polk street bar hop.

They do still make a great martini (of any kind), so I'll keep it at three stars.
author: Mike T.

description: Thank god my favorite lush opened its doors right before NYE.  It was crowded on that Wednesday night and the space was great.  What can i say, i love this place unconditionally.  The fireplace adds a quaint charm and it is so nice to have the option to go upstairs to get away from it all.  I love the long communal bar table down the center.  It is just so much bigger and more open than the last location.  I didn't recognize any of the old bartenders, so i am hoping they might return soon!  Great bar...i love this bar
author: Lyndsey H.

description:
nice polk spot to grab a drink.  the decor is interesting, with statues of the virgin mary and buddha, and flat screen tvs.  big open windows in front for some semi-outdoor feeling seats.  nothing really special about this place, so i would normally give a place like this a 3 stars.

BUT, $2 PBRs and $6 shots of patron?!  now i know where i'm going next time i want to black out in record time.  they are pretty stingy about their happy hour though.  2 minutes after happy hour was over, i went to grab another PBR, and was charged $3!  crazy, i know.
author: dan a.

description: I like this place.  We came around 10pm on a Saturday night and it was pretty dead but by 11pm, the place was bustling!  There are very few tables/chairs so 90% of the place is standing room only.  The drinks are fairly priced and the crowd is pretty diverse.  The second story is a little quieter than the first floor so it was nice to be able to hang out with friends without having to scream into their ears.  Really like this place and would definitely come back!  Also, if this place is full, there are a bunch of Irish pubs nearby as well.
author: Kristie G.

description: great place. Nice layout with interesting stuff on the walls. Friendly bartenders and the clientele are easy to talk to.
author: Ddc C.

description: Loved Jack, the bartender. Got way drunker than I thought I would because the drinks were cheap and the service was great.
author: Aly M.

description: Nice place to go, even on a weeknight.  It wasn't crowded when I ended up here on a Wednesday.  The large window near the front of the bar was open to the street.  Only one homeless person came up to talk to me and my friend.  Bud light is on tap, which is awesome.  Also, the pomegranate martini doesn't taste like pomegranate.  Its certainly a distinctive taste, but not quite all there.  Other cocktails might be better, but I stuck to that one and draft beer.  A nice place for a little-after-happy-hour drink with friends.  I'd go back.
author: Beth V.

description:
A friend and I walked into this place for happy hour one day.  It looked like a cool dive but at the time we didn't know it was a gay hangout, so be warned if you're not into that sort of thing.  But it isn't all gay, hell I went there strictly for the drinks because they were so damn delicious!  The bartenders would take forever to make your drink, but at least I could see that he was making everything from scratch --- squeezing the limes, peeling the lemons.  

They used to have a lounge piano player every Friday night.  He was an old man, and we used to sip on our pina coladas and wonder how much longer he could play before arthritis got the better of him.  Last time I went I think a few of the bartenders had left and the drinks didn't taste as good anymore.  But yeah, totally chill, totally mellow if you are looking for a downbeat place.
author: Jackson Z.

description:
Pretty small place but I went on a  Monday night and it was a good sized crowd--everybody could sit. When I first walked in I noticed a bathroom smell that I must have acclimated to after a half hour.

The selection of sweet mixed drinks were wonderful because the ones I had weren't overly sweet like they are at every other bar in the world. 

I would love to go here again.
author: Robert V.

description:
When I went: Sun night 8-10 pm.
Who I went with: A girlfriend who doesn't like clubs and writes for law journals and likes English literature

Drinks are really inexpensive here: From ($3) for beers and a few fruity specials to ($7) for a lot of the other specials.

The ambiance is quite eclectic. There's a smorgasbord of 40's and 50's memorabilia and two TVs that are playing classics like The Graduate and Breakfast at Tiffany's. The setting is dark with orange and red lighting, but with the 80's music playing, it gets very loud inside. There's no room to dance so this would be more of a place to sit around talking to a friend or two. 

I've come here with a large group of young people and I was just glad that we had already had a few drinks before we had arrived. The seating isn't conducive to having a group outing here. The crowd is a bit older and you will see several regulars having a beer here. There are always far more men than women here.

The bartenders are always so nice here. One even made us popcorn just for fun and it was a really nice touch. The drinks are pretty strong here. The bathrooms are lit in bright red which always makes me feel uncomfortable because it really prevents you from seeing the true uncleanliness. It also makes you feel like you're waiting for a prostitute to come by.
author: Neelima D.

description:
Update:  So i have been back since this post and I do now see what everyone is talking about.  Shows you how much I care about that, gay not gay who gives a fly rats a$$.  The place is cool, the drinks are stiff, and the prices are right. 
The people watching is also priceless. 

OK Im a straight dude that has been oing here for sometime for the cheap martini's and crowd watching.  
I must be ABSOLUTELY blind because I haven't noticed the gay thing that everyone talks about.  There is a transgender bar across the street (DIVA) but never notice them in there.  I must just be completely faced by theh time they role in.

I go here to people watch and get wasted.  The drinks are stiff and the specials aren't.  The prices are fair and the crowd is priceless.

This is the place the XYZ crowd wish they could hang out at but are too busy trying to be ULTRA-cool to leave the pack.  
I've never picked up a broad here but thats probably because I am busy making crazy oogulie eyes at them or referring to them as broads. 

Don't bring a date here on the weekends unless you like to people watch together and don't mind screaming at them.
author: Spanky M.

description: Laid back bar scene with a cool vibe.  Pretty spacious and plays mostly new wave tunes so if you're looking for top 40 this might not be the place for you.  Drinks were generous as well.  Not too shabby: D
author: Christy B.

description: Pretty cool, i liked it.  Happy Hour is clearly posted. Wasn't too crowded on a Thursday.  The only thing holding me back from the 5 star rating is the drink selection for Happy Hour- I feel like they need another mixed drink.
author: Travis L.

description: This bar is great! Jack the bartender rocks ! Me and my Uncle and GF come to this bar everytime we are in San Francisco. The drinks are as good as they get. Its like eating at a candy store so many choices.
author: Ed G.

description: I've generally not been a fan of this place because of the annoyance of it being cash-only, but yesterday confirmed that I will never go back.  I was out with my husband and some friends, joining in SantaCon festivities, and we were making our way up Polk Street. We tried to go into Lush, and the bouncer said that anyone in costume was not allowed in. We were not overly drunk nor rambunctious. It was a very un-San Francisco move on their part, and I prefer not to give my business to places that so blatantly go against the fun-loving, laid back vibe of this city.
author: Jessie J.

description: Always loved it when it was an old lush  .. my very first bar in SF and frequent there for serval years !  Even met someone that i've dated for 4 years there.. =-) New lush is twice as fun, beautiful and still the same awesome staff!! congrats. ! one of my fav places in the city!
author: Anson K.

description:
I love this place.  I go there intermittently with various friends.  They are very nice.  They have free popcorn at happy hour.  If you like girly drinks, and aren't a cocktail snob, it's fab.  I love the cheap frozen fruit martinis.  I also love their mojitos which are made with love and very nice, not too sweet.  It's sort of a drag bar in that drag queens would be very comfy sipping colorful libations, and they are always showing a melodramatic movie or musical on the tvs.  If you are looking for uber trendy drinks or are a real butch manly man, this might not be the place for you.

Also the owner now has a taqueria across the street so you can order food from there.  They still weren't upset when my friend and I had burritos from someplace else.  Loves them.
author: Deniz T.

description: I pass by Lush every time im on the 4 going home. I swear it use to be something else before it was Lush Lounge?  Anyway, cool bar that's convenient to hit up on the way home or to stop by when you're in the TL for a quick drink.  The night i was here i met a dude who i swear was wearing the same jacket in the Thriller video and an irishman who complimented me on my taste for good whisky saying he's never met an american girl who knows her stuff.  Tell me something i dont know buddy....*polishes finger nails*  Pretty cool crowd.
author: Juv C.

description:
I've been going to Lush for a few years. I was devastated when they closed for their move. And of course, I had to go there a little after they re-opened at this new (current) location. It's great. Loads of room, a completely different crowd though than before at happy hour. Same great bartenders. Although to be honest, there's one that I avoid because he puts too much mixer and seriously not enough alcohol into drinks. Sami and Svetlana are still there, and Sami is there for Friday happy hours. Besides the fact that he's a cutie, he makes some of the best drinks around!
The new location doesn't have the red bathroom, the frozen martinis, the popcorn, or the golden mannequin (sp?), but they don't really lack anything. The atmosphere is great, the drinks are devine, and the staff is spectacular. 
I've brought at least a dozen friends here, and they keep coming back and brining new people. It's one of those places you'll never forget, and will keep dreaming about those delicious, -- and when it comes to the Almond Joy martini that Sami makes-- orgasmic martinis, you'll keep coming back.
author: Katia T.

description: Great new location, wonderful ambiance. If you like cosmos, this one is most fabulous! A nice venue on Polk Street!
author: Blaze F.

description: They don't strain the mojitos, so you get shredded mint stuck in your teeth. Some people like that.
author: Katherine B.

description:
I think my favorite specialty drink here is in between a Makers Manhattan or the Oatmeal Cookie; very spicy and sweet. The place is dark, eclectic in a very sophisticated way, and small. It gets pretty loud and crowded on a Saturday night but still worth the trek to mingle and drink.

I dont know if they accept credit but there is an ATM.

Oh and Ladies (and men) watch your handbags if you are sitting against the window. There are sketchy people always scoping them out from outside.
author: Allen B.

description:
Pretty fun bar. Always old movies on. Tons of specialty drinks, especially martinis. Kind of small but its usually not hard to get seats when people leave. ATM inside. Two bathrooms, one of which is Mens only. 

Only real bummer is the excessive amount of bums that bother you when you go out to smoke. Personally I find an enjoyment of interacting with bums after a bunch of drinks, but one time some crazy tried to rob me and my friends...with some nail scissors. Too bad he didn't realize there was a cop standing 5 ft. away, who batted the scissors out of his hand and frisked him and told him to get lost. 

But the corner of Post & Polk offers a variety of interesting characters, namely the trannies. Last time i was at the Lush I witnessed a great fight between the bartender and a tranny, who claimed that she was ripped off by the bartender. Not so much a fight as he just did his best to take the punches while pushing her out and locking her out until the cops got there. But hey, its the Tenderloin! If crazy but fun is your kind of thing, this is your kind of place.
author: Stu C.

description:
This is an excellent week night neighborhood bar.  The music is great, the bartenders are really friendly, but not over the top, and the crowd is always interesting.  

I even forgot my wallet on the bar the other night when I went in to pick it up the next day, everything was still there!  Thanks so much!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Lush is small and a good place to people watch.  They do a pretty good happy hour and lot's of interesting vodka drinks.  I used to frequent here regularly and run into the same people.
author: Rayna A.

description: Great bar! Tons of random stuff on the walls, really eclectic crowd and the bartenders are cute. Overall, it's kind of hard to explain, you just have to come and experience it for yourself.
author: Rose K.

description:
I love the new Lush. It's kinda swanky, but not too much that you feel uncomfortable. Friday's it's the bar of choice for those going on to dance at Mayes or Vertigo so can get real busy between 9 and 10pm. Its a great place to bring out of town friends if they don't want the dive bar or alternative vibe (which you can get just down the street at Hemlock etc).
On warmer nights they open the windows onto the street (especially cool on the night the Giants clinched the World Series!) and they also have an awesome fireplace for the colder nights too. Five stars.
author: Gazza B.

description:
My friend and I were lured into this cute little place last night. Of all the bars on the strip, Lush caught our eyes with its funky outside decor and frozen martini signs. Lush is small, but cozy and comfy. The decorating is excellent - black and white photos adorn the walls, and a silent film plays on the screen at top. The music was pretty nice, too -a little retro but definitley refreshing amidst the ever popular "club beatz" down the street. 

It was pretty dead inside. A few regular- types, and an old man that talked our ears off about his gambling addiction and close ties with Madonna, Jack Nicholson, etc. (I'm still wondering how much of that was BS). He was eventually what got us out of the place, but we probably would have stayed. The drinks were good. Not amazing, but good. We ordered some cosmos and then some sort of vodka/lemon shot. As the bartender explained, it literally was lemons soaking in vodka. Next time, I'd like to try some of their specialty drinks. 

The best part about this place was its non-threatening atmosphere. The two waiters - Chris and Jake (yes we got their names!)  - were so friendly and sweet. After we went to this bar down the street and a chick fight broke out (broken beer bottles, blood), we came back to Lush for some end-of-night comfort after the chaos. The bartenders were sweet and offered us water.

I give this place an A- for its friendly and warm atmosphere.
author: Claudia C.

description: Been to Lush a couple of times now and it definitely does the trick for the loud, bar crawl kind of night. It's your average Polk St. bar, if larger and with a more memorable restroom arrangement (the sinks are pretty cool, though I wish they had more wc's being such a large place). For whatever reason, it always ends up being the last place I go to during a (unexpected or otherwise) crawl, so my memory of it may be somewhat impaired, but in general I think it's just one of those places that always seems sufficiently crowded to get you (or keep you...) in the party mood, yet roomy enough that it's not suffocating. It's a tad exhausting though, which may be why it's always the last stop. Eh, I have mixed feelings. In any case, I hate the cash-only policy, so that'll probably keep me away for a while.
author: G. J.

description: Came here for HH before my birthday dinner and it was a nice little joint. Their HH drinks are pretty interesting, ranges from $5-$6. I like the blackberry something, strong. I suggest not ordering the lemon drop special, it was very sweet.
author: Nhung T.

description: So I was never really a fan of this place while living in the neighborhood. Came back into town recently and discovered that they had moved up the street. Great new location. Very nice. Was quite impressed. Much larger and a lot more space to sit and chill. Still not really my scene but I love the new set up.
author: Heather L.

description: This lounge is great; the drinks that we had (of course had to try some different martini's since we were in SF) were awesome! Being a dog lover, I thought the fact that the owners had their dogs in the bar and they were just chilling there with the guests, was awesome! The atmosphere was very inviting and warm, the bartender was very knowledgeable about the drinks and service was prompt
author: Andrew M.

description: The location's changed and so has the sweet taste of their lemon drops.  I miss the more low key place it used to be =(
author: Andrea L.

description: I went to Lush this past Saturday and had an awesome time, great venues and great ppl. I'm only giving it 3 stars because it doesn't take credit cards. I know a lot of ppl still like to use cash, but its nice to know you have the option to use your plasic, especially at bars.
author: Angela T.

description: Was there last night with a couple of friends. This is a cool bar with friendly people behind the counter. The bar had lame music till midnight but it got louder as more people starting pouring in around midnight. Overall a pretty chill place but the music could get louder and better
author: Kishor K.

description: Showed up at 4pmish. Got a maragrita $6. Drank. My god the drank was stiff. Hard working bartender. Provides good service.
author: Stanley L.

description: I forgot that we had ventured into this place weeks ago. Out with a few friends from dinner and was in the area. I prefer wine bars and lounges in different areas but depending on what group I'm with...I can try to enjoy it.  Not a bad place, reminds me of my college years. And I still was drinking beyond recognition that night. Haha. Honestly, depends on your crowd and your idea of a good night. Could be amazing for some people. But not for me.
author: Lola D.

description: This place is just a normal bar now. But before they used to have Martinis that came out of a slusshy machine. It was amazing. Now they are just a regular bar that accepts cash only. Not impressed. Maybe I just need to be already drunk before I go in there. And have cash or find a guy to buy me drinks.
author: sierra s.

description:
In memory of some of the coolest bartenders ever.. Rami and Sammy (brothers/bartenders/SF Legends) Ok maybe not legends but they are some cool mofos no less...

So a year and a half ago I moved to the City.  Not wanting to rush into things, I put myself up in a hotel off Van Ness.  The first night I wondered around the neighborhood... Route 101?  Damn, I see 7 people 6 doods all older than my pops.. nope not tonight... I keep on keepin on, make a left on Post, crossed Polk and what did I run into?  LUSH.  I headed in and feel like I  never left the place, until I moved to the Western Addition.  I must have went back every night... that's how much I enjoyed Lush.  I still head back every so often... usually, when I don't want to bring a lady to my area or to say hello to these magnificent bartenders....
I had one of the most amazing nights at Lush... sitting talking it up for like 3 hrs about anything and everything with this person.  I was blown away that I'd met someone like this on that particular corner (no not the trannies)... It was so crazy I had to tell my co-workers about it the next day..
Co-worker,"So who is this amazing woman?"
Me,"Umm.. actually his name is Barry and he's gay"
CW,"Umm Gabe you might want to move back to Oakland"
Me,"not like that not like that"
CW,"yaa,, that's how it starts.. next you'll be bring him to the company party"
Never that never that... 
I'll enjoy myself anywhere I'm at, even if it's a lounge that use to have drag queen shows upstairs... (didn't know that until I read a review about the place sometime later)
I love the old classic movies, the martini's, the ladies, people watching, and everything else about Lush. 
At least I know I'm attractive to men and women.. lol I think my head just got a little bit bigger.  Thank you Lush.
I've been told the brothers moved back to Italy.  If so, Lush will never be the same!
author: Jamal G.

description: If you ever go here and order a white russian, they *might* be out of cream.  If you still want that white russian, they *might* make you run across the street to the corner store and pick up some cream.  They will then reward you for your efforts with a free drink.  So that's something.  This is one of my favorite Polk Gulch bars.  Probably because of the white russian cream...
author: Lauren F.

description:
This really is a great place on polk street with a very friendly happy hour-ish vibe and a great mix of people. The prices are fair and they really have great bartender service that is as fast as it gets. 

They only accept cash so no credit cards. I recommend this place to locals and out of towners alike. It won't disappoint.
author: Ryan T.

description: Great Spot.  I like the big front window, great for people-watching and gives the place a very open feel.  The decor is good.  Music isn't amazing, but it works.  Do wish they served sauvingon blanc, but oh twell.  It was easy to reserve seating for a group and the guys at the bar took good care of me (thanks Chris and Jack)!
author: Rahna B.

description: What a pleasant bar. Sammy, the bartender was super-friendly, the drinks were superb, and the tourists who kept complaining left with a thank you and a smile. i had two drinks there with an old friend and both of us said that we'd be back after leaving. And we rarely lie.
author: Sam A.

description:
while doing some research for the magazine i'm editing today, i came across the lush lounge's website. splashed across the front page was the quote: "voted best pick up bar in san francisco"

wtf? really?? 

i don't see it. every time i come here, there's usually a group of really nice older gay men sipping on lemon drops and dirty martinis. there is also the tenderloin/polk gulch resident young-ish crowd situated along the counter or lounging at the tables toward the back having private conversations over their bloody marys and g&t's. 

everyone seems pretty cool. 

actually, it's kind of interesting to hang by the window facing divas. someone tried to sell me contraband through the window once, and the hookers on the corners are always fun to watch. they also play classic films on television screens and my friends and i usually fill in the dialogue and sound effects. our exchanges get pretty funny after the first couple of rounds.

it's no wonder i'm missing out on the pick up scene. i'm having way too much fun!
author: May T.

description: Just ok nothing earth shattering here. Crowd was a bit cold, heard great things about it, but left after one beer.
author: Joe A.

description: This is my new 'deep conversation bar.' Not for any other reason than I've always seemed to have very intellectual or heartfelt conversations here. Maybe because it's named 'lush' and that fits my persona. Or maybe there's fairy dust in the beer. Either way, I've determined this cool little bar is where I'm going from now on to talk everything out.
author: Michael E.

description: Came by this neighborhood hot spot yesterday while waiting for my classmates to meet me which they failed to do so. Well, it's still happy hour and I'll have a few drinks anyways. I love their cantaloupe martinis but they're mandarin happy hour cosmos are just as good. I have to say the place can get a bit rowdy with mid-day drunk revelers but it's wonderful to stop by when walking around the Polk.
author: Adrienne H.

description: This is one of the nicer bar venues on lower Polk Street. It's very clean, sort of dark, and intimate (read: smallish), but this lends a cozy feel that is conducive to conversation over a very nicely prepared martini. Thankfully, they have my Belvedere on hand. And the mixed crowd can and should be considered built-in entertainment.
author: Gregor G.

description:
there are over 90 useful reviews on lush, but this isn't one of them.

.
i came here alone on one cold christmas night...long story, don't ask...

the place was tranquil...no noise...completely empty...except for this one guy at the bar and the bartender...ahhh, just what i needed after another stressful christmas family gathering.

so i pull out a stool and sit somewhat near this guy...maybe four...maybe five stools down...

i'm not sure what prompted me to sit somewhat near him. perhaps even a holiday cynic like myself didn't want to be completely alone on a night like this...

he looks at me momentarily before he goes about his business.

the bartender comes over and asks, "what can i get you, fella?"

"a cold one...maybe a stella", i said.

"you got it. coming right up", he said...and pours a nice, cold stella from the tap.

ahhh, tastes so good...mmmm, tastes so refreshing...

everything is slowing down...to a crawl...

.
just me, my beer, the bartender and this guy in a bar on a cold, lonely, eerily quiet christmas night.

silence...slience...and more silence...

after thirty minutes or so, we sorta glance and nod at each other, and go about our business again.

silence...silence...and more silence...

another thirty minutes go by...and i decide to buy the guy a beer. i mean, after all, it is christmas.

he's a budweiser kinda guy.

he thanks me, or more like nods at me for the beer...and goes about his business again...not even a small talk, which was fine with me cuz i didn't feel like talking that night either. 

silence...silence...and more silence...

another thirty minutes go by...and the guy returns the favor and buys me a beer.

i nod at the guy...and go about my business.

silence...silence...and more silence...

another thirty minutes go by...and i buy the guy another beer.

he nods at me again...and goes about his business.

silence...silence...and more silence...

another thirty minutes go by...and the guy buys me another beer.

i nod at the guy...and go about my business.

silence...silence...and more silence...

this act of goodwill goes on for the next three hours until...

.
time for last call...time for me to go home...

so i nod at him for one last time...and exited rush...

i never got his name. we never said a word, but that was ok with both of us on that cold, lonely, eerily quiet christmas night.

.
somewhere johnny cash was smiling...
author: frisco j.

description:
My premise. A date. At one point I'm asked, "Well dear, what do you think of kids?" - arbitrary and benevolent I respond in force, "Sometimes when they scream, I just want to shake them till the noise falls out." And this is where I'll let you in on a hoot - three hours later we're sitting on the steps to city hall, prim and proper. "I have a kid..." she decries. Good god, I'm a boy in his late-twenties who simply didn't see this coming (incidentally it's not mine, we just met).  Rewind. We walk into this bar, tacky with decline - it's flamboyance matched only by my margarita. It was magnificent and morbid all at once... a feisty martini glass donned with an assortment of brightly coloured fruit. Her with the beer and tatted demeanor, me with the dreams of a large gay population in the tender of my grip. Sipping without a straw I make comment on the weather; polite and delusional - this is my vice. A girl to my left strikes up an unexpected conversation - an interlude to my event, I'm lost in the moment. Words are flying unabated and I can't let go of this stranger of mine.  Rude, wretched am I - the fluster reaches it's boil and I lean in for my Castro'd delight, but my mind's a mess and the bloody thing topples over with flashy decline. A crotch soaked in Casadoras, a red cherry nestled merrily below my belt buckle.

The date proper reaches over and picks it up; the b-rate movie rerun as it curls across her lips. The teeth to a bite and my arbitrary stranger became contrite. Oh, we men are a cheap delight.
author: Marc M.

description: an old friend, new location. The Lush is the best.Class act bartenders who don't grumble when you ask them to make really annoying drinks like bloody marys, or fresh fruit mojitos. Great drink selection,lots of fun and exotic combinations I'd never quite think of (blackberry and champagne--YUM!).Go there early on a weekend because at a certain time the crowd gets kinda lame,but the ambiance and drinks make it all worth it
author: Lauren V.

description: I really liked the last Lush Lounge, and I was worried they wouldn't be able to recapture the ambiance at their new location. Fortunately, I was wrong! The new space is much larger, but the delicious drinks and friendly bartenders have stayed the same. I hit up happy hour on a Thursday afternoon and the crowd was great - enough people to keep up the mood of the bar, but not too crowded at all. Definitely plan on frequenting this new location more than I did the last one. Expansion was a success for sure.
author: Anne A.

description:
Fun bar on a Saturday night.  It's not as packed as a lot of the similar bars because it's pretty big and has two levels.  Came here with about a dozen friends for my birthday and we all had a great time.  The only thing I wish they had was credit card acceptance - cash only is a killer.  Place has good sangria and specialty drinks for girls.  Beers selection is okay.

Most importantly, you can actually hear other people talk!  Most of these types of lounges blast music so loud you can barely hear yourself think.  It's impossible to talk to anyone without screaming.  While there is music playing it's not overpowering - other bars should take notice.
author: James S.

description: I love this place. Great mojito's and campy movies and music.  Foul play was playing when I walked into the bar to have a mojito with the Frenchman. Bartender was friendly and fun, low key place that can get crowded. But it's a fun crowd. The Frenchman insisted I order a mojito. I did and it was  refreshing. A goto  place to go after work and have a conversation. Bar is Cash only but they have an ATM there.
author: Jennifer S.

description: They literally scam you here at night. The drink glasses shrink from a pint, to 12 oz, to 8 oz over the course of the night with no price change and no warning. We lined up our empties after we got suspicious and sure enough! Terrible.
author: Steve P.

description: Ah, the Lush Lounge.  A few years ago this was really an interesting place, with live music most nights, and musicians tucked in a tiny upstairs stage that looked like something out of a Vincent Price movie....   but for whatever reason they dropped the live music.  Now it's just another bar....
author: Rose Q.

description: Fun place and cool vibe. Try the mojitos and you'll be guaranteed a good night, but little crowded on the weekends.
author: Niners F.

description:
i don't get it.  this place isn't "almost gay" at all b/c there really isn't anything gay about straight girls awkwardly making out with other straight girls, especially while looking like they hope to be perceived as adventurous and thus, turn men on.  speaking of dudes, the men here on a friday night were as sleazy as we expected the men here on a friday night to be.  
it's ok if you're straight and live in sf... you don't have to pretend that a place is "sort of gay" so you feel more trendy going there.  have some confidence in your mainstream sexuality, and acknowledge you're at yet another hetero-late-20's-verging-on-yuppie tl spot.
author: Ariane R.

description:
there is a little stairway in the back of the bar that leads to a casual looking bookcase.  but if you look very closely, the bookcase is an actual, real-life secret revolving door.

its just like the one you dreamt of having when you were little, after seeing it on scooby doo when freddie, daphne, velma, and shaggy  solved mysteries in haunted houses.

it is glorious.  we stood and stared at it for a good minute, frozen in awe.

then we tried to open it and sneak a peek.

BAD IDEA.

the owner came out of nowhere behind us and barked for us to mind our own business.  (we totally deserved it.)

flushed and wide eyed, we backed away from the "bookcase" and went back to sipping our stellas at the bar.  we glanced back at it a couple times.  it taunted us with its mysterious presence.

nick k. thinks its the door to narnia.  he says the owner is mad because he doesn't believe anymore, so he can't go back there.  and if he can't go, no one can.

i believe him.
author: Helen L.

description: Really Cozy, Fun little spot. Great for pub crawling down polk/geary.  They started charging a cover on Halloween... luckily we got in before that! I like the little staircase that leads to nowhere in there. It's hella random and a cute little nook. It got a little too crowded though so we took off. But I'll definitely go back!
author: Lacey C.

description: Ever tried an oatmeal-cookie martini? If not, head over to Lush Lounge immediately.  The chocolate shavings on top help this (incredibly potent) martini taste uncannily like a cookie. But there are lots of reasons to try Lush - the mojitos (also very strong), the free bowls of popcorn, the great happy hour prices, the leafy hanging plants, the long polished bar, the big windows made for people watching the corner of Polk and Post, and the friendly bartenders who know the locals by first name.  You want to be where you can see the troubles are all the same...
author: Debbie A.

description: This is my first trip to the new Lush Lounge. I was a fan of the old one, but this location is like an entirely different bar. I went on a Friday and the place, which is at least twice the size of the old one, was wall-to-wall. There is a nice feel to the bar, with a young, vibrant crowd. Didn't have a chance to sit down, or try any of their specialties, due to the volume of people. I saw enough to know that I will be back, this time however, during the week.
author: Michael C.

description: I always consider Lush Lounge to be the marker of where Polk street starts to get cool.  Turn one way and it's homeless/crazytown central.  Turn the other and it's bar after bar after cute restaurant after bar.  So it goes without saying that Lush should be great.  Isn't the name genius too?  It makes you feel like you belong there.  A lounge.  For lushes.  Perfect!  Okay, on to the drinks.  They ALWAYS have great drink specials, whether it's for margaritas or martinis or mojitos, and they are super cheap and super good.  They find ways to include fruit like mango and blueberries into their drinks, but you can still taste the alcohol which is important!!
author: Michelle L.

description: When they moved it was the best thing that could have ever happened to them. I love this place! Definitely a shining star on the nob hill side of Polk. The fireplace is a major plus. Bartenders are cool. You should go here.
author: Stafford J.

description: Lush. I had so much fun! The bartender-- I dont know his name but hes  italian with dark skin---- treat me and my friends excellent. The drinks were off the hook! I definitely will go again!
author: Laura T.

description:
The new Lush Lounge is a disheartening reminder of the gradual shift on Polk St from interesting cross-section of the city to sanitized borefest. The old lush lounge was one of my favorite bars in the city: it was cozy, had great, unique decor and the drinks were amazing. Best of all, you never knew who would walk through the door next: some queers from the Tendernob, some sketchy characters from the TL, some trans gals hopping over from Divas, or chill Russian Hill residents looking for a change of pace.

The new Lush Lounge is bigger, and the decor is nice, I'll give it that. but it's also completely faceless - no personality, nothing worth noting. Where once offbeat movies and weird pornos played on the screens, now you find sports games. The eccentric characters have been replaced by Marina clones and faux-hipsters. Even the drinks, which are now pricier, have lost their kick. My personal fave was the Cactus Berry Margarita -- now I wouldn't wish a sip upon my worst enemy.

Really sad, but all good things must come to an end. Enjoy your new digs, hetero girls and douchey boys - I understand that Blur, Vertigo, Hemlock, and the countless other places on the street weren't enough. Kimo's had to be taken over, and now Lush Lounge too. I guess I'll go enjoy the Cinch while I still can...
author: Josh E.

description: This is a pretty upscale bar for the area. In general, the clientele was more typical bar goers  and less crackhead chic. I was a bit confused though about who I was talking with...She/he seemed like a fairly attractive female but had a surprisingly deep voice. Interesting conversation. They didn't have a cover on new years and it was a pretty good place to be. There are plenty of places to stand around and rest your drink...and some good lighting. Fairly clean if that is important to you.
author: Jason W.

description: Friendly, friendly and more friendly...this place has it down. Strong drinks, cute (straight) owners, good looking bartenders (both gay & straight), casual and comfortable feel and really friendly patrons. How can you top that!?
author: Jason D.

description: Love the luscious lounge. Great martini menu varying from the usual suspects to crazy key lime concoctions. Great atmosphere with 80's music playing in the background -- think Madonna. Very gay friendly, but doesn't scare off the straight guys either. It's a great spot for after-work drinks or before/after drinks when you grab dinner in the 'loin.
author: Defne A.

description:
this place is intoxicating. its fun, flirty and has plenty of plants that make it feel very intimate and not at all like the grimey polk street that awaits you outside. some hot bartenders who are mostly gay but fun to look at. 

they used to have an open cabaret night- def not of the karaoke kind- i saw some talented heartfelt performances here.
author: Adrienne P.

description: 3 words: OATMEAL COOKIE MARTINI !!
author: Nance W.

description: Stopped in last night for the 1st time for a margarita.  What a beautiful margarita it was.  It was beyond tasty and worth having two!  The bartenders were great and the other patrons were definitely hokey.  I look forward to visiting the new location when they move.  If you have time before they close this location ask for Sam to make you a margarita in a margarita glass and not a pint glass - you won't regret it!
author: Anjali K.

description:
I love the new location! It captures the feel of the old lounge the regulars love so much with a modern touch. Definitely don't miss the opportunity to hang out. It will be your new haunt hopefully for years to come.

Love the staff! one of the bartenders, sammy, is attentive and very friendly and makes a mean Manhattan! 

So please take some time out of your busy schedule and give yourself a treat. It is a great bar!
author: Tatiana B.

description:
my friends rang me and told me to come to the lush for happy hour as they heard that they were closing, and were going to find out the scoop.  this was our frequent happy hour spot, and upon their call i rushed the bf and myself out of our racquetball game to head to the lush.

my friends gave me the lowdown when i arrived, and apparently they are moving up the road to a swankier location -- fireplace, mezzanine and the whole lot!

phew!  i was sad when i thought they were closing, and am now relieved to hear the news of the new venue.  

i can't wait to see the new location!
author: Sheri N.

description: Who knew such a nice bar could be in a place like this? I love this place. It's small, intimate and cozy. Everyone is pretty friendly here, even the bartenders. The cocktails are delicious and the drinks specials are great.  I've always had a good time here just chatting it up with friends and strangers as I watch the people of Polk walk by. It's one of the few places where you can sit with regular, good looking folks and watch the transvestites and prostitutes get picked up and do crack deals. Good times...
author: TaDao V.

description: Great decor!  The Cucumber Kiss is awesome! Service is good. Overall, a good experience for my first time. Will definitely return again and bring friends to try it out.
author: Amie T.

description:
It is a very nice place (spacious with sizeable balcony area) to sit and have couple of drinks with your partner. 
Bartender was very friendly, approachable and attentive. She made couple recommendations for cocktails since my partner and I wanted to try it for the first time (usually we order straight drinks).  We decided to give it a shot with a pear cocktail (do not know the name)....but it was delicious.  We will be back again for sure. The only downside- cash only :(
author: Elena S.

description: "Well hello Lush-ious!"  Every time I've come to this bar, it's been a pleasant accident. Vertigo or some other establishment was too crowded and we've done the "How 'bout that place?" thang.  Well THAT place is Lush and they brew up a mean cocktail, served without attitude...at least not a bad attitude. The bartenders are cool, helpful and make either great suggestions or funny quips (deserving of a witty retort..but they wouldn't have it any other way "Mary!").  Depending upon the night it can get crowded, but still fun. Much better than RRRRrrrrrr Baaaarrrrr!  Try a Hangar 1 'Tini!  Been there with the crew at night, or H-hour to catch up with a friend or two. Hell....even hung with the Nishmaster himself  at  Lush. Five duckets to Lush for being a great stop along the TenderNob crawl.
author: Johnny C.

description: Lush lounge is so lovely! Svetlana is awesome for a Friday happy hour, and it seems as if everyone who enters relaxes a bit, watches a minute of a classic film, enjoys some stale popcorn, and starts talking to the person sitting next to them. Leave it to raspberry slushy daiquiris to bring San Franciscans together. Congrats on Hanks as well-can't wait to check it out! PS-they make a killer martini here. Yuuummm.
author: Libby T.

description: This place is pretty stupid. But it doesn't suck. This is like a fifteen-year-old kid's idea of a fifty-five-year-old gay man's lifestyle. Which somehow winds up being the actual lifestyle of a fair number of fifty-five-year-old gay men. Hence the crowd here, sipping frozen martinis in all their cartoonish glory.
author: Tim S.

description:
i've always loved this place for the casual atmosphere, fantastic drinks, and friendly bartenders.  the cinematic decor was also a bonus.

NEWS ON THE NEW LOCATION:

i've heard that they're to re-open in late november here - 1221 Polk Street, near Sutter...

thank gawd!
author: Karen O.

description:
I LOVE THE NEW LUSH LOUNGE!! Their new location is great, and is especially great that they kept the old crew. Sammi is the best, he is always so friendly with everyone. If you have a chance to talk to him on slower nights he is the sweetest bartender, truly embodying the friendly and worldly Lush feel. There new refreshed Lush combines the cozy feel oft he regular crowd with a new refreshed sense of modernism. 

You can still catch a lot of the classic regulars on slower nights, Wednesdays and Thursdays for happy hours, and the new decor has brought in a whole new crowd of youngsters and hipsters that have injected a new energy into the place. 

Highly highly recommended. And say hi to Sammi when you go. 

Best drink? The Cosmo. Best spot? the little upstairs section so you can see the action on the main floor.
author: Valentina C.

description: Favorite spot on Polk! Love the deal on Tecate + a Tequila shot. Always a fun time and never that difficult to get in, though it's always crowded inside.
author: Darcy M.

description:
how can you not fall in love with any bar that lies within a neighborhood called the tender nob? alright, that's the tourist in me talking, but i definitely got a laugh out of it.

loved, loved, LOVED the inside of this place. super high ceilings, tons of plants, a warm red glow and knick knackies all over that somehow managed to avoid the bennigan's/tji friday's feel.

the bartender wasn't the speediest in the world, but the cocktails were tasty, the crowd was super low key and the seats were plentiful.
author: Rachel P.
