description: Came here with a gaggle of girlfriends before seeing Sex & the City on Van Ness. They had Cosmos for cheap, so it seemed appropriate. Also some frozen concoctions on tap that weren't delicious but were totally drinkable and cheap! They didn't have any problem with us bringing in outside food. Relaxed vibe. Conveniently located around the corner from stripper shoe stores, so you can multi-task, if that's your thing.
author: Melinda K.

description: One of my fav bars on Polk St.  I love going here with friends after work.  The Sour Cherry Martini they sometimes have is one of my fav drinks of all time!  Plus I love looking at Barbara Streisand posters and watching Audrey Hepburn movies while drinking.
author: Katie M.

description: Your neighborhood type of bar... I was reminded of this place when we went last weekend. It's been ages since the last... I suddenly remembered how much I like this place. It's a great place to go to when you want to be out for a couple of drinks but you aren't in the mood for anything high profile or anything too divey. Its lively enough with a very interesting and diverse crowd but not too crowded and not too dead. Just right. I like that it has window views of the street to let the outside activity liven the place up - I hate it when some bars you walk into are all walls... I feel super claustrophobic.... Its a great place to just chat with a group of friends over drinks - a night-ender... also if you like old music like me, they play goodies from the 80s and 90s... Hello Journey and Boston and Hall and Oates....
author: Bernadette L.

description: $3 drink specials, friendly bartender and patrons, and very eclectic decorating make this a nice change of pace. The frozen martinis are a little bit too fruity for me, but the $3 Newcastles will do just fine...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I'm going to the Lush Lounge tonight. I haven't been there in awhile-- I haven't been out drinking in awhile-- and I am very, very excited. OK, maybe just one "very." Last time I was there, my friend Thomas and I practiced our "Shiny, Happy People" karaoke routine in the back of the place for hours, and our significant others didn't even notice. That's how wonderfully buzzy we all were on the not-too-sickly-sweet mojitos...and a few shots of tequila. Looking forward again to the feel-good, neighborhoody, warm-and-fuzzily-diverse vibe (yikes, no wonder I'm not a marketing copywriter).
author: Heather M.

description:
The new digs are fantastic.  Steve and Chris did a terrific job in setting it up.  The carved wooden bar is beautiful. The place is bigger than the former and has a great fireplace and loft (not opened yet).  The same staff is back and everyone of them, Sam, Jack, Chris, Svetlana are great.  They hired another bartender, a guy named Baz (short for Basil ?) who is Irish, nice fellow.  

I agree about one of the posts that made a comment about that long table that sits behind the bar, it is too close to the bar and makes it difficult to navigate. And a couple tables or a couch in front of the fireplace would be great!  

The decorations are a little toned down from the former joint but work really well in the space.  They have two nice flat screen TVs above the bar as well.  The music is the same.  Drink prices are pretty much as they were before.  They haven't technically started the happy hour again in the late afternoons but I hear they are going to do that.  

Check it out, it is a nice mix of straight and gay (probably 75/25 straight), mix of ages, friendly and cozy.
author: Rob D.

description: This is a fun little place to check out if you find yourself in the Tender-Nob; it's pretty close to AMC Van Ness as well as bars like Vertigo and Hemlock Tavern. I guess Lush is in theory a gay bar, but everytime I've gone everyone's been more than welcome. Last night, stopped in with good friend to catch up a little. Our bartender suggested a Hangar One Lime straight, and he served it perfectly chilled in a  martini glass - my buddy went for a mojito, which was also mixed to perfection, and served in a pint glass. They also had a Barbra Streisand movie showing, nice touch!
author: Nish N.

description: Decor is a blast from the past.. if you are a fan of noir films this is the place...I luv the whole Broadway theme of the bar as well the drinks are reasonable this place is well known for their Martinis. Is a mix crowd. Which I really enjoy it feels a little bit like NYC. the edge with the  wanna be yuppie but at the end  you never know,what are you getting. This lounge is good in company of friends.An Is very low key but is worth checking out!
author: Alex V.

description:
my memory of this place is pretty vague. we had already spent most of the night at the Hemlock. we were wearing our Halloween costumes that night, but even though it was Halloween weekend, pretty much no one else was dressed up. hanging out in a bar while wearing a pink bunny costume was pretty random. i *think* that i remember the bartenders there being pretty nice... but maybe i'm just making that up. hrm, ok, maybe there really is nothing that i remember about this place... but at least the location is good... i'll have to give it that!

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description: I didn't really form an opinion either way on this place but it was fun when a crack addict came in asking for a spoon and the bartender chased him out.  Drinks were good.
author: J. O.

description: I had a very strange experience here. My husband and I were early for a dinner reservation at Crustacean so decided to stop here for a drink. We sat down at the bar and waited for a good 15 minutes but the two bartenders (one girl and one guy) refused to make eye contact! Weird. Would understand if the place was packed and busy, but the two bartenders actually serviced the couple sitting next to us and the group of 3 at the end of the bar TWICE while we waited. We left and went to Pour House which was great! :)
author: Maria K.

description: This place is a hoot. The bartender was an ass but in the sense you can only laugh back about it. The drinks were not bad but nothing to rave about. The decor was funky in a Applebee's sorta way. Then when its last call, they turn on these H U G E  flood lights to get everyone out. Leave it to my girls to ignore it, put on their oversized shades, and finish their drinks and conversation while the bartender counted his tips.
author: Ray R.

description: As far as it goes, a bar is just a bar.  The best way to stand out is to make a decent coctail and have a friendly staff which is exactly whas Lush Lounge does.  I hit this place with my coworkers to take the edge off a day from f*ing hell time and time again.  A little free popcorn and a few cocktails and I'm back to my calm self.  One of the best features isn't in the bar but, outside the windows.  It's Polk, it's at night... it's a show to say the very least.
author: Carl C.

description: Really liked this place.  Not very big, but a great open and inviting vibe.  Met some interesting eclectic people there - it felt like two sitcoms crashing together, Big Bang Theory and (short lived) Class.  Music had a good mix of some 80's gems.
author: Jason C.

description: GREAT frozen mango margarita. It took like 10 minutes though to figure out what was the dark round thing the put in the middle. It was a blueberry. The place was fairly empty on a Thursday except for us, some woman who was REALLY into the old movie they were playing on the TV with Cary Grant and these two guys making out constantly at the bar. It was a nice place to just sit down and have a unique drink or two.
author: Matt H.

description:
I love this place!  The drinks are amazing.  I'm all about the frozen martinis.  Who doesn't love an alcoholic slurpee?

Also, I wish I was a hot, single girl so I could get in Sammy's pants.  He's an amazing bartender (fast, efficient, and nice).  He made my night super fun and got me super drunk!
author: real l.

description: If you and your friends are looking for some over the top, sweet desert like, unique martinis, this is the place to go to.  Lush really makes some great martinis, and although I am not a fan of sweet alcohol drinks, I will say that having tried some of their signature cocktails, I was very impressed.  No worries though, they serve a selection of draft beers on tap and make a mean traditional martini.  Great place to visit during a night of bar hopping on Polk Street.  Only downer here, cash only bar.
author: Charles C.

description: Good music, decent drinks, and but it seems to be too small to hold as many people as they stack in there. Aside from that, its not very lounge-y as there isn't really anywhere to sit either.
author: Mace M.

description: It's like the flamboyant version of Cheers...where everyone knows your name! The bartenders are so friendly, the drinks are cheap (and strong) and the location is great. There was a  good mix of regulars, tourists and people of all age groups, backgrounds, etc. when I went there on a Friday night. Plus, they give out free popcorn. Yay!
author: Natalie T.

description: Lush Lounge will make you a drag queen spotting, green thumb growing, crafted and built cocktail craving fool.  This place has charming bartenders, a wonderful peaceful atmosphere - pleasantly contrasting the neighborhood outside.  The cocktail list is impressive and they have fresh garnishes and a juice press.  Their gourmand enablers will provide you with a watermelon, canteloupe or apple martini.  If you haven't had dessert yet try a chocolate martini.  Ask for a special margarita.  You will not be sorry, but you will leave with a smile.  The fabulous rainforest plants adorn the place with a little life, ommiting the bleak tenderloin.  Drag queen watching is a plus - with the fabulous DIVAS parading accross the street.  Everything beautiful indeed.  Did I mention that the bartenders are fantastically nice?  Get off your websurfing butt and grab a cocktail.  You go GIRL!
author: Gwen P.

description: It's the farmers' market of bars.  The juices for their drinks are fresh squeezed, and the garnishes are works of art.  It might take forever to get your drink, but it's all about the attention to detail here.  They have all-night $5 drink specials, which do not suck.  Have I mentioned how tasty their drinks are?  The tangerine cosmo tastes like tangerine!  The blueberry cosmo tastes like blueberry!  Someone call Violet Beauregarde and tell her to get her fat ass down here already.
author: Teri G.

description: ah....marsha was going to give a four, i guess i should do the same. the coconut mojito offshoot was an amalgam of whizzbang tresses and schoolgirl naughtiness, while the haleys comet i didnt quite agree name wise. Either way, it was all about me and the ms. z having a smashing time discussing our relative home pieces and experiences in similar institutions. she likes slapstick, i like hate-yourself molten dramadies, but it all amounted to a cemented treat.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Forget dessert at the restaurant and opt for a Chocolate Martini at Lush!  This is a great little spot for drinks after work, after dinner, or after a date!  Basically anytime!
As anon a. says, try to get a window seat, you'll catch some of the neighborhood action!
author: Ashley Q.

description: Do you like chocolate martinis?  Do you find yourself asking bartenders  to "make me something fun and coconutty"? Have you had a white russian within the last month?  When you hear the words "key lime pie",  do you immediately think of the drink rather than the dessert?  If so, you should call me and we should go to Lush Lounge together.
author: shoba d.

description: Great happy hour space under 80s music with very cheap drinks, dutiful, friendly bartenders who are, yes, cute and flirty and keep the free popcorn salted and ever ready.
author: Sean S.

description: This is a nice place to 'class it up' in the 'loin. The bar staff is stellar and the drinks are strong and pretty looking as well. It's like a little disco oasis where you can unwind after a long day.
author: Colleen B.

description: Not too fond of fruity drinks but you have to try their blended watermelon martini along with another one (don't remember what it was called but it was a white blend)!  Friendly, kick back vibe...worth checking out and cheap!
author: Maria E.

description: This is a great great bar.  The mojitos are super sweet,  just the way i like them!  Fun cocktails, yummy bellinis, kitschy decor.  What more can you ask for?  I'm a fan.
author: Liz C.

description: Get the chocolate martini AND the blood mary (ok, maybe not together).  They are great.  One star is lost, however, b/c the mojito is served with coconut rum.  Yuck, coconut.
author: Jenn S.

description: On our last trip to SF my dear friend and fellow yelper Katie M. decided to treat my boyfriend and I to this tasty little place. I say tasty because she advised me to get the blueberry martini, in which they crushed real blueberries.... it was delicious. I also had the apple pie martini... equally delicious. While I can't visit since I'm back down at home, it doesn't stop me from craving these tasty drinks!
author: Danielle C.

description: The mango martini I had was delicious!! Weird crowd--but I had already been drinking quite a bit soooo may have to amend this when/if I go again--but alright for what it was.
author: Krystha B.

description: Lush is my fave place for cocktails before 11pm on this side of Market.  Good good drinks, great bartenders, good people.
author: Shan K.

description: not a bad place for a drink.  Last i remember, they had some hot wimmin bartenders.
author: joseph k.

description: There's something I really like about this bar. I've ended up here a few times on weekday evenings, and invariably ended up meeting new people. That never happens to me in bars. Plus, their mojito is the bomb. It's crazy on weekends just like all the other Polk St. bars, but the atmosphere is spot on during the rest of the week.
author: Aaron L.

description: A cute small cozy bar filled with locals and lovers of a good cocktail.  The bartenders are great, they don't even cringe when asked for a mijoito.  But I still think that the frozen watermelon martinis are the best. I have to get one ever time I go there...i sometimes go there just for them.
author: Tara S.

description: Well I'd heard it was a gay bar!?  It didn't have that vibe, but it felt very mixed and open!  The most INCREDIBLE lemon drops... seriously... all their drink specials are amazing.  Lots of fresh ingredients.  A little pricy, but worth it for the taste.  It's also fairly easy to get a place to sit for a place this bustling. Way to go, LL!
author: Aaron W.

description: Meh.  I've experienced better.
author: Jo W.

description: There's nothing quite like sipping a chocolate martini on a cold San Francisco late afternoon, chatting with Brazilian bartenders and watching Hitchcock's The Birds.  It doesn't get much better than this.
author: Sarah S.

description: Big fan of the Tenderloin Iced Tea, and the seats in the corner are very comfortable and the bartender came out to take our orders and that was cool.  It is a great place to chill and I like the decor because it is thought-provoking.  I came here with a friend of mine and spent at least an hour talking to her about the joys of sex and capitalism.  Plus it's near a bunch of other bars so you have options.  Come here with a couple of friends but not too many because it is kinda small.
author: Cassio P.

description: This little corner bar was fantastic! the atmosphere was unique and interesting. It was a little too crowded to stay for a long period time, but I highly recommend the safe sex on the beach.  The bartenders are fantastic and friendly.  Lost one star due to the multiple times I split my drink because people were bumping into me.
author: Nichole V.

description: Yummy drinks like chocolate martinis and grasshoppers are perfect for girly girls and guys.  Cozy and popular without being so crowded you can't hear your conversation.  Wish it was in a better neighborhood but it's really not that big of a deal.  Cheap drinks and decent bartenders make me forget panhandlers and transients anyway.
author: Jill D.

description: I hate cash only places, but the drink prices are actually not bad. And most of the bartenders have a heavy pour. The decor is interesting, as is the view of trannies out the window. But hey, there's alcohol so what does it matter?
author: The Sock S.

description: One of the best bars. The staff is always cool and very personable. The drinks always great. The vibe and energy a very good one. A good mix of people which makes it interesting and fun.
author: Rob L.

description: Really fun drinks, but they definitely have that "concocted" feel - this is not a fresh pure juice drink place. The mojitos are too sweet for me, but I do enjoy the chocolatey martinis - there are several good ones. The bartenders can also be really big jerks - so watch out.
author: Monika M.

description:
i happened to stumble across this place. its 30 ft from re:fresh day spa where i get my deep tissue massages from and is on a corner where theres motocycle parking. i walked in one day, THEY GOT CHAMAY ON TAP. 

its a nice lil spot. id easily recommend just for the pbr and chimay on tap, but they gots one of the craziest mixed drinks list iver seen. AND TRUST ME I KNOW MY ALCHYMOHOL.
author: Euge L.

description: Great party place on Polk!  The decor is cool with old singers & performers pics on display... even a glittering gold mannequin hanging from the ceiling to bring you back to the "good ol' days".  They keep it "lush" with plenty of plants and people to drink their stiff yet tasty concoctions.  It's also in a good hood, with an array of places to continue the party nearby.  When you want to chill in a diverse SF hood, lush it up at this spot : )
author: Tara G.

description: An evening that started with a b-day party at seven and ended with walking a slightly intoxicated friend home across town at three had it's first after-dinner pit-stop here. Beware of the larger than normal Jaeger shots and the Long Island Ice Tea. Goood stuff. Relaxed and laid back place, too. This Martini fan's only caveat: the $3 watermelon Martinis. Tasted a friend's one and wasn't too convinced.
author: Roland A.

description:
1 STAR- cool, friendly, witty bartender 
1 STAR- casual moody ambiance 
1 STAR- CLEAN unisex bathrooms
1 STAR- DELICIOUS AND TANGY tangerine cosmopolitan
(minus 1 star for barely-can-choke-it-down lemon drop shot)...TOXIC

My latest crush took me to Lush Lounge after the They Might Be Giants show last night at the Fillmore....sigh....I'd go just about anywhere with him...ahemnmn...sorry....as I was saying...This is an unpretentious but casually cool corner bar with a sort of dark, moody but friendly and inviting ambiance.  We sat at the bar and ordered the evening's drink special...the tangerine cosmopolitan...for $5...can you say cheap AND YUMMY?...the drink, that is...not my date...he is anything but cheap : )  We shared one lemon drop shot...$3...I'm a lightweight, so I could only tolerate one sip...I'm relatively certain that it killed any and all bacteria in my mouth, and possibly took one layer of tissue off the lining of my esophagus when I swallowed...my face contorting.  My crush is a drinker, and even he thought it was strong.  I would recommend ordering one if you...say...had something offensive for dinner...it's sort of like Listerine on steroids.

The bartender had the sort of personality that every bartender should have...gregarious and effortlessly charming...quick with a witty and poignant observation...attentive to our needs but never intrusive.

If you are so inclined, a hetero couple could use one bathroom at the same time, as they are unisex...each with a urinal and toilet.  I see this as a time saving device on a busier, crowded night.  They were also clean, which is a MAJOR bonus in my book.  

I honestly can't remember one song that was playing last night.  Whatever it was, it never annoyed me.  I was too busy gazing into my crush's beautiful, sexy blue eyes and hanging on his every word.  The music was at a level where we could easily talk and listen to one another, which is nice.  Never once did either of us have to ask the other to repeat what was said.  This makes Lush Lounge a nice place to hang out and converse...and canoodle...and drink.

As we were leaving, the bartender thanked us for coming in and invited us back.  I would definitely go back again~
author: s r.

description: This place is great! They have really great, extremely well-priced drinks. The drink menu is pretty extensive and geared towards the dessert lover...grasshoppers, oatmeal cookies, etc. YUM.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Drinks are pretty good and strong.  I like rasberry truffle or the frozen martinis if I'm feeling a little girly.  This place got rated number 1 pickup bar and the crowd is pretty good.
author: Jared F.

description: This place is dead most of the time.  Could be cool to 'take it over' for a night.  Nothin special.  A perfect 3.
author: Thadd L.

description: The chocolate martinis at this bar really are great.  The space is small but the interior is cozy and welcoming.  Have to agree with others that the drinks seemed pricey - even if the bartender did give me a cherry/blueberry drink skewer- yum.
author: CAKE E.

description: This place just has a great ambiance. And not until I read these reviews did I realize it was supposed to be a gay bar - whatever the crowd is, there just always seems to be a great mix of friendly people. I've taken out of town guests here to get drunk off of their AMAZING chocolate martinis and even managed to have fun there on a pretty bad date. Maybe the hot bartender helped ;)
author: Dalia K.

description: The BF loves this place, I prefer places with dancing but as far as Lounge's go this one has decent drinks and it's not so loud you can't hear each other. Bonus points for having relatively clean bathrooms. As in I do not fear getting any diseases when I have to use the facilities.
author: Cathy T.

description:
i love this bar - it's suuuuuuch a great place for people watching. (what - isn't that why most ppl go to bars??!!)  

although the 3 dollar frozen watermelon martini comes out of a machine, it's tasty ... and only three bux! last time we were here, my hubby only ordered a coke, and they gave it to him free.  i got out of a bar for only *3 dollars!!!* (plus tip) ... now that's amazing. i felt like i should order another drink b/c i felt wrong about only spending three bucks in a bar. 

i once asked them if they could make me a watermelon mojito (which i'd only had at this bar i loved out of state, b/4 i moved here), and the bartender was more than willing to give it a try - and it was actually really good.

speaking of the bar tenders -- they're precious, and although i usually have to wait a bit to order, i can't be mad b/c they're so cute- and call me sweetie and hun.  i know, i'm a sucker.
author: Alexis W.

description: Oh, how I have spent many an afternoon and evening at the Lush Lounge. Sure, the location is kinda seedy, but it just adds character to the bar. The staff is very cool and the people are nice. I always end up meeting new and interesting people. Definitely try the frozen drinks, for usually only $6! And don't forget to ask for more popcorn!
author: Jan Z.

description:
blueberry martini was the perfect antidote to a hellish day at work. 

cash only though so somewhat inconvenient.
author: Charlene C.

description: This is just a great, chill bar.  My brother and his wife had a pub crawl birthday party last Friday where we came to Lush as our last stop.  I called Lush a couple days in advance and asked if I could drop a cake off early in the night.  They were super friendly and accommodating.  I've been to Lush a few times and every time I go, I have a great time.  Great drinks, friendly staff, and great energy all around.
author: Dave D.

description: The name of this place is confusing, because it's not really a lounge, and the only lush references are framed on the walls. But still, a fun stop for the evening. Drinks seem to lean in the fruit direction, which is fine by me. A few more seats would be welcome, though.
author: Purnima M.

description: Went to Lush Lounge last Sunday and it was great!  Great atmosphere to have some drinks and catch up with friends. They have good specials but of course I was craving a bloody mary. The bartender put his blood, sweat and tears into this thing and it was delicious! Although it took him a long time to make, he didn't seem to mind and was very pleasant.` All of the happy hour drinks looked great especially the cucumber gimlet! I will definitely go back.
author: Sarah H.

description: Been here a couple times. Its nice, fun. Mixed crowd which is great. I would go again.
author: Art A.

description: Interesting decorations, they were playing some crazy black and white movie on the TV.  They make incredibly delicious fancy drinks here, particularly if you are a fan of sweet drinks.  Chocolate martinis are delicious when I want something frou frou to drink.  My friend ordered a Bloody Mary that had all kinds of crazy shit in it.  They have a drink menu if you are indecisive, like I often am when at a place like this (I'm usually a Jack & Coke kind of gal).
author: Max B.

description: The most varietal martinis ever.  The scene (being the Tenderloin) on the street can be quite entertaiing at times.  Friendly folk and a great atmosphere.  You just wanna kick back a few and enjoy what comes next!
author: Christopher C.

description: Nice red room with lots of plants -- me likey.  I also likey the mojito made with coconut rum which makes the drink less potent but really tasty.  Another star for being able to make a really good extra dirty, extra dry Grey Goose martini.
author: Helen C.

description: Love the Bellini's in this gaylicious bar!  The boys are fab, the bartenders are uber fab and the price is ultra fab!!
author: Michelle B.

description: this place can get packed & sweaty, & other nights it's just a chill place to kick it. their specials are great! getting buzzed on cheap drinks is definitely the i like way to go. i haven't tried any of their mixed drinks, though their sangria isn't too bad. the people tend to be a diverse crowd during the school nights. on weekends it becomes a collar popping, one too many cologne spritzes, frat guy haven. i like my guys normal, clean & not so tan... so my favorite day to kick it here is a thursday or friday. if i carried more cash on me, it might be 5 stars.
author: Madhu D.

description: Cute lil bar full of greenery and fun little signs and funky stuff.  Great place to go after work on a weekday to unwind with friends.  Went there last Sunday night to hang out with the boys after work and had a very chill evening.  They always have cheap, cool concoctions behind the bar in large glass dispensers.  Last time I had the triple spiked sangria and lemon drops...mmm good and stiff.  Typical mixed SF crowd.  I'll visit again.
author: Alicia K.

description: We recently moved to the neighborhood and were looking for our neighborhood bar.  Systematically we ruled out the Nitecap (too many hookers/crack heads) and the Brown Jug (too many hookers/crack heads) and just as were were about to give in to Divas, we saw Lush Lounge.  I was a little reluctant at first- it was filled with frat brothers.  or so it seemed.  one even knocked my friends drink over.  But they soon left and it became a nice, low key place to get a big margarita for $6 and chat with the other locals at the bar.  We made friends, got a CD, and got drunk.  And we did it in style.
author: Connor S.

description: Cozy corner bar with great people (trannie) watching and eavesdopping opportunities and very coconutty sweet mojitos.  You can always watch the old movies on the TV screens too if you get tired of the people.  Service can be very slow at times (it took 20 minutes to even be acknowledged by a bartender last time we sat at the bar) although it does also get really busy for just one guy to man.
author: Vivien W.

description: I don't do slushees, slurpees, frozen margaritas,  or even frozen yogurt, but  I have yet to pass thru the doors of the Lush Lounge and NOT partake in a frozen watermelon icee thing.  Delish, pretty and potent(ish) and  when accompanied by a bowl of popcorn during happy hour, makes a very respectable drunk girl's dinner.  Respectable was the adjective for  dinner, not girl.
author: Laurie A.

description:
The whiteboard in the front window of Lush Lounge advertises their signature libations, with a strong emphasis on strong martinis: Watermelon, Lemondrop, Raspberry Truffle.  They all sound so fruity and delicious--healthy, really--that I'm tempted to stop in on my walk to work in the mornings.  It's a temptation I resist, though, until the sun sets or the weekend arrives, and then I find Lush to be a reasonably priced and proximally convenient place to get a Polk Gulch Appletini.

Extra draw for streetside eye candy: Lush sits kitty-corner from Divas, everyone's favorite transgender dance club.
author: Hannah J.

description: I used to love this place, I went there for years until the bartender was extremely rude to me twice in a row and actually called me crude names and now I will never go back!
author: Morgan B.

description: Last night was my first time at Lush.  I've only recently moved to this neighborhood, and I've been auditioning local hangouts...this may just be it!  The bartenders were cute, the drag-spotting was fun, and the drinks were good enough that I didn't even notice the decor!  Ok, maybe that's cuz the guy I was with was a hottie conversationalist, but I'm giving credit to the bar anyway :p
author: Madeleine K.

description: I really like this bar, so much so that I went twice this past weekend.  They make great drinks (particularly their mojitos and gin martinis) and they give you popcorn.  It is a great place to enjoy a quality drink while mindlessly watching classic films.  There is always a crowd but not so much of one that you can't get a seat or have a conversation with the people you came with.  Mostly, I love the crowd...it is one of the most diverse I've seen in the city.
author: Julie P.

description: I like this place on weekdays, when the crowd is thin and you can actually get a seat and a drink within moments of each other. Decent prices, and the clientel ranges from dirty old men, to trannys from Divas, to preppy folks, hipsters, and general loin inhabitants.
author: Margotelyse C.

description: This is a regular place for me.  I come here when I want a cheap, strong drink at a place that I can actually breath on a weekend night, and is not super crowded.  I usually get their pre-made mango martini and ask the bartender to squeeze some fresh lime juice in it so it's not quite so sweet.  I especially like the decor, plenty to read and entertain!
author: Amy W.

description: Very cool bar with a private area for small parties. I like the way they set this bar up so you can casually walk in and work your way around the bar to see what's going on. The music is ok and so are the drinks. Its a primary location to start off your night since its at the beginning of Polk Street. If you sit by the window, you'll get a good seat and see some interesting people along the way.
author: Dave Y.

description: Lush Lounge was stop #2 on our New Year's Eve pub crawl. I usually prefer someplace a bit more low-key to down my liquor, but the lush in me appreciated all of the fanciful and inventive concoctions they had to offer. The crowd was a bit too "straight and narrow" and the drinks were a bit too expensive for my tastes. Truly though, it was a good place to stop by for a few drinks and then pack up and move on to more exciting venues.
author: Kelli C.

description: Lovely cocktails and a great vibe.  My to-go place for girl talk.  The best part is ordering your drinks and sitting in the back corner on the stairs-that-go-nowhere.  There's something cozy about sitting in a bricked off stairwell.  Is there someone trapped inside?  Is it The Cask of Amontillado come to life in our fair city?  Spooky!  Also, if you get the reference, well done, braniac.  You can buy me a drink here.
author: Frankie D.

description: Well apparently Lush Lounge is kind of a flamboyant gay hang out according to the other reviews. (?). For whatever reason I didn't seem to notice. Now that I think about it, no dudes bought me a drink there and it was pretty crowded. But then again, this was the last stop of the night, so it very well might have happened. Either way, I do remember the place had a great vibe and I left there blowing probably around a .18, so the drinks must have been good. Though it was a bit crowded, it wasn't too difficult to get a cocktail. I'll hit it up again for sure.
author: Kristin B.

description: Great place to kick it in the city nice break from suburbia for sure for us non-city dwellers. Quite a trendy spot and well it definitely has one of the best mojitos i have had on this side of the world.
author: Victoria M.

description: Um, came here drunk.  But I do remember they have really good specialty martinis and mixed drinks.  Reading other Yelp reviews, I think I need to go back here again.  Had fun here with other drunk friends.  I think we were definitely THOSE people that night, the ones people laugh at.
author: Sarah F.

description: I love their happy hour frozen watermelon margarita specials! Sip your drink and admire the Judy Garland wall decorations. The bartenders are hot and friendly. An interesting tenderloin stop- especially if you're headed to Divas down the block.
author: Jessica M.

description:
the only reason i don't give this place 5 stars is because it's small and when it gets crowded, it's a real turnoff to be elbow to elbow with people.

great drinks (*love* the metropolitan), relaxed atmosphere, and there's always some old classic movie playing above the bar (maltese falcon, chinatown, etc.).
author: sylvia c.

description: The right place for the right time. It all depends on what you are looking for. They have a great variety of drinks, some great specials, and plenty of room with a pretty unique environment. Great place to catch up for happy hour, but also seems to be good for the late night partiers too.
author: Thomas K.

description: This place rocks! Me and my bro go there for happy hour all the time. What can I say, great cocktails, awesome old movies and tons of atmosphere. Be careful with your money tho, the streetlife has been known to wander in and steal money you leave as a tip when you're not paying attention.
author: Timoteo K.

description: Great place to get a nice big cocktail from a cute bartender.  More fun to come in drag, or just watch the drag queens...
author: H.A. ..

description: Thia bar gets me laid. I think it is the good drinks and the fact that as someone else has commented this bar is a crossroads for many communities. hence i am always meeting someone who has ended up there looking not just for a drink but for an adventure. you get the idea. plus english tourists get sent here by the hotels and i love me some english :).
author: Cassandra T.

description: It's my favorite place to grab a drink.  I've been going here for years.  The bartenders are cute and friendly.  They really know how to make a good drink.  Besides, how can you go wrong with $3 frozen cosmos/martinis.   I love all the kitchy stuff hanging on the walls.  I always notice something I haven't seen before.  They also have a great selection of movies that play on the tv.  Sometimes they'll even have popcorn.  You can meet all sorts of cool people here.  It's one of those places you go to, and you're always glad you went.
author: Miss T.

description: I've been to this bar several times and I love it. The decorations are awesome and completely distracting. Many times I've been in a conversation only to realize I'm staring at the ceiling and the wild things coming out of the walls. I think it gives the bar a lot of character.
author: Pearl M.

description: I really love this place. It's such a nice and cozy lounge serving great cocktails with reasonable price and great service always... though... I've experienced a few uncomfortable mishaps recently here. First one was about an apprentice bartender.  Every time when he took order that evening, he just couldn't find where the booze bottles were. Contrary to the customer's extreme patience, his excuse was like "Oh, come on. This is my first day. Give me a break!"  Ugh...ouch. I know he shouldn't have been there alone in the first place, but his attitude evidently lacks grace to work for my beloved classy martini bar. Second was about music. One day my folks and I went there for a couple of pre-dinner cocktails. As soon as we opened the gate, a loud noise struck our ears. This bartender was playing his kind of music all the time when he's on duty. I assume he thinks it's his privilege to play his favorites. I endure this ear-deafning music only when the bar becomes like a meat market on the late-night weekend, but not on weekdays especially after a long, long day.  Anyways, a bartender as a soothing ambiance creator should thoughtfully select tunes to allow us to relax, get a good buzz on and enjoy conversation. Then again, this bartender is one of the rookies. I hope those newcomers soon become able to carry on tradition of THE LUSH LOUNGE. Then, I'll be happy to give five stars.
author: Kaulike Y.

description:
i love the lush lounge.

gin and tonic or mojito - my friend gets the lemon drop. we go there fairly often, so the bartenders know us... which means that we got to try a mango something or other. frozen mango martini? it was pretty dang good too, but the mojito is where it's at.

just don't be afraid of trannies, there's usually at least one or two.
author: dave w.

description: I love this place! The bartendars are great and the atmosphere is just right!
author: Annah H.

description:
Great music, great decor, great drinks!

I mean there aren't may places in the city you can find fresh squeezed lemon drops for $ BUCKS!  Yep, that is it, $5 BUCKS I will be back!
author: Lara F.

description: It's a nice place to grab a drink after work or with friends.The atmosphere is very serene, intimate and inviting. Great place to unwind.
author: Natalia P.

description: This is one of my regular hangouts after work.  Where can I get a delicious frozen drink with enough liquor in it for 3 dollars?  No where else and I can double the size for 5 dollars. The music is great and the bartenders are attentive and don't forget all that free salty popcorn.  Come early to avoid the crowd but stay late and see why San francisco is so diverse.
author: Yen T.

description: I don't get this place.  They spent a fortune to put chatskies on the walls.  Why did they put the fireplace in the middle of the room.  Way too many men, relative to women in there, for my level of comfort.
author: The P.

description: cute unique corner bar with a lot of style and a fun crowd. i came here with a friend of mine who is gay, so i expected it to be mostly men, but it wasnt. the crowd was mixed equally with both gay and straight people. its dark and cozy with a nice decor and good windows for people watching all the trannies across the street at Divas.
author: Michelle I.

description: From the outside, you may thing this place is more a "raise the roof" type of place. However, I was lured by the large open windows (I'm a sucker for natural light in bars).  It turns out to be a pretty chill place for an after-work drink with lots of dark wood furniture and quirky drink names.  The prices are also pretty good.  Definitely one of my favorite places on Polk street.
author: Suzanne A.

description: Lush can be fun, but lately, there is simply no breathing room in this narrow bar space.  The bartenders are solid and flirtatious, and though they look ambiguous, they swing straight.  If you are an utter nutter like me, you get lemon drops on the house and they remember you so that you can cash in on free drinks the next time.  Some call this place a "chick bar," but those guys are just mad jealous by the musculature on the bartenders.  True, they also are good at making so-called "chick drinks," like blueberry martinis, cosmos, strawberry daiquiris, etc.  But, come on, almost anything with blueberry--feminine or not--is tasty.  I have had the lemon drops, and delicate name, notwithstanding, those little suckers can pack a wallop.  They treat me well here, so I am a little bit torn on the rating, but the place just does not have the draw for me that it used to.  Moreover, it is not a dive, nor a lounge, nor super chill, nor especially anything.  Hence, it is, by definition, a stop during a pub crawl.  Strategically placed, too, since Polk and Post are peppered with pubs and taverns.
author: Dee C.

description: Lush Lounge was one of the first places I ever went to in SF. I still love it to this day. I guess you can say I'm a regular (anyone who can walk into a bar and be told "oh no here comes trouble" while they hastily make a drink for you is a regular). The bartenders are fabulous in every sense of the word. Last  time I went there on a crappy date (we're talking a HORRIBLE date but I do digress) one of the bartenders conspired with me and he sweetly asked said date to leave. As soon as tacky boy left I got a sympathy drink on the house. Love it! Another great story involves my friend Kat. She and I were there getting our drink on one busy Saturday night when she had to use the bathroom. She went and came running back out. She called to Rami (the bartender on duty) and explained there was no TP. He stopped what he was doing to dash downstairs and bring her a fresh roll apologizing for the inconvience. How do you not love it when your bartender cares? The bloody Mary is tomato juice with the produce aisle attached to it. Anything out of their little "black book" of drinks is usually reasonably priced and tasty! It's a place with no pretenses; you can usually have a bar buddy within a few minutes of coming in (even if you came by yourself) and have at least one satisfying conversation. People watching here is great! The movies and music playing are usually stuff you like anyway (and fun to zone out to). All in all if you find yourself near Post and Polk do go.
author: Veronica G.

description: Lush, Lushy, Lushes, 3 drinks in... Luscious... This is my neighborhood bar, but I am not giving it 5 stars for convenience or even the strong drinks.... Bartenders are not only extremely talented at mixing drinks, but incredibly friendly, professional, funny, and attentive- oh and tolerant. This is the only bar I order mixed drinks at, typically I'm a bourbon on the rocks kind of girl- however like I mentioned earlier they are that dang good. They are also great at maintaining a non-riffraffyrowdy bar. The only negative thing is that since they are so damn good, I find myself here on a nearly daily basis. BTW their happy hour starts earlier than any other bar on the block- 3PM! Steve the owner is a amazing host and adds a personal touch and has amazing taste in bartenders. Svetlana (butchered your name- sorry) works on Monday and Friday Happy Hours, and Tuesday, Saturday, and Sunday evenings is skilled, quick, makes delish delish concoctions and is quick & witty. Jack is the latest addition to the Lush family and recently declared the favorite aside from Svetlana works Happy Hours on Saturday, Sunday and evenings on Friday and Monday. He is an uber-amazing-mixologist. But honestly anytime you decide to go you will be served by a very attentive and professional staff.
author: Gracie A.

description: Prior to a late-night opening show of Sex and the City, I went with a group of 20-something girls to get cocktails SATC style at Lush Lounge. Located at the edge of the TL, LL provides a slight haven from the sketchiness that surrounds it. Small, dark, and extremely crowded, LL seems to be a happening spot filled with Marinaites and fresh out of college type kids. After reading yelp reviews, I had higher expectations for the drinks. Yes, the portions were enormous and decently priced, but quantity does not always equal quality. The selection was okay, pretty standard in my opinion but nothing very unique or exciting (not to mention the bartender was not particularly helpful or knowledgable about mixed drinks). I went for the most creative concoction on the menu, which turned out to be a ginormous margerita laced with cactus berry liqueur and garnished with blueberries, marachino cherries, and citrus wedges. The drink was served in a large rimmed sugar coated glass and was the object of everyone's attention for the first few minutes. As I struggled to make my way across the bar with my drink to catch my friends, about three girls stopped me and asked what kind of drink I had- apparently people were envious. Apparently no one was brave enough to venture out from their lemon drop bubble to sample something a bit more unique (seriously folks, how crazy is cactus flower syrup) as most people there seem to stick to the very basic cocktails. And the drink itself? Not bad, pretty sweet, pretty strong, but nothing to write home about with the exception that about a third of it made me pretty damn drunk and I had to give away the rest to my eager friends.
author: Kate A.

description: i've never had a dull night at lush.  maybe it's because it's where i often end nights after having 5 too many drinks...and then i start drinking martinis.  it always seems like a good idea at the time.  interesting people, positive vibe and a seedy neighborhood.  great to end a night of bar hopping from the hemlock to the castle...
author: Jessica W.

description: The best freaking blueberry martini in San Francisco.  No frills bar, but fun  overall.
author: Mark S.

description: i went to this bar for the second time the other night - had a blast!  luckily we got seats at the bar (rad) and we tried some of their special drinks.  great mojitos, and the special was a frozen watermelon cosmo... yum!  any drink that comes with a cherry is a friend of mine.  they were playing awesome music too - lots of oldies and songs that you know.  i will definitely go back!
author: Carolyn B.

description: I was never in the old Lush Lounge, but let me tell you...This place is sooo cool...not to sound cheesy, but it really is...I love the fireplace and the rustic look and feel along with the plants and rest of decor, this place is so inviting and as I mentioned in my review of CDR Construction (the ones who built this bar)....it has a a great , laid back, unpretentious vibe about it!!
author: J C.

description: Fun martinis for the sweet tooth.  Diverse and interesting crowd.  Great place to come with friends to catch up and make new friends.
author: Lisa L.

description: how can anyone not LOVE this place?  sorry to spoil it for you gay boys out there who just wish us breeder hipsters would just go away but this place is so much fun and we're not leaving!  it's a great mix of straight, gay, marina, mission, and everyone else in between all intermingling amidst the fruity signature cocktails and classic movies on the tv and cheesy music (was that phil collins i heard?).  i have never had a bad time here...perhaps it is because i've also downed a few too many of those $3 blueberry martinins?
author: Cyn B.

description: Lush lounge is a pretty cool spot.  The drinks are very fun.  The only thing I dont like is that it is always crowded because the drinks are so good.  Its a good spot on the weekdays weekends are a little too crowded unless your in the mood for that.
author: jennifer h.

description:
sometimes (ok most of the time) when i'm drunk and out with my boyfriend, i get other people's opinions on our latest fight/disagreement/relationship problem/etc. my boyfriend is not a fan of this. he hates it, actually... and usually gives me the stern "not right now" staredown. i usually cower in fright... but i was on a GOOD one when we reached the Lush Lounge the other night. subject of the night: how much my boyfriend hates the fact that i don't get home after closing the bar until 3, 4 or sometimes 5am... depending on the fact that i may go to some late night eatery to sober up. 
i was with my other bartenderess and we were getting hammered as usual. all of a sudden the big, burly, black, but oh so sweet, doorman pulled up a stool next to me. i engage him into my discussion about the boyfriend hating my late hours. his simple solution to the problem to my boyfriend??? "dude, all you gotta do is lie naked in bed when she comes home. problem solved." four stars for you, big man, four stars.
author: Erin D.

description: i would have done four stars but i could not take the decor, marilyn, audrey, cliche, be original.  awesome bartender and strong drinks.  my friend and i did a lemon drop shot and i asked for water as a chaser, the bartender said NO and gave me a lemon.  I LOVE HIM.  if i go back i'll just close my eyes.
author: kiki b.

description: Visiting San Francisco for the weekend and we just happened to walk by this place. It may have been the tangerine martini sign that drew us in, but the bartender's creativity, drinks, ambience and the friendly patrons is what truly kept us here. Will definitely come back.  Great drinks!!  Thank you, Sammy!!
author: Cheryll E.

description: Never had probs here simply because I am straight, as other reviewers have mentioned...? This is the bar I always end up at after racking my brain trying to think of a new bar to try...simply because I think it is good to try new places. Well, I guess with an old standby like the Lush Lounge I don't have to try the newest or hippest places. This place is kind of a throwback, a mish-mash of eras in one space and there is always 80s music playing. The cocktails are froofy and fun, so who cares if they are not super sophisticated? They always seem to have a drink special. Last time I was there there were Lemon Drops all night for $5. I like the Cactus Berry Margarita becasue they give you this big honkin fruit stick thing with it. Yum. The crowd is a mix, which I like, and is always pretty laid-back and friendly. BONUS: You can watch the 'ladies' working the street in front of Divas tranny club across Post. A goldmine of observation.
author: Jackie P.

description: "i'm kind of confused b/c i think i read online that this is supposed to be a gay bar. i totally didn't get that impression when i went though (it just seemed to have a good mix of all sorts of people). the bartender was incredibly nice and helpful (and cute too!), and i remember liking the music too (i was *very* drunk, though). moreover, they carry chimay white, and any place with chimay white has my instant approval. oh, the mojitos are fabulous too! it's also conveniently located right near hemlock and vertigo..."
author: Roshni R.

description: the location of my very first mojito, and my, was it delicious! really awesome. the place was kind of awkwardly small though.
author: Victor B.

description: uh-huh. yep. i like this place. i've come here to start a night, end a night, all night-you name it and i've done it and liked it. the drinks are superb. delicious. i can never decide what to have and with everything i try the first words out of my mouth are omg! this is my new favorite drink! it's really rather obnoxious. so...... good bar, delicious drinks, and killer people watching-the perfect mix for a good night.
author: Laura H.

description: Quite simply these are the best mixed drinks in town and at the best prices.  The martinis are simply to die for and come in over 1000 varieties (French is always a good one).  The bartenders are tons of fun and very friendly.  The decor is festive and unique.  It would be great if they served food (something to cushion all the booze instead of just popcorn).  For some reason you can never go into Lush Lounge for just a drink or two or three - somehow it always ends up being 7 or 8 or so.  They're the sorts of drinks that are super smooth and you don't really notice the alcohol...until it knocks you on your ass an hour or so later.  I would also love the bar more if there was more than one (unisex) bathroom.  It's a small bar with a decent crowd so it generally isn't good for more than 4 people although it's best for 2 people.  A great bar for dates.
author: Ginger K.

description: I went to Lush for my birthday this year, and had a blast. The crowd was very diverse, a nice change from the upper end of the Polk St. scene. I recommend going to Lush to get things started, then heading across the street to Hemlock, and maybe wandering your way to the Karaoke Bar.
author: Jenna F.

description: my favorite place for a cocktail! great atmosphere, old movies on the tube, frozen cosmo's, cute bartenders, creative drinks, elaborate mixology...need i continue?
author: Jennifer M.

description: the drinks are very tasty. and the place is very tiny. tons of stuff to look at on the walls. i dig it.
author: Sarah C.

description: so, sometimes there's a line outside Hemlock Tavern on the weekends. and since i don't love waiting in line, i usually end up over here. the service is quick, the drinks are relatively inexpensive, and the people are usually watchable, if not talkable.
author: Manlio L.

description: Love Love Love this place. It is really as good as it gets. The drinks are strong the atmosphere rocks and the bartenders are awesome!!! Chris, Jake, and Svetlana rock and the place is super cool-  I think I have a new crush!!!  great for the drinks after work or the shots on Saturday night!!! Please try this place!!! It will not let you down I promise!!!
author: kim k.

description: lush is definitely reccomended if you like sipping on frou frou drinks you're almost too embarassed to order while listening to feel good 80's music (bowie, talking heads rather than the obvious bar soundtrack of journey and lynard skynard). nearly every time i've come here, mommie dearest is on, which means lots of laughs over child abuse and too thick eyebrows. if john the bartender is working, you know you're in for a good time. last night three drunk trashy date rapist australian dudes staggered in and looked suspiciously close to vomiting. when the aforementioned super nice bartender suddenly turned serious and threated to kick their asses out, one of the paunchy three with his shirt unbuttoned to past his nipples declared loudly "australians don't hurl!" for the entire bar to hear then stumbled out. highly reccomended if you don't want to see people you know and want to meet people you don't want to know.
author: Sushi K.
